results.description:
"Arundel Bible Study & Coffee for Singles (and Everyone Else Too)" is a group that meets once a month for Bible study, coffee, discussion, music and fellowship. In the words of Paul: "Let the message of Christ dwell among you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom through psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit, singing to God with gratitude in your hearts." Colossians 3:16. We welcome singles of all ages - and everyone of all ages. We will read scripture, look at video discussions, sing hymns, discuss faith-affirming beyond-and-back stories, and occasionally meet out as a group for fun and fellowship. Please join us.  P.S. The background scene on this site is a beautiful picture of the Sea of Galilee from this site:  http://simplefollower.com/2012/02/27/

For social events, you may also check out "Annapolis Area Christian Singles Meetup" here: http://www.meetup.com/Annapolis-Area-Christian-Singles-Group/

Our Bible study is held once a month (roughly every 4th Sunday) and our social event is held once a month (roughly every 4th Saturday).  Check this site for upcoming dates and events.
results.name: Arundel Bible Study & Coffee for Singles

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in playing basketball for fun and exercise. All skill levels are welcome. We'll be playing indoor at one of Greenbelt's Gyms.
results.name: Greenbelt Pick-up Basketball

results.description:
Note about fees at the bottom! 

Let's meet up! Whether you're new to DC, have primarily guy friends or are looking to branch out, this is a group for women in their 20-somethings who are interested in exploring DC, grabbing drinks or meals or just hanging out. I started this group for all of the reasons above, but I also miss having great girlfriends during college and I'm hoping to make those kind of meaningful connections out here. Plus, I love meeting new people and think this is a great way to do so. Looking forward to meeting some awesome ladies and finding new favorite places!

Fees: We put fees in place to cover the meet up costs (They now charge us $90 twice a year to keep this group running...) and the times - although rarer and rarer - that we get stuck with the bill after a night out. Meet up also takes a cut of the annual dues you pay, so we only get a portion of THAT. I know, crazy. So thanks for understanding and joining the group! It's been wonderful and successful since day 1!
results.name: Mid 20-Something Females Around DC

results.description:
This is a group of women in our 30's who are looking for a little more in life. More adventure, friends, dinners, movies, working out, travel, or anything else. We will go to dinners in DC, NYC, and just around town. Comedy clubs, 5k runs, fun road trips, new experiences, book clubs, spa and pamper days, kickboxing, indoor rock climbing, sailing lessons and much much more. Only join this group if you want to make fabulous new friends and want to try new things to help yourself grow in this life.

 

Please note: If you do not have a photo of yourself in which you can be recognized at an event you will not be approved to join.  This is to protect all members that are in this meetup group.
Thank you for your understanding

 

Eighty percent of success is showing up. –Woody Allen

So come on ladies... this group will NOT benefit you if you don't show up.
results.name: FABULOUS LADIES IN OUR 30'S

results.description: For deaf and hard of hearing that communicate orally rather than via American Sign Language.

results.description: Let's get together for some outside adventures! We like to have easy hikes the whole family can enjoy. Events will be scheduled throughout the week, including daytime, evening, and weekend hikes in relatively close proximity to Baltimore City. Places like Stoney Run, Irvine Nature Center, Cromwell Valley Park can be explored with little ones. It will be a slower pace to let children explore plants, bugs, sounds and anything they might find interesting along the way!
results.name: Family Friendly Hikes and Adventures

results.description:
We like to ride. But sometimes we need a destination...somewhere interesting to go, where there will be interesting people to talk to. This group is NOT about organizing group rides, but rather to give riders a place to ride to. We'll pick times and places in the Baltimore/Washington area where riders can be sure there'll be a friendly face to chat about our bikes (or whatever), and maybe grab something to nibble and drink.

Some destinations may be interesting landmarks, some may be as mundane as a local Starbucks. We may stop at area motorcycle dealerships and perhaps some motorcycle events hosted by other groups. The point is to give riders a destination and purpose rather than just riding around.

Unlike other Meetups, joining Ride-In and Hang-Out doesn't commit you to a membership in a motorcycle club or riding group. Attending our Meetup events is as easy as showing up and saying "hi."

It's all about adding a social component to our rides and making them even more interesting. I have no doubt that new friendships will spring up, and you may even find a new riding buddy. But that's all up to you.
results.name: Maryland Motorcycle - Ride In and Hang Out Meetup

results.description:
Like to sing? The Baltimore Vocal Jazz Ensemble (BVJE), a unique "A Capella Pops" group singing 5-9 part harmonies, is inviting new members! Whether you are 18 or 80, there are openings for all voice parts from sopranos to basses. We rehearse on Thursday evenings at Oak Crest Village in Baltimore County, MD, but members come from throughout central MD, Pennsylvania, and DC. To learn more about us, hear us perform, or get directions , visit our website at www.bvje.net. Stop by any rehearsal to check us out and join the fun! Questions? Email Joe at joe.m@bvje.net.

Call

results.description:
Support • Connect • Empower • Make a Difference

As moms ourselves, we understand that life is about finding balance while nurturing our minds, bodies and spirits. "Our Village" was created with this aspiration in mind. Our Village is for moms who want to be healthy, happy role models for their children. You do not have to be a member of Stroller Strides to participate in Our Village. By becoming a member you will build a tight community of moms to share advice, tips and most importantly laughter.  Support and connect with other moms through:

Innovative and creative playgroups - fun for mom, fun for baby!

Entertaining moms' nights out - this is YOUR time.

"Moms with a Mission" activities - help better the community where you live and play.

Visit annapolis.fit4mom.com for more information about Fit4Mom programs.

There is no cost associated with becoming a member of Our Village and you do not have to be a member of Fit4Mom. All moms are welcome!!
results.name: Our Village - FIT4MOM Annapolis

results.description:
Do you love to read, participate in lively discussion about the books you read, and treat yourself to a good time? The Harford County ladies Book Club is for you! Our members range in age. We most often meet at local restaurants and other spots to talk about  our book of the month! We meet once a month to discuss the book. Books are chosen through polls. The group also participates in activities outside of the monthly meetings, including outings to movies (from books of course!), brunch book swaps, etc.

It should be noted that this group requires dues. A six month membership is $5 or you can pay $2 per event for three events then you become a member! This due fee is from July to January. Your dues allow us to keep the club going through Meetup, and also allows us to celebrate our yearly anniversary in style!

Things you can expect to do in the club

Book club on Sundays! (right now the first sunday of the month, unless its a holiday
Coffee & Conversations
trivia nights
Girls night out
events held at local book stores! span>
Movie nights
Dinners and wineries
and many more activities!

Our book list from Jan-June 2015

The silent sister

Dept. of speculation

Neverwhere

The girl on the train

My life in France by Julia Child

results.description: The goal of this group is to provide a safe space for people to express their passion, excitement, trials, disappointments, successes, difficulties, challenges and triumphs while trying to live a vegan lifestyle. The Veganism Support Group is a SAFE SPACE where everyone is invited to share their thoughts, opinions and questions in a non-judgmental, guilt-free environment. If you're curious about veganism and want to know more about the lifestyle, used to be vegan and have been thinking about transitioning back to veganism, are currently a vegan but are finding it to be a difficult lifestyle to maintain, or are fully integrated into the vegan lifestyle and are interested in providing support to others who may be struggling with veganism, this is the right group for you! Anyone interested in joining this group must understand one very important thing: This group is all about SUPPORT, COMPASSION, ENCOURAGEMENT and POSITIVE REINFORCEMENT. If this sounds like a place you would like to be, then welcome to the Veganism Support Group!!

The Amazon Web Services User Group (Baltimore) is a group dedicated to cloud services provided by Amazon. Because we are specific to Amazon Web Services (AWS), we can go deep into some of the technical services provided by AWS and get some really great insights into how their services work.

results.description:
This is our old meetup group- please use http://www.meetup.com/Xtreme-Hikers-Hiking-for-a-cure-of-Cystic-Fibrosis/


We are hiking for a good cause! Come join us, won't you?!

The Metro DC Chapter of the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation is proud to invite you to join us for the 1st Annual XTREME HIKE to Spruce Knob West Virginia. On September 21th we will summit the highest point in the Mid-Atlantic. The adventure includes a 2 night stay, pasta dinner, transportation to the trail head, hike lunch, post-hike bar-b-que, and celebration brunch.

In addition to the 30 mile hike win September we will be planning a number of training hikes that we would love for you to be on with us!
results.name: Hikers for Cystic Fibrosis

results.description:
Welcome to the Washington DC Agile User Group!

The mission of the Washington DC Agile User Group is to raise awareness, understanding and acceptance of agile practices, and support a community of local practitioners on their agile journey.

Our meetings present industry experts, opportunities for learning, networking, and provide an open forum for collaboration and knowledge sharing among local Agile practitioners on varied topics related to agile methodologies.

Meetings are held monthly and occur on the 2nd Wednesday evening of each month. The meeting location will be in Bethesda/Chevy Chase and be metro accessible.

Join us to learn from fellow Agilists about their agile experiences or share your own experience on adopting or implementing Agile. Contact the organizer if you want to present at a future meeting.


Session Agenda
6:30 pm - Sign-in, Refreshments & Networking
7:00 pm - Welcome and Introductions
7:10 pm - Presentation
8:00 pm - Q&A
8:15 pm - Announcements
8:25 pm - Wrap Up
results.name: Washington DC Agile User Group

This group is for Coaches, Counselors, Psychotherapists and those people who are interested in seeking knowledge and skill in these fields. The mission of the group is to set out on adventures in learning to enhance skills for achieving excellence both professionally and personally.
results.name: Hypnosis and NLP Adventures in Learning Metro Washington, DC

results.description: A social community centered around cooking and conversations, where friends and soon-to-be friends cook and talk together while enjoying tasty dishes. How it works. Bring the ingredients necessary for everyone to try a little bit of your dish, grill, extra knives & cutting boards (if you have them) and a bottle of wine per person. When you arrive 1) Check in 3) Pour yourself some wine 4) Start making your dish 5) Drink some more wine 6) Help your new friends 7) Bang on a pot when your dish is finished 8) Don't forgot....try some dishes, share your dish, and try not to start yourself on fire 9) Wrap up some food to take home 10) Everyone helps clean up This has been an incredible success, cultivating some of the best vibes we've felt in a while. We started at 18 people and pushed the chaos to 60, which somehow still works. Some dish ideas of what was made in the past; Vietnamese Summer Rolls, Gazpacho, Watermelon Basil Mint Feta Salad, Week-long marinated Pork, Portobello Mushroom Burgers, Curried Squash Soup, etc.
results.name: Chaos Cooking (Baltimore Chapter)

results.description:
Welcome to our group.  We gather for casual riding and socializing.  The focus of our group is simply to enjoy ourselves while riding our bicycles, and all levels of rider are welcome.  I plan to schedule a couple rides per week eventually, but for now I organize one ride every weekend.  Anyone is welcome to post a ride or make a suggestion for a ride as well; given that it is something relevant to this meetup group.

One of my goals for starting this meetup is to offer something that would be particularly beneficial to newer riders who may be intimidated by riding with others and I am always willing to share my own experienceand knowledge with beginners.  We will ride terrain that is relatively flat, mostly trail based(minimal traffic) and the rides will be no drop unless otherwise stated.

Thank you,

Todd
results.name: Takoma Park & Surrounding Areas Bicycle Riding Group

results.description: BOP is a wide-flung group of planners, gardeners, activists, city folk, county folk and plain old ordinary good folk who work together to grow fruit trees (in our yards, schools, neighborhoods, congregations), glean them (anywhere we can find them) and give the fruit away to those in need. And create bonds of neighborliness in the process.

results.description: This is a group dedicated to all things pizza, from its history, to cooking, to sampling some of the best pies in the local area and beyond. It is also a support group for those with a compulsion towards the greatest food ever tossed. Discussion of fast food and frozen pizza is allowed but not necessarily eaten. No, we are focused on pizza as art with the motto that if tastes good, it is good. An overriding obsession is to find a really good New York style pizza in the DC area while sampling all pizzas styles from Naples to New Haven.
results.name: Pizza Addicts Anonymous - D.O.C.

results.description: We love board games! We are located in Halethorpe, MD just outside of Baltimore. We hold events all around Baltimore, we play all kinds of board games; social games, cooperative games, strategy games, new and old games. We are a group of adult professionals looking for people with a like minded interest in all things board gaming. We are a free to play club, there will never be any fees or dues. We have beer, wine, coffee, drinks, snacks available for you to enjoy when we have events at the house.   So come join the fun, meet some new friends, have a glass of wine and relax, and get yourself out of the house!
results.name: Halethorpe Board Game Club

topics.name: Self-Empowerment for Business and Personal Growth

results.description:
• Are you looking for a group of likeminded women who have a passion to share their gifts with Howard County and surrounding communities through entrepreneurship?
  • Are you thinking about launching a new business idea?
  • Have you launched your business idea, but aren't sure about how to gain more exposure, reach your ideal clients or brand your message?
  • Are you frustrated that your business isn't looking as glamorous as you thought it would by now?
  • Do you want to gather with a group of women who are committed to supporting women entrepreneurs in helping to start, build and grow a sustainable business, while having fun doing it?

DIVAS (Daring, Innovative, Vibrant, Authentic, Savvy)Who Launch is for women who are looking to make new friends, create new collaborations and desire to be in an empowering environment to help bring their dreams to life.

The type of woman who would enjoy this group is a work at home mom, entrepreneur, small business owner, author, speaker, coach or a woman interested in starting a business.

We meet the last Wednesday of each month at a location in Howard County. Be sure to join the group to stay up to date on everything DIVAS Who Launch, where authentic connections, amazing collaborations and awesome women meet!
results.name: DIVAS Who Launch

results.description: This is a group dedicated to bringing geeky, nerdy, and super awesome people together to rejoice in our passions! I don't want to scare away non Whedon fans (if there is such a thing...), but my favorite fandoms are all from him so that's where I went with the tags. But I wouldn't limit events to that one area, we can diversify! There are a ton of amazing nerdy Meetup groups, but I was hoping to make some events closer to home in Columbia, rather than Baltimore or DC. Really, all of Howard County is accessible and nice. Some events I would hope to plan (and host) would be marathon nights of favorite TV shows, happy hours, casual gaming parties, etc. I am part of another group that has amazing events (like a weekly trivia night) that would be fun to combine with as well.
results.name: Columbia Geeks and Nerds with an Emphasis on Joss Whedon :)

results.description:
The purpose of the First Time Mommy Meetup is to provide an environment that is safe, encouraging, supportive, fun and even educational; and where meaningful and lasting relationships can be born (as well as babies!!). This group is for First-Time mothers - whether you have already had your little one or if you are counting down the days till your baby's arrival. This is a special time in our lives when relationships with other women are so helpful and important. Our boyfriends and hubbies, try as they may, can provide lots of desperately needed love and support, but when it comes down to it, women need women. If you are looking for friends to share this season (whether trying or being pregnant)...you should join! If you are looking for community and encouragement in your first-time mommy-hood...you should join! If you are looking for friends to be the Village that it takes to raise wonderful healthy well-adjusted kids....YOU SHOULD JOIN!!  Please include a brief bio about yourself, children names and ages, or expectant due date please. There is a $2 membership fee that must be paid within 30 days of joining.

PLEASE NO SOLICITING!!
results.name: Crofton First Time Moms

results.description:
The Home Recorders & Mixers Meetup is a workshop for musicians & artists that create at home and would like to improve their sound. The meetup provides an opportunity to learn, share techniques, and network. Once you join the Meetup feel free to check out our group on facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/HomeRecordersandMixersMeetup/
results.name: Home Recorders & Mixers

results.description:
Ever read C. S. Lewis or Tolkien and envied their bond in the Inklings? Wish you could have a beer with N. T. Wright, Brian McLaren, Charles Townes, or Francis Collins? Well...this group can't promise to reach those heights of intellectualism. But we can at least enjoy great conversation, share what we're reading, what we're learning and expand our minds by association, ALL while enjoying a good beer or coffee at one of Baltimore's many great hangouts. I hope we can read each others' work, share our latest epiphanies and recommend our favorite books. If you are a Christian writer, thinker, philosopher, talker or listener, consider joining the group. Maybe a blurb about myself will convince you one way or the other, if we can be friends!

I'm a Christian. The mysteries of how God's redemption, our faith and the human experience intertwine is a constant source of conversation for me.

I like to think that I'm a film/tv "connoisseur": The greatest tv shows of the last decade were Pushing Daisies and Firefly (though my brother will argue for Breaking Bad). The film I'm most looking forward to at the moment is Star Trek Into Darkness (I am an unabashed sci-fi fan).

I'm currently reading (among other things) "'Til We Have Faces", "Confessions of St. Augustine" and "1776". I am most inspired by allegorical storytelling. It's that experience you have when someone tells you a story, and their delivery was so good, that not until the very end did you realize they have changed your mind or altered your perception of something (like Inception!). My most recent experience of this was watching Zero Dark 30.

I like coffee and beer, so coffee houses or pubs just seemed like a good meeting place :)
results.name: Christian Thinkers, Philosophers & Writers of Baltimore

results.description:
We are birthing a new spiritual order, and a new spiritual community:  The Self-Realization Community, Where All Are Embraced in the Heart of the Divine.

The SRC harmoniously blends together four different religious traditions:  from Buddhism, the principle on serenity through non-attachment; from Vedanta Hinduism, the ideal of Self-Realization or Union with the Divine through Unconditional Love; from the Judeo-Christian tradition, loving God with one's whole self and loving one's neighbor as one's self; and finally, from Tantra, honoring both the Sacred Feminine as well as the Sacred Masculine in a celebration of Divine Presence and Consciousness throughout all life and the Universe.

Vision:

We are a universal community of consciously evolving beings who welcome others to join us on the path of Self-Realization through practicing spiritual disciplines, non-attachment to form, and the embodiment of unconditional Love for all life.

Mission:

To empower one another together on the path of Union with the Divine through choosing to be and to become the Presence of Divine Love, to live by the Light of Divine Wisdom, and to celebrate in the freedom of Divine Laughter.

Core Values:

Sacred Feminine as well as Sacred Masculine

Unconditional Love and Gratitude

Openness and Going with the Flow

Compassionate Kindness

Self-less Service and Generosity

Acceptance and Oneness

Empathy and Intuition

Divine Grace and Forgiveness

Nonnie Carol's role is to empower each one to discover and to give birth to the divine within.

Please bring cushions and a throw for sitting on the carpet, and a freewill love offering if you feel moved to support the gathering of the Circle. Sunday evenings at 7:00 pm in The Light Worker Training Institute's healing room.

For more information on Carol and her work, please go to:  http://lightworkertraining.com/Home_Page.html .

Please check out the Self Realization Therapy blog:  http://selfrealizationtherapy.wordpress.com/2013/11/18/lessons-from-discourse-1-of-the-i-am-discourses-of-saint-germain/ .
results.name: Self Realization Community of Greater Washington DC area

results.description:
SILhouette (Spiritually In-tuned Lesbians) is a spiritual community of women who love women desiring to discover, embrace and live as their spiritual- authentic self

The purpose is to support women in the life in learning how to be in relationship with themselves, discovering & embracing their passions and living according to the guidance of their spirit/ intuition- such that they are living life creating the loving and joyful experiences that they desire!

The SILhouette woman, through active participation*, will learn spiritual practices and tools to support her in being in a loving, committed relationship with herself.  As such, when she is in a loving, committed relationship with herself, everything about her exudes this love and personal commitment, hence the name...SILhouette... When your SILhouette exudes joy, peace, love, passion, just to name a few, then you attract to you people, places and experiences that exude the same!

If any of the following applies to you, this group is for you if:
*You are a lesbian, bi-sexual, queer or questioning woman desiring to grow spiritually
* You desire to discover, embrace and live as your authentic self
* You desire to be in balance in your spirituality, sexuality and sensuality
* You have a fear of being alone
* You desire to live following the spiritual/universal laws
* You are currently in a relationship and desire to maintain your autonomy while in relationship
* You are currently waiting on “the one” and desire to be prepared for a loving, co-committed relationship
*You have a challenge with remaining autonomous when in relationships, in other words, your partner becomes your world and you lose contact with your family, friends, etc.
*You are waiting for "the partner" to come before you will fully live your life
*You recently ended a relationship and lost yourself in that relationship
*You are co-dependent and/or attract to you co-dependent relationships and are ready to heal from codependency
*You have read this description and a part of you wants to cry or is triggered in some way (that is your spirit's way of notifying you, that this is for you)

**Attendance/Participation Policy **
SILhouette is a community. To support the energetic flow of this community, it is vital for those that join SILhouette to be active within the community in some way. For that reason, the following will warrant removal from SILhouette by the facilitator:

• Being a“NO SHOW” for three events. “NO SHOW” constitutes RSVP “YES” for an event, and not showing up. To avoid this, just change your RSVP status to “NO.”

AND/OR

• Failure to attend at least one (1) SILhouette meet-up in a nine-month period. (For example, you join SILhouette in January 2015; you must attend at least one (1) meet-up by October 31, 2015.)

* Please note: the tangible benefits you will receive from participation in this community are equal to how much you engage... much like exercising... if you work out 3-4 times a week, you are likely to release more weight than if you worked out once a week.  So beloved, participate as you please... in the end, you showing up when you can is all that matters!!

***SILhouette is facilitated by Spiritual Life Coach Maq Ele' you may read Coach Maq's bio on her profile!!***
results.name: SILhouette (Spiritually In-tuned Lesbians)

results.description:
Bonjour,

The Baltimore French Meetup Group is a great opportunity for individuals of different proficiencies in the French language to meet up, make friends and develop great relationships.

Members of the group range from beginners, intermediate, fluent, and native speakers of all ages. Through different activities the members have the chance to freely express themselves without the pressures of being in a classroom.

Our meetings are geared toward helping our members exchange and improve their skills and abilities in the French language.

3 EASY RULES:

#1 : All members must have a recognizable/appropriate (no shirtless pic, gents!) profile picture, and at least their real first name.

#2 : All members should be respectful of each other at ANYTIME.  Zero tolerance policy.  As a friendly reminder, any inappropriate behavior will be rewarded by an immediate removal and ban.

#3 : Be considerate if your plans change, and, please, update your RSVP to our events ASAP.  It simply helps the organizer to reserve the best table with the venue for that event.  Just be mindful not only of the relationship the organizer has with most of the managers of the places we go, but also of the time consumed organizing events, checking ahead places, etc.  When possible, we want to keep having some nice deals for our group as well :)

Be active, be involved! Your ideas are always welcome!

A Bientôt !

Philippe
results.name: Baltimore French Meetup

results.description:
-                                             Power Up!  The Small Business Network

Ever wonder how to get from zero to explosion in your business?  Maybe you are just starting a new venture or direct sales/network marketing business. Do you know how to reach the perfect client, customer or business partner? Do you know about entity structure, taxes, business or personal credit and how it effects your business? Do you have marketing and sales systems in place to grow your business?

Most small and mid-size business owners, entrepreneurs and direct sales consultants have no clue how to grow their business and let's face it, we all need help from time to time!

That's where we come in.  We are a collective group of business owners, entrepreneurs, consultants, authors and direct sales/network marketers who are 'extremely' serious about raising the bar for not just our business but for others as well.

We welcome those who possess a strong desire to succeed and are willing to invest in the success
of others.

We are here to provide the necessary resources, tools, experts and guidance needed to get you and your business to six-figures and beyond!

We are building a Network of 'highly' successful businesses. If you'd like your business to be part of our network, join us for our next event.

results.description:
The purpose of this singles group is to allow single white men (SWMs) and single black females (SBFs) to have the opportunity that they might not otherwise have to socialize together in a laid back, accepting and open setting. This group is inspired by the historical Loving's relationship that overcame the racial injustices of their time. Their marriage is an example of true loyalty, love, and perseverance.

The group will explore the local Howard County area, mostly, meeting-up at museums, Jazz venues, rock concerts, bars, clubs, restaurants, happy hours, volunteer opportunities, live sporting events, wine tours, and the like.  Socializing is a major aspect of the group, and the hope is that new friendships and social connections are forged.

We welcome all religions: Jewish, Catholic, Christians, Protestants, etc.

There are many other avenues to meet people of the same ethnicity; for that, we say—great, join that group. We love everyone! But, this group is for professional, sincere, and single white men and single black women open to meeting one another in a social environment.


In order to join, please show a recent picture of yourself (members want to  see  who you are!); honestly complete your profile and RSVP or cancel RSVP's in a timely manner. (You do not have to cancel a RSVP if you were never going to attend anyway). An annual membership to this group costs a nominal fee of $20 upon joining. Once your membership is paid, you are a member in good standing for a year, and you are welcome to attend the many events that we have lined up!

Looking forward to meeting you!

results.description:
"It's not that MS Excel is a soft skill, it's that people's MS Excel skills are soft. Excel is called Excel for a reason..."

-Steven Bugge

The benefit of being a member of this meetup group is improving one’s knowledge of MS Excel and learning how it can be leveraged at both work and home.

The Excel Refresher Meetup is here for beginning, intermediate and advanced users of Excel who would like to learn and share tips and tricks with fellow users. Maybe you are upgrading to Excel 2007 2010 2013, switching from PC to Mac or maybe your new to Excel all together. This is a great place to help get acquainted. Excel is an extremely dynamic and useful program and there are TONS of resources out there on the web for MS Excel, but sometimes it’s hard to see the forest through the trees. Simply having someone to talk to can make all the difference and that is the purpose of this meet up.

 

I was told once told by a manager that "MS Excel is a soft skill".  Those words did not sit well with me as I tried to digest that statement while thinking back to how it was my MS Excel skills that got me hired in the first place; at every company I had ever worked for...

This dichotomy eventually lead me to make the decision of working for myself as a data consultant, because what I came to realize was; it’s not that MS Excel is a soft skill, it's that people's MS Excel skills are soft.

Excel is misunderstood and therefore underutilized by many professionals. CEO’s, entrepreneurs,  med students, manufacturing analysts and venture capitalists (to name a few) have all reached out to me with Excel questions and are simply blown away by what they didn’t know they didn’t know. I believe that an informed community is a productive one.  When the US produces 60,000 engineers a year, and India and China produce 400,000 and 1.6 million respectively, we as a nation have a lot of catching up to do (no pressure!).

We have to begin somewhere, of course, and I think a communal collaboration of MS Excel knowledge amongst CEO’s, secretaries, professors, students, working and stay at home parents, along with everyone in between, is a damn good place to start!  (# S.T.E.M.)
results.name: Baltimore Microsoft Excel Refresher Meetup Group

results.description:
This meetup is for people in the Silver Spring area who enjoy being outdoors and want to participate in a variety of activities. We plan outdoor activities of short duration (2-5 hours) and within an hour of Silver Spring. Examples would be biking on the C&O Canal Trail, a walk along one of Montgomery County's many greenway trails or a potluck picnic in a park. We often walk on the stream valley trails that form a network in and around Silver Spring. Members are encouraged to suggest and organize events. It is not required but helpful if you can post a photo of yourself on your profile (even better if it is outdoors).

Some rules/guidelines:  Anyone over 18 can join. Children are welcome as a guest of a member as long as they are supervised and can keep up with the described activity. Dogs are welcome as long as they are friendly, leashed, you pick up after them and they are allowed in the area where we will be. If you have any questions about an event after reading the description, please e-mail the event organizer or post a comment.

You are a no show if you have signed up to attend an event (RSVP'd yes) and do not attend. If you change your RSVP at the last minute or e-mail me or the event organizer to say you're not coming that does not count as a no show. Even an explanation after the fact may mean your absence does not count as a no show. After three no shows I will remove you from the group and you will not be able to rejoin.

Dues for this meet-up in 2015 will be $5. Any member who hosts a meet-up event will automatically be exempt from dues for a year. If you join in the middle of the year I will prorate the dues. In 2014 I collected dues through the meet-up site. However, getting dues out of the we pay system proved to be a problem. In 2015 I will only be collecting dues in cash at events. This money is used to pay the cost of hosting the meet-up (approximately $140 per year) and if there are any remaining funds to purchase items like glow bracelets for night walks or paper goods for potluck events.

results.description:
The best way to learn about us is by checking out our website http://www.ColumbiaUnwound.com

We are a friendly and outgoing social group for those in and around the Columbia, Maryland area who are a bit more adventurous, those new to exploring new aspects of their sexuality, and those who feel they might fit into the Alternative Lifestyle category. This primarily means the BDSM, Poly, generally kinky lifestyles, we are LGBT friendly, and open, accepting, and welcoming to just about all other lifestyles. But most importantly, we are not a hookup group.

We host regular happy hours, munches, semi-private and private events to meet other like-minded people, make new friends and unwind in a safe, social atmosphere. We have been active on another site since mid-2012 with many members and recently chose to expand our group by joining MeetUp.com.

Events range from evening happy hours, afternoon lunch meet ups and weekend get together, movie nights, themed parties, to full dress and play events. In order to attend private parties and events, we need to get to know you at happy hours and munches. These often are not posted on MeetUp. While people have met and stated relationships, this is not a “hook up” group, please do not use it as such. Please make sure you abide by the rules below. If you have any question, feel free to contact us at Columbia.Unwound@gmail.com

Rule 1. Discretion is a must.

Rule 2. DISCRETION IS A MUST! Remember that you are in public and that each place will be different, so use your best judgement when conversing on lifestyle topics.

Rule 3. Respect - Respect must be given at all times within the group as well as in person.

Rule 4. Attire and behavior - Unless specified in an invitation street clothes are requested and vanilla behavior is expected! Again, each venue may be different so use your best judgement.

Rule 5. Have fun... and enjoy yourselves, safely!

Our organization is known as the Towson Junior Chamber (JC --> Jaycees) and is a member of the Maryland Jaycees, the U.S. Jaycees, and Junior Chamber International.

• Training Philosophy

You have to balance nutrition, cardio, and resistance training to get the right results. Meals have to be planned. Cardio must be established to match your goals. Weight training has to focus on a high intense workout. Do not substitute food if you don't have to.

  • Specialties

Weight loss, strength building, endurance, bodybuilding, powerlifting, figure, fitness, and sport specific training.

  • Certifications

Cooper personal Training, the others are military related. Close Combat Instructor/Mix Martial Arts. Swim Instructor/Coach, Track/Football/basketball Coach, Special Forces Scuba Diver. Pro Bodybuilder

  • Experience

I trained Marines for the last 23 years. I was a Deputy Director of a Marine Academy. I trained at La Fitness for one year. Training 13 people a day. I trained over 100 clients each day 4 days a week in our Marine Fitness Boot Camp from 2007 to 2010 in the Dallas Fortworth Texas area.

  • Availability by appointment only or during a boot camp session.

 

 

Let's get together so we can help you lose weight get healthy and make a lifestyle change. We have specialized training for bodybuilders, fitness, physic, and bikini competitors. Our goals is to help America get fit again. So we train the entire family. Bring your Grandparents and children. You will learn about nutrition, exercise and cardio. We will and can host seminars or workshops at your church, school, and business. Your health is the most valuable thing that you have. Make an investment that will last you a lifetime.

results.description:
Welcome to the Baltimore Software Craftsmanship User Group! This group is for software developers in the Baltimore,MD area that care about the quality of their work and want to practice and improve their programming skills, share what they know and learn new things from others. This is a hands-on coding user group with no presentations. Each meeting will be a dojo where we will go through a challenging software craftsmanship exercise that focuses on clean code, test-driven development, design patterns, and refactoring. We will pair up and practice on a kata in order to learn and apply the values, principles, and disciplines of software craftsmanship. Come with your laptop equipped with your favorite programming and automated unit testing environment. Be prepared to pair up, learn, share and have fun!

 

We thank Washington,DC Software Craftsmanship group for their help with starting up this group in Baltimore.
results.name: Baltimore Code Craftsmanship

topics.name: Family and friends of disabled individuals

results.description: This is a group to help bring together those with Gastroparesis, Ehlers-Danlos, Dysautonomia, and other illnesses associated.  Let's get together, talk about the realities of day to day living, and support one another through these debilitating illnesses.  Too many do not know about these illnesses.  Through Group Meets, we can discuss what we are going through, build support through one another, as well as add to data I have been putting together with a few other people to find common factors to help find cures.  We all hold a piece of this puzzle.  We know our bodies and what is going on inside more than the doctors do at this point.  Let's work together to educate others as well so people don't have to suffer for years before understanding why.
results.name: The Truth About Gastroparesis, Dysautonomia, Ehler

Plan on getting together for dinner/cocktails at various restaurants, having girls night out on the town, also low key wine wednesdays and movies. I would like to plan meetups for outdoor activities like community running events and hiking! Please feel free to suggest a meetup idea!

The Meetups feature an array of organized fitness classes, ranging from yoga and Sha’bam to Kettlebells and Boot camps. Every week we will check out a new class in the area. Members are encouraged to recommend classes!! The focus is on encouraging physical fitness for women of varying levels of interest in health and fitness.

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in learning more about, and experiencing biotechnology hands-on. BUGSS is a fairly well-equipped community biotech lab/lounge, located in Baltimore.  Let's get together to crack our brains wide open to what's possible when biology meets technology and mixes with a cool group of individuals thinking, discussing, and doing rad stuff. results.description:
Let's get together to have fun and enjoy delicious vegan food with like-minded people.  We'll also discuss some of the current topics and issues in whole-food plant-based nutrition.  "Whole-food plant-based" means we focus on plant foods in their natural, unprocessed state as much as possible because such foods are the healthiest one can find.   However, this does not exclude small additions of salt, healthy oils, and natural sweeteners.  Some people may also choose occasional use of more processed foods such as bread, pasta, bottled salad dressings and sauces, sweet snacks, pre-packaged foods, vegetarian meat substitutes, etc.  These foods are not essential for a healthy lifestyle, but they do make it more appealing, convenient and tasty.

This Meetup is for vegetarians, vegans, and people who want to be; for those looking to prevent or treat chronic diseases such as heart disease, cancer, diabetes, obesity, reflux, constipation, and many others. I'm a vegan Registered Dietitian interested in helping the community advance toward a menu that is not only healthy, but practical, convenient, inexpensive, invigorating and delicious! Each Meetup will focus on a particular topic, such as delicious ideas for beans and why beans are so important, how to use greens, simple effective weight loss without pills, powders or special foods, the proper role of salt in your foods, how to eat sweets without losing control, etc.

We may also explore the work of relevant authors, although this Meetup is not associated with any non-profit organization, author, publisher or food manufacturer.
results.name: Baltimore Whole Food Plant-Based Nutrition

topics.name: Support survivors of loss divorce illness & abuse
Group for younger widows/widowers to have support
Social Meeting for Widows and Widowers
Mature Singles Separated Divorced Widowed Over 45

results.description: We welcome widows and widowers of all ages. Our only membership requirement is that you have lost a life partner. We gather to socialize in a spirit of mutual support at 6 PM on the first Tuesday of every month at a bar or restaurant in Howard County.  Currently, we are meeting at Sonomas in the Owen Brown Village Center of Columbia.  Members sponsor other social activities such as pot luck dinners, movie/dinner dates, house parties, etc.

results.description:
About the Silver Spring Film Club - Movie Nightcap

Watching movies is fun. Exhaustive research we’ve conducted shows that watching movies with friends is 4.87% ABV times more fun. The best part about movies, however, is talking about them. Movies can be exciting, infuriating, thought provoking, or even solve global crises. 

Our group is for movie fans interested in checking out independent, classic, foreign, and vintage blockbuster movies, and at times discussing the movie afterword. Come join us! 


Why Silver Spring?

First of all, why not? Second, the AFI Silver Theater, located in downtown Silver Spring, is the best theater in the universe, ever, ever. They offer a great selection of the types of films mentioned above (and beer!). We check out a lot of movies at the AFI Silver Theater. 

Although we’re based in Silver Spring and are head-over-heels for the AFI, we are open to seeing films at the Regal Majestic 20 in Silver Spring, one of the independent theaters in DC, and even outdoor screenings during the warmer months. Just let us know what screenings you are interested in. We don’t discriminate. (Except against snakes. Snakes are not invited, and their opinions are unwelcome.

Come see a movie with us, and join us afterwards to chat about it. We may have some food or drinks and a heated yet friendly discussion after the movie.


How It Works

We have meetups at least twice a month, so check back often. Chances are, we will be seeing one of your favorite movies, or one you’ve always been meaning to see. Occasionally, we’ll see a movie that none of your friends would be willing to see. After you RSVP for the event, you can buy your tickets either online on the AFI  Silver's website, or at the AFI box office. Before the movie we gather as a group, at the AFI Cafe inside the lobby, so newcomers can meet everyone and old friends can chat.

RSVPing/No-Shows

A brief word about RSVPing for an event- If you RSVPed, and discover that you can't make it to the meetup…. No problem! 

But PLEASE change your RSVP to "no" so we as organizers are not waiting for you to show up to the theater. (The AFI staff is tired of seeing us crying and playing the Charlie Brown Theme in the lobby.)

If this becomes an issue repeat offenders may be removed from the group. (Also, it will go on your permanent record.)

And please don't show up to the meetup without RSVPing. We want to be able to find each other at the theater!  


About the Organizers

Pete, Nate, and Airrion are three regular gentlemen (we use this term loosely) who share a love of movies, beer, and good-natured trash talking. They have combined forces (undecided as of yet whether for good or evil) on a podcast called Movie Nightcap during which they talk about a movie they have just watched.  Their involvement in this group comes from their passion for the unique experience movies offer when people watch them together, have a beverage, and chat. These are the same reasons the podcast, Movie Nightcap, was created.  If you are interested in checking out the podcast you can find it on iTunes, Stitcher, and Poddirectory.


Ideas, Questions, Feedback

Please feel free to message any of the three organizers with your ideas, suggestions, and feedback. We are always happy to hear from you. As new group organizers, we are learning on the job. Thank you for your interest and your patience as this group develops. (But be gentle.)
results.name: Silver Spring Film Club – Movie Nightcap

results.description: This is a group for anyone who enjoys books and would like to meet other avid readers for discussion, food, drinks, and an overall good time. Our goal is to gather once a month over food/drinks at various locations around the Baltimore area to discuss our book choice. We want book lovers that enjoy a variety of book genres (fiction, non-fiction, classic, historical fiction, biography, etc.) and that will be an ACTIVE member of our group. We want to keep our size small enough so that real relationships can develop and great discussions can happen. So join us and....Get Your Book On!!!
results.name: Get Your Book On! (book club with food & drinks)

results.description:
Hello all Agilest in Baltimore. I have a registered group B'More Agile in MD on the Scrum Alliance website and many of the interested Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Developers have joined the group. I wanted to start the MeetUp group so that I can manage our monthly meeting well. Please register here to receive updates from me and other fellow Agilests on the current and future trends in the Agile world around Baltimore. Please do recommend this Meetup to all your friends and colleagues who are interested in Agile Software Development practices including but not limited to Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban, Lean, XP, etc. Scrum Masters, Product Owners, Agile Coaches, Developers, QA's, Tech writers, BA's... everyone is welcome to this group. Our focus is to meet monthly and discuss our every day experiences with fellow participants and be result oriented and solution providers to the business we work with.

Sincerely

Tejash Natali
results.name: B'More Agile in MD

results.description:
If you're looking for a friendly roleplaying group that's welcoming to anyone from complete novices to experienced roleplayers this is the group you're looking for.

Nearly every Friday night (sometimes Saturday or Sunday afternoon) this group will meet to play indie RPGs, which we're defining as anything that's not Dungeons & Dragons or Pathfinder. Most sessions will be open on a first RSVP first play basis. There will be a mix of continuing campaigns and one-shot adventures with the goal to keep mixing up genres and systems as we go forward. New players are welcome to join any session that is open to RSVP. Our approach gives you the freedom to pop into a session when real life allows and to focus on having a fun time. You need to bring nothing except enthusiasm. This group is wonderfully nice and supportive; this is tabletop roleplaying as it should be.

Since September 2013 we've played Always/Never/Now, Buffy the Vampire Slayer (Cinematic Unisystem), Call of Catthulu, Call of Cthulu, Cosmic Patrol, Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space, Dread, Dungeon World, Eclipse Phase, Fate, Fiasco, Ganakagok, Hillfolk, Icons, In Nomine, King Arthur Pendragon, Laundry Files, The Mountain Witch, Mouse Guard, Newsies & Bootblacks, Primeval, Rocket Age, Shab-al-HIri Roach, Star Trek (Last Unicorn Games), Star Wars (West End Games), Wicked Lies and Alibis, Witchcraft, and Yggdrasil. Our goal is to play at least 10 new RPGs every year.

My wife (Michelle) and I (Kirk) host these sessions at our house and will provide vegetarian meals and snacks. We have three types of meetups: 

Private Session: This is where a member of the group has wrangled 4+ other players for me (Kirk) to run a RPG, typically one I've already run for the group, at my house. I'm aiming to do 1-2 of these every month. 

RPG Gala: This involves up to 4 GMs running different RPGs for a maximum of 24 people. These will alternate between Friday, Saturday, and Sunday sessions. We always need volunteers to GM and these events are only possible when we have enough GMs to make it work. 

LARP: We're going to try once every four months to run a LARP with politics, intrigue, and mystery. This will be a sci-fi fantasy setting that specific enough to frame the scenario but vague enough for you to make your character your own. 

Good Enough Gaming: These are tutorials and help sessions for people wanting to learn how to GM or merely pick up some tricks on how to improve their game. 

If you have any questions or concerns don't hesitate to message me!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q) What will be provided at the session?
A) Some sessions will have snacks provided and some dinner, they will be labelled. Food will be vegetarian and usually there will be sodas and some snack food; hot water and an assortment of tea bags will always be provided. We also have plenty of pens, pencils, paper, notecards, and dice. 

Q) What should I bring?
A) A sense of fun and teamwork! No rules knowledge or prior experience is presumed. Contributions of snacks or sodas are always appreciated. Try to keep things PG-13 in tone when possible. 

Q) What should I not bring?
A) No alcohol or pets please.

Q) What's the parking situation?
A) Parking is available in the driveway and along the street. The best location if not in the driveway is alongside the curb of the nearby park between our house and Tamarack Road.
results.name: Colesville Indie RPG Group

results.description:
Married or in a long-term committed relationship, but missing the company of other like-minded couples for you and your partner to hang out with? Are your children grown and you are now wondering what you and your significant other are going to do with yourselves?  You've got your friends and your partner has his/hers, but maybe you don't have many friends in common who are also in a relationship? This is a group for married, engaged, or seriously committed couples (with or without kids) in the North Baltimore area ages 50+ wanting to meet other like-minded couples for fun activities.  Join us as we make new couple friends in this next chapter of our lives.  When you join this group, please be ready to commit to making your best effort to attend at least one meetup every few months.

IF ONE SPOUSE SENDS IN THE REQUEST, PLEASE INCLUDE THE OTHER SPOUSE'S OR SIGNIFICANT OTHER'S NAME AS WELL.   A COUPLE PICTURE IS RECOMMENDED.

results.description: Connect DC is a Wiccan based public ritual group that seeks to heal and transform the city of Washington DC through magic, mystery and celebration. Our rituals are always free and open to the public. We have been celebrating magic in public spaces since 1999. Our motto, “Stop, drop, and do ritual”, sums up our philosophy in seeking public and accessible areas to do magic. Connect DC creates ritual at boundary stones, in the parks, on city streets, behind the White House, next to the Anacostia River and within national demonstrations. Our goals are to heal our city with magic, mystery and celebration, and to create an expectation for public pagan ritual in the city proper. Announcements of upcoming rituals and other activities are distributed via the Connect DC announcement list. One can join the list by sending a message to ConnectDC-subscribe@yahoogroups.com Join us. Join in the magic.

results.description:
This is a group for Abraham-Hicks Teachings enthusiasts/leading-edge co-creators. My vision for this group is to get together and watch Abraham-Hicks workshop videos and discuss, also discuss the various books such as Ask and It is Given, The Vortex, etc. The purpose of the group is to have fun and to assist each other in allowing ourselves to be, do and have the things we choose for ourselves.

Meetings will generally be once a month.

You can find out more about the Abraham-Hicks teachings at their website. http://www.abraham-hicks.com

A Synopsis of Abraham-Hicks' Teachings

1. You Are a Physical Extension of That Which is Non-physical.

2. You Are Here in This Body Because You Chose to Be Here.

3. The Basis of Your Life is Freedom; the Purpose of Your Life is Joy.

4. You Are a Creator; You Create With Your Every Thought.

5. Anything That You Can Imagine is Yours to Be or Do or Have.

6. As You Are Choosing Your Thoughts, Your Emotions Are Guiding You.

7. The Universe Adores You for it Knows Your Broadest Intentions.

8. Relax into Your Natural Well-Being. All is Well. (Really It Is!)

9. You Are a Creator of Thoughtways on Your Unique Path of Joy.

10 . Actions to Be Taken and Possessions to Be Exchanged Are By-products of Your Focus on Joy.

11. You May Appropriately Depart Your Body Without Illness or Pain.

12. You Can Not Die; You Are Everlasting Life.
results.name: Baltimore Abraham-Hicks Meetup Group

results.description: Soccer is fun! It's even more fun when playing with people who understand the fundamentals like: passing, receiving, heading, shooting, juggling, and dribbling. The primary purpose of this group is to schedule open training sessions to work on basic skills and co-ed pickup games. House Rules: Sportsmanship is in effect. Fair, ethical, respectful play with a sense of fellowship with all players is required. No fouling, slide tackling or any gamesmanship tactics that could lead to injury. Infractions of this rule could lead to ejection from the game. Keep the game moving. Off-sides, out of bounds, hands, and unintentional fouls will only be called if clear and obvious or under rules of sportsmanship called by yourself. In these cases pass the ball quickly to the other team and keep playing. Corner kick will only be granted only if the defense intentionally kicks the ball over the goal line otherwise goal kick. The person who runs for the ball unchallenged gets to bring it in. There is no 11 meter. Keep in mind there are inexperienced, mature, and/or injured coed players on the field. No trophies or cash prizes will be handed out at the end of the night and next week the teams will be different. Have fun, be safe and respectful at all times. Otherwise FIFA rules are in effect.
results.name: Silver Springs Co-Ed Adult Soccer

results.description: This meetup group is open to all who are interested in learning more about hypnosis and the possibilities of positive change. We invite and encourage both those with a working knowledge of hypnosis, and those who are curious about what hypnosis is all about. In this group, we crave activities that are downright fun and merry, and we like to mix up the themes. We’re up for adventures like whitewater rafting and surfing, but we also go for slower paced activities like having afternoon tea in a quaint town or taking a brewery tour along a historic highway. results.description:
Psalm 19:1-4 The heavens declare the glory of God and the firmament shows His handiwork.

The purpose of this group is to meet and fellowship with other believers or those interested in Jesus Christ while celebrating Him in an active outdoor environment.  (Matthew 18:20 - For where two or three are gathered together in my name, I am there in the midst of them.)

We are Christians that have accepted Jesus as our Lord and Savior, and walk with Him in our daily lives. We also love His extraordinary natural creation. One of the greatest forms of worship is spending time enjoying all He has done. It can be difficult to meet Christians outside of our respective churches; this is a way to expand your group of Christian friends that enjoy doing the things we outdoors enthusiasts love, all while glorifying God!

All are welcome to join regardless of their background and religious affiliation. We respect each other and our differences, but maintain that the core belief of this group is based on the acceptance of Jesus Christ alone. If you are not a Christian, that is OK, just keep in mind you will be surrounded by them, and we love one another and will love you! :) This will be an environment where we can freely share the love and knowledge of Christ without judgment. It is also a place where others can learn of Christ and accept Him as their Lord and Savior, if they wish. In addition to our outdoors activities we can discuss the bible (a favorite topic), our faith, ask questions, share testimonies, understand and get to know our different backgrounds and strengthen each other in our walk with Christ and in our lives. The primary purpose of this group is to bring to believers in Christ together through doing things we enjoy, so talking about Jesus will be very likely and even encouraged.

We would love to have an active group, so if you are interested in leading an event in a particular area, please contact us, and we might reach out to some of you for help. Allow God to use you to expand his kingdom with your talents! Please keep the group in prayer as that will be the key to our success and plans God has for us and His glory.

Please check out our Pages to learn more about us!

What we believe and what it means to be a Christian

http://www.meetup.com/The-Christian-Outdoor...

Learn more about the Christian Outdoors Group

http://www.meetup.com/The-Christian-Outdoor...

Learn about why we pray at events

http://www.meetup.com/The-Christian-Outdoor...

Please become familiar with our RSVP Policy and small fee event charges

http://www.meetup.com/The-Christian-Outdoor...

Welcome to COG and see you on the trail!
results.name: The Christian Outdoors Group

On our meetup group, we post events that are happening in and around Creative Colony, like our happy hours, free coworking days, and the like. topics.name: Support Group for Panic & Anxiety Disorder

results.description: BALTIMORE SUPPORT GROUP for SOCIAL ANXIETIES. Shy, Introverts and Anxious people Welcome! Hi. I'm Rachel, started attending a support group in DC over 3yrs ago. I have social anxieties and I was becoming agoraphobia. I was self-isolating and avoiding human interactions. I've been facilitating the Support Group Meetings in DC for Social Anxieties for over 2yrs. I'm the organizer of " DC Social Anxiety Support Group Events" Meet Up. I live in Baltimore and I want to expand into this area. Typically we have 5-6people attending our weekly/biweekly. Wednesday meeting. We share our experiences living with and overcoming our anxieties. Baltimore meetings will be on Wednesdays at 7:30-8:30pm. We'll start with a Casual Conversation about Social Skills. (For example making eye contact, making phone calls, giving and receiving compliments, office parties.) We'll go around and say our Names and a Personal Triumph. (For example, I went on an interview, I attended a meet up.) Then we will have an Open Discussion. We can discuss different social situations, difficulties, and challenges. We will finish the meeting with Personal Goals. (For example Connect more with friends and family). Hopefully together we will find good Solutions, Ideas, and Advice. The purpose of this meeting, so you can go through the day in a calm and smoother way, with less anxieties. This group might not be the exact answer for you, But please consider attending at least of our meet ups. This is a great place to start! Once you get the momentum rolling you will surprise yourself! We also do different fun activities around the city. Please note this is peer support only NOT Professional help. This is for people with social anxieties only, if you want to bring a friend or family member as encouraging support that's fine. STUDENTS! If you are "required to attend a support group" for a College Course Credit, you're can call me to discuss you LEADING one of our meeting.(I mean guiding our the conversation with me shadowing you.) I we post a notice for that Wednesday, stating, we will be having a guest facilitator. You are NOT Allowed to just come to Observe Us. (Go to AA instead, because these people are too SHY! I have a hard enough time getting them to open up and talk about their issues, without you watching them!) Thank you for Respecting Our Shyness.
results.name: Social Solutions

topics.name: Trans/Gender Queer, queer and queer friendly peeps

results.description: For those of us who are tired of the bar scene, club life, etc., this group is for you. This group is for gay men who want to make lasting friends and foster true and honest friendships. We welcome you with open arms. We are respectful of your religious/political views, and want to create a safe space that is free of judgment. Possible activities could include hiking, going to dinner, or just meeting for coffee. Suggestions and questions are welcomed.

results.description:
All English Bulldog owners welcome!  We meet monthly at local dog parks in Montgomery or PG County but all "bullies" from any County/State are invited to join in the fun.  Members are ALWAYS encouraged to send suggestions for future events.

Similar to the English Bulldog's personality, this is a fairly laid-back group. There is no membership fee; however, if you want to make a small donation, we'll use it towards maintaining this website.  Meetup attendance varies based on the weather and folks' schedules.  Generally, the nicer the weather, more bullies come out and play!!

When we send a Meetup announcement, we will provide the date, time, and location, in addition to a map to the dog park. Also, at the park, we will have a welcome sign.

It's so exciting to see all the beautiful bulldogs together (see pictures from recent meet ups).

Please join us!

topics.name: Retirement: A Time for Life Expansion & Creativity

results.description:
Have you retired from your federal government job? Are you thinking about retiring from the federal government? This community will explore the many options and resources available to you. We are a holistic group: looking at health topics, employment options, consulting opportunities, social activities, and resources for retired and semi-retired baby boomers. This is your community and we are open to new ideas and suggestions. Our plan is to meet monthly for 2 hours and to share resources online. We are currently looking for a place to meet one week night per month inside or near the DC Beltway. Please join us and share your experience and resources with our community.

This group's mission is to serve the retired or retiring federal employee. Any member who directly solicits another member will be removed from our group. Also, currently we are calling our members "Transitioners" but are looking for a better name for our members. Your input is appreciated.
results.name: DC Life After Federal Retirement Community

results.description:
Ball play for adults? District Skee offers the ultimate opportunity to relive those glorious arcade memories but with the addition of adult beverages. Organized into teams, players send balls rolling up ramps aiming for high scores and the everlasting glory that accompanies them. Fear not amateur rollers, this is not to be outdone by the glory your team can achieve at the flip cup table.

Register and you'll receive a league t-shirt, eight weeks of skeeball fun, pregame and postgame drink specials, and more! Players will compete for a $250 donation to the charity of their choice. That’s not all. League players are invited to an end-of-season party featuring free beer! Become a true BALLER  and start building or sign up as a free agent today.

We're focused on making fashionable clothing that fits and learning new sewing techniques. We're trying to fill the niche for the intermediate sewist who's beyond the basics and wants to try more. If you have basic machine sewing skills and want to expand your talents, tackle new projects, and do it with a fun and a supportive community, join us today!

Be sure to join our Facebook Group where you can discuss your projects and ask questions.
results.name: Cut - Sew - Wear

results.description:
This is a group was created for anyone interested in learning more about digital photography from working professional photographers in and around the DMV area.

You know, the type photographers you always said "Jeez I wish I could tag along with you to learn more. If you ever need a hand, I'll work to learn." Well, I never like throwing people into the mix until we had a chance to discuss your level and goals. If I'm going to show you some things I want it to be for both our benefit.

So this group will cover things from equipment, to understanding the subject, to workflows, to prints while shooting what we love to shoot after learning all the rules. You have to learn them so we can break them to make it your own art.

The DMV Photography Workshops has a 1275-3200 sq. ft. studio home base in Baltimore City at SkyloftFRentalStudio.com.  Some of the workshops are also conducted by other groups and organizations, because we want to keep our members informed of some of the best workshops know matter where or who is conducting them. The goal is to learn more about what we love, any place. With that we also offer a 10% discount on Skyloft F Studio Rental time!

So if you are a professional photographer, and would like to conduct a workshop showcasing how you do something please let us know. And members, if you would like to see a particular workshop offered please let us no at anytime so we can grow as a resource.

All workshops are instructional and hands on training to help give you the complete "How & Why?"

If you have any questions, just drop us an email. You can also find us on FaceBook and our web site.

Thank you all!
results.name: The DMV Photography Workshops

results.description:
The group is for active Washingtonians in their late 30s, 40s, and early 50s who like to travel. Since we, as Gen X Washingtonians in our older/wiser age, tend to be more selective about where and how we travel, this group’s focus is on non-touristy, responsible travel (to local, domestic and international destinations).

Non-touristy just means high-quality trips to cool, distinctive destinations (e.g., Iceland) with lots of character, as opposed to the cheapest vacations to the same old touristy spots. Responsible simply means patronizing locally-owned hotels and restaurants so that we give back - the money you spend stays in the local community, which is not the case with most mass tourism that only works with the huge international chains.

Besides that as a guiding principle, we go wherever we want to go! Near and far, domestic and international, beach and city, mountains and lakes, adventure and relaxation, long weekends and weekend to weekends, and anywhere in between or longer! This is our travel club and it’s all about us! So if you like to travel to cool, fun places and are looking for like-minded, new friends to travel with, then this is the group for you!

How do we decide where to go? Easy… while I’ll offer some trips for consideration, we’ll chat about locales of interest here online, and at local meet-ups at different bars & restaurants in the city. Fantastic way to get to know each other and the oh so many neighborhood spots in DC. Always new places to check out & many neighborhoods to keep up with… so might as well check them out with new friends and do some travel planning at the same time! We also can do other types of quality, local DC outings (e.g., walks/hikes, volunteering) to keep in touch, continue our travel ideas, and build lasting friendships with our fellow city and metro neighbors.
results.name: Washington DC Gen X Travel Club (late 30s, 40s, early 50s)

results.description: This is a group for those interested in LAN Gaming. MLG has a LAN 3-4 times each year. ALL ages are welcome. We game with PCs mainly but also network Xboxes for LAN multiplayer games too. We encourage all interested to join our forums to get acquainted with MLG and its members.

results.description:
Every Wednesday from 5:30pm to 6:45pm, our group meets at Old Kernan Hospital (2200 Kernan Drive, now UMROI) Conference Center to share the ancient wisdom of mind-body exercise "Qigong", and its practical applications in stress management and self care.  Lead by Dr. Kevin Chen, an Associate Professor at the Center for Integrative Medicine, University of Maryland.  A certified instructor of medical Qigong, Dr. Chen is also a NIH-funded researcher and the associate editor-in-chief of college textbook “Chinese Medical Qigong.” (2010).  The contents of weekly gathering include Qigong warm-up, ancient wisdom of week, various ways gathering Qi. Eight Pieces of Brocade, Six-Syllable Formula (Six-Healing Sounds), Five-Animal Play, Five-element Palm, Simplified Tai Chi 24, Longevity Qigong, Happy Fisher (anti-depressing qigong), Integrative Meditation, Stress-management, Qigong for pain management, Lowering Blood-pressure meditation, Taiji Five-element medical qigong , and more…. New members are welcomed at any time, and the first section is free.

http://www.compmed.umm.edu/classes_qi.asp

results.description:
Got stress? Always tired? Feel like it’s an uphill battle to fulfill your responsibilities from the moment you wake up till the moment you go the sleep?  Looking for more than relaxation tips?

Well you’re not alone.  Welcome to Stress Busters of Baltimore!   We’re a new group dedicated to improving the quality of life for folks who struggle to find balance in this fast-paced post-modern world we live in now.  We choose to avoid a vicious cycle of pushing too hard, which leads to stress-related health issues, which, in turn, impedes progress toward those very goals that motivate us to work harder in the first place.

Once a month, we’ll discuss how nutrition, exercise, school/career, the environment, stressful events, seasonality, finances, personalities, perceptions, relationships, spirituality and other factors impact  our stress, overall health and ability to achieve our goals.  Reputable subject matter experts will present REAL solutions for dealing with chronic & acute stress.

We’re a welcoming and supportive group.  You won’t want miss this unique opportunity to finally address your stress head on!  You’ll leave feeling more motivated, more in control and confident that you’re on the best path to success!

Wishing you good health & success.
results.name: Stress Busters of Baltimore

Our Monthly General Meetings and Activities are open to any interested party wanting to find out more about CSC or just make some new friends! The club puts together between 9 to 11 North American and 1 to 2 European Ski weeks each season, plus several non-ski trips throughout the year. Come out and join us for our next event!  Check out our Website at www.columbiaskiclub.org!

results.description: Dating can be tricky, especially when the majority of your friends are married and you no longer have a "wingman". This is a group for women that provides a positive and supportive environment of peers who are braving the world of dating. Using the book by author Dr. Henry Cloud, “How to Get a Date Worth Keeping” as a guide, we will meet regularly to discuss the book and how to follow through on its principles as well as share our experiences and offer encouragement. The book is written by a contemporary Christian author, but the group is open to all, regardless of religious beliefs. We will also enjoy social outings that are conducive to meeting potential dates – after all, you’ll never meet anyone if you don’t put yourself out there. We are based in Baltimore City, but we will not limit ourselves to events in the Baltimore area. I hope you will join us!

results.description:
Bringing together people who love the outdoors and craft beer (and sometime wine, margaritas, etc.).

Are you a lover of the outdoors and between the ages of 29 and 40? Do you need new friends to get out and hike, camp, kayak, or snowboard? How about I add in craft beer and homebrewing? We're an eclectic group but we love to get out and enjoy what nature has to offer (from mountains to gardens to hops). Seriously, who doesn't love a nice brew on the top of a beautiful mountain? We also keep our events small to foster an intimate atmosphere where you can form real friendships. So come join in the adventure!

Please Note: We are about outdoors adventures first and beer second. Please do not join if you only want to come to pint nights or if you just want to get drunk. This group was started as a way to make friends who love the wilderness - love of craft beer is simply a bonus.

Past Meetups Have Included:

Hiking Old Rag

Kayaking the Patuxent Water Trail and the Shenandoah River

Dogfish Head Tour in Delaware

Brewgrass Festival in North Carolina

Pumpkin Beer Swap

The group's home base is Columbia, Maryland, but we will travel to Virginia, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, and beyond as time and events allow.

Our Guidelines
(please read before joining!)

1) If plans change, and you cannot make an event you RSVP'd ''Yes" to, please be considerate of the people attending, on the wait list, and/or hosting the event, and update your RSVP to "No" at least 24 hours prior to the event.

(This is the only time to RSVP as a "No" - if you are *changing* your RSVP. Please do not RSVP "No" in advance to every event listed on the entire calendar you already know you can't attend.)

2) If you do not show up to an event without giving 24 hours notice, you will be counted as a "No Show."

3) People who "No Show" 3 times, will be put on restriction and will not be able to RSVP or attend events for 3 months. The Event Organizers definitely understand that situations can come up at the last minute that you can't always control, which is why we give you 3.

4) "No shows" will eventually be removed from members account, based on your attendance at other events.

5) To cover the cost the organizers pay Meetup.com to run the group, we ask for members to contribute $2.75 in yearly dues. Please pay your dues within 3 weeks of joining (and then by Oct 1 each year after), or you will be removed from group events (especially those where paid members are on the wait list) until you pay. The link to pay is on the left side of the page.

You might also be able to arrange to buy me a beer at one of our events in exchange for dues. Just arrange this in advanced so you aren't removed from an event and so I don't have 5 people offering me a beer at one event. ;)

6) A clear picture of your face is required to join the group, so we can recognize you at events. No snow goggles, sunglasses, Halloween costumes - and no wilderness shots where you are too far away to recognize.

These policies have been put into place to encourage respectfulness and active participation in the group.

Thank you for your attention to these policies! :)
results.name: Maryland Outdoor Adventures and Craft Beer

results.description: This is a group for anyone interesting in paper crafts. If you have a passion for card making, scrapbooking tea and scones we would love to meet with you. Lets get together and create some fantastic memories!
