results.description:
We are a fun, laid back, social group that enjoys finding new places, experiencing new things and meeting new friends.  A sense of humor is a must!

Why we meet: To have good times and make friends while discovering new favorite places!

When we meet:  Any time there is something fun going on!  We try to have at least a happy hour each week, but we are open to all different activities.  Post your ideas and get involved in the group! 

Where we meet:  Usually we stick to locations in Anne Arundel County to keep it convenient for our members.  But we are not limited to the County - if something fun is going on elsewhere, we are always open to suggestions!

How we meet:  Fun and camaraderie are always first and foremost for our events.  We've all been the newbie in a situation and understand that can be uncomfortable for some people, so we strive to make everyone comfortable and feel welcome in our group!  Because of our commitment to this, it's important that all members have a recognizable picture and their first name on their member profile - we want to know who you are when you show up for our events!

Who should join:  We are adults from all corners of Anne Arundel County.  Typically, ages range from mid-30s to mid-50s.
results.name: Anne Arundel County Fun Social Group

results.description: Welcome to the Order of Eastern Stars of Maryland Meet-up. This is an informal gathering where we can meet and break bread in good company and where interested persons are welcomed to stop in and greet us on a common level. If you are looking to cultivate lasting friendships, better yourself and your community, do something for others, and have a great time in the process, we’d love to chat with you! We are an affiliate of the Masonic Lodge and one of largest fraternal organizations in the world. We are dedicated to Charity, Truth and Loving Kindness. We periodically open our doors to women who are interested in becoming members of the Order of the Eastern Star or Sisters of the Order who may be searching for a home. The Meet and Greet will serve as a forum to provide basic information, an opportunity to get acquainted and apply for membership. To my Masonic Brothers, if you know of any ladies that you would like to introduce to this fraternal journey, please feel free to invite them to attend the Meet and Greet. We look forward to meeting you!

results.description:
ABOUT US

Now Canada's largest tech meetups, and growing internationally, eh.

RSVP to get a nametag. This is important, because people without nametags aren't even really people. There, we said it. :) Check us out >>> Facebook | Twitter

HackerNest is an international nonprofit community movement focused on building supportive Silicon Valley like tech communities in every city - strengthening local tech ecosystems globally through unpretentious social events and hackathons. We’re nurturing cohesive communities today to empower them with more relevant and accessible peer-based tech education tomorrow.

Connecting people is awesome. And community good breeds fab karma.

We cram smart, accomplished people into a room with free beer. Our relaxed, down-to-earth Tech Socials are now Canada’s largest tech meetups.

Our membership - diverse and highly technical. Developers, designers, engineers, social media/business folk, entrepreneurs, investors, etc. regularly gather to socialize, talk tech, maybe hear speakers or watch demos, and meet future co-founders, employees, funders, and friends. Strict no-douchebag policy.

Global. We want an international network of HackerNest “splinter cells” to pop up everywhere – from underserved cities to high-growth innovation centers – to rescue nerds from isolated basements, offices, and code tunnel vision.

We love hardcore nerdcore. Tech folks, tech events, tech love. Our formula: laid back atmosphere + free drinks + brilliant people = fireworks

We're not scienticians, but the formula seems to work: we became Canada's largest tech meetups in a year, before even leaving Toronto. Today we have "splinter cells" in multiple cities internationally.

Our goal is to complement and strengthen existing nerd ecosystems – we come in peace. This isn't a business; nobody owns HackerNest. Conceptually, it is the ideal of a strong and supportive tech community - pretty much anyone that isn't a jerk can be a part of it.

Interested in running HackerNest in your city? Take a look at the FAQ.

---->---

Whoa, longest descriptions evaaar. Need more? Here's some answers. Don't forget to check us out >>> Facebook | Twitter

---->---

Here's more pictures of our Tech Socials and hackathons:

********

When: Pretty darned regularly. Check back!

Format: Relaxed. Hang, talk tech, occasionally a speaker, plot to take over the world, etc.

Where: Usually in the large private office of a tech company (have a venue?)

 

At any given HackerNest meetup, you may find people who are:

developing incredibly snazzy Ruby (most likely on Rails) applications - heady hardcore designer typesPHP/Perl/.NET/Python/django addicts - ...Fortran devs?! - looking for a tech/entrepreneur/new business story to cover - Objective-C experts and iPhone/iPad/Apple product pundits - engineers and managers and CTOs looking for co-founders to join their angel/VC-backed tech startup - looking to write articles/stories about the obscure/interesting/hilarious hacks you've pulled off - totally oblivious and just wandered in because they heard there was booze (!?) - building a top-secret app out of their basement that's going to change the way the world does X; like "Facebook for Squirrels" - scrambling to find a partner to work with on a well-paying contract that's just a wee bit too much workload for the anticipated deadline - heroes, because they're part of the burgeoning community that will reverse all this insane brain-drain - incredibly talented, smart, entrepreneurial go-getters who are absolutely dangerous to the status quo - pretty bloody interesting, because seriously, if they're coming out for drinks ON A MONDAY (or Tuesday, or Wednesday) NIGHT... they've gotta be

 

Chances are, you'll fit right in if you're a(n):

software or hardware hacker/h4ck3r (or maybe just a hack)

coder/developer/programmer/brogrammerdesigner, UX-oriented, or just like making things pretty

biotech/electrical/computer or basically any kind of engineer

network/network/system/IT administrator

front/back-end specialist

angel investor

demon investor

venture capitalist

venture communist

tech enthusiast

tech/entrepreneur-oriented media/journalist

OCD blogger/Tweeter

bloodthirsty recruiter looking to poach developers

internet mogul

nerd/geek/freak/tweak

entrepreneur

SEO/SEM pro

writer/project manager/business analyst

1337 individual

etc., etc.

...and aren't a douchebag. <3

results.description:
In the second half of 2013, the crafty nonprofit/thrift store SCRAP DC moved to its current Brookland location, and a few months later, began hosting this Meetup. They wanted to provide a place where you, our members, could assemble, chat, and maybe trade some tips while working on artistic works-in-progress. It sure didn't hurt to have an eclectic assortment of art supplies right outside the workroom, where you could make some quick purchases before a session if needed. However, as "scrap" took over several tenants' studios and then the storage closet, that back room became THE place for volunteers to do their work of sorting and pricing new donations.

Enter our hostess -- now Meetup co-organizer -- Marcelle! After pipes burst and flooded our usual venue, she rescued our March session with just one day's notice, and... wow -- kept finding room for the many who showed up last Tuesday night! We look forward to more of the same, with some potential alternate nights offered, perhaps with a little more frequency during these warmer months. We absolutely hope that you'll still visit SCRAP for art and office supplies when they're open (Wed.-Sun. noon-6). Now that we know our move won't be so temporary, tho', we'll change the default venue to Marcelle's studio, #15 on the Arts Walk (between 7th and 8th along Monroe Street NE). We hereby rename the group, too. You're all now members of "Get Craftin' in DC."

If you like making things by hand, please join us! All skills and skill levels welcome: whether you knit, sew, crochet, origami, scrapbook, embroider, quilt, mend clothes, make jewelry or anything else, I hope you will find a new home in this group.
results.name: Get Craftin' in DC

results.description:
Sa Kap Fet Mes Amis! I don’t know about you, but it has been very hard for me to meet fellow Haitians in Baltimore. The Haitian experience in Maryland is very different in comparison to that in New Jersey, New York, Florida and/or Boston. 

From the outside looking in, the Haitian community in Baltimore, in my opinion, is downright invisible! I know I can go to Park Heights for yummy Jamaican and/or Trinidadian foods or travel to Randallstown for a little “international” grocery shoppin; but where can I go to buy a bottle of Kremas, piece of pain patate, or bottle of l’huile maskriti? Where can I go to sit down and eat lambi, legume avec sous poi, or diri a djon djon? Clueless! 

When I came across the Meet Up site, it hit me- WHY NOT CREATE A GROUP JUST SO YOU CAN MEET AND SOCIALIZE W/FELLOW HAITIANS LIVING IN BALTIMORE? 

My vision for this group is to create opportunities to bring Haitians and/or Haitian-Americans together. By no means is this a dating site! If you are seeking to establish a connection with people of Haitian descent while exploring all of the cultural experiences Baltimore and the surrounding cities have to offer, then by all means, welcome!
results.name: CHARM CITY HAITIANS

results.description:
Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy. Develop it.

It can be intimidating for women to learn and ask questions when they are in an extreme minority. While open and welcoming, today's budding developer community is up to 91% male. There isn't a comfortable place where women can learn at their own pace and not be afraid to ask "stupid questions."

We decided it was time to provide a place where all questions are OK and everyone can learn in a supportive environment. Our courses focus on coding, leveraging existing technology, and having something to show for it (aka building sweet websites).

Thank you for supporting Girl Develop It on our mission to make software development easy, affordable and accessible to all women. Your contribution helps us expand our mission to create great programs and opportunities for women learning to code.

Interested in helping as a teacher, teacher assistant, sponsor or in another way? Please reach out to us via our Interest Form or contact us directly at baltimore@girldevelopit.com!

Note: While we focus our mission and messaging to women, we're women inclusive, not women only. Men are encouraged to join us as teachers, teacher assistants, sponsors, etc.

results.description:
My name is Steve Smith.  I live in Columbia, MD, work as an accountant, and am fifty-one years old.  I've been a vegetarian since 1980.  I consider myself a life-long student of spirituality and meditation, and study with H.H. Sant Rajinder Singh Ji Maharaj, an internationally renowned author, meditation teacher, and spiritual leader.  For more information about Sant Rajinder Singh and the tradition of Sant Mat, www.sos.org.   

About Our Group:

The theme of the group will be meditation in the Sant Mat tradition (customarily translated as The Path of the Masters).  I hope to create a space where everyone feels welcome and we enjoy our time together.  Thank you to other meetup group coordinators of Baltimore Vegetarian Group, Columbia Insight Meditation Group, and ZenAdventures for letting their members know about us. 

I plan to start and end the group with short, 10-15 minutes meditation sittings.   Most of the time at Oakland Manor will be a chance to learn more about the teachings with opportunities to ask questions or share with one another as well.

After our meetings, we will have opportunites to get together for dinner or other activities which may be suggested.  Love and fellowship are our cornerstones, yet we seek to first nurture ourselves by going within via meditation. 

Meetings will generally be held 2nd and 4th Sundays at Hebron House in Ellicott City, Maryland.

PLEASE READ OUR MEETUP PAGE REGULARLY FOR OUR LATEST ANNOUNCEMENTS

 

A Personal Testimony: 

In early 1980, I first found out about yoga when an English Professor handed me a book.  I had already been exposed to meditation techniques at home, because my mother and two brothers had practiced alternative methods.  I yearned for more in my life, and I wasn't sure where to find it.  The theory of yoga and how everything is within us struck a chord.  I started to "OM" on my bed in my dormitory room.   Naturally, when my folks found out about my search, though they were open-minded, they were also concerned.  In truth, so was I.  This was years before the internet, and I struggled to gather information about what my spiritual options were.  I attended Bible studies on campus, and I also enjoyed reading about Buddhist meditation practices. 

After the spring semester, I returned to my folks' home, and my mother handed me a California publication called "Common Ground".   I leafed through about 30 pages and came across an interesting ad:  "Are you really seeking God?  Do you expect to find Him in massages and whirlpools?"  Then there was a quote by Darshan Singh about the cry of the soul.  I was amused and intrigued. I wrote to California (snail mail - no email in those days) and in return, I received a few handouts and the phone number of someone in Columbia, Maryland who coordinated the local satsang (spiritual meeting).  I attended my first satsang, and my life's never been the same since.

I respect other meditation paths, and I enjoy sitting in with other groups.  Many people nowadays benefit from various meditation practices.  To say that all meditation paths are the same is a different story.  Not all fitness programs are the same, not all diets offer the same results, and not all academic institutions offer the same quality of education -- Why should we imagine that all spiritual paths or meditation practices aim towards the same goal or are equal in their ability to conduce towards spiritual awakening and empowerment? 

Sant Mat still appeals to me as offering the most comprehensive and hopeful message and the highest possible goal.  I've discovered what many others before me have learned:  Spiritual development involves many paradoxes.  In order to make "quick" progress, we need to learn how to become "still".  If we are in a "hurry" to experience inner peace and fulfillment, we need to development "patience". 

I'd never trade my good fortune in being led to this path for anything else.  It's always felt like a great blessing to be led to a caring, competent spiritual Guide, and the price I've had to pay is commitment and opening my heart.  Spirituality is a gift like any other gift of nature.  In the Sant Mat tradition, programs are offered for free.  In a country like the States, we need to put our suspicions on hold for a few moments and allow this simple thought to sink in.  It's not easy to discover ourselves.  Many of us arrive at the doorstep of direct spirituality and mysticism after a long and painful journey. When we connect with the love that's already within us, healing naturally occurs. 

I've shared a little of my story, because I wanted to highlight how this is a personal experience for each one of us, and there's hope. 

Best Wishes to everyone on your own spiritual journeys.

Steve

results.description: As a pain sufferer, I know (firsthand) that pain can significantly impact our personal lives as well as the lives of the people around us; so much so that  I often think of it as another dramatization of the "Butterfly Effect".  There has to be something better than daily doses of NSAIDs, addictive drugs (opioids) being dispensed through massive prescription writing by physicians.  America is about 5% of the world population yet we consume over 80% of the world's pain pills!  I feel that it is time we embrace the amazing possibility that the body can restore itself to its natural pain threshold to help increase our quality of motion.  Quality of Motion = Quality of LIFE!
results.name: Pain Free Living ... NATURALLY!

results.description:
Calling all neighbors/locals in their 20s/30s! It'd be nice to have a group to go to brunch, happy hours, movies, yoga classes, comedy shows, museums, and more with people that live in Van Ness, Tenleytown, and Cleveland Park. The events don't need to be limited to this area, but I'm hoping this will be a great way to always have a low key brunch buddy or someone to try new things with.

Membership:  Be in your 20s/30s and be local (think Bethesda to Dupont).

Pictures:  Please make your picture a picture of your face so we can find you.

Comments: Please do not spam us with comments for each event. If you have questions, you can ask, but please note that we all use Google Maps (or other apps) to find the event location and navigate there. I typically have not been to the location beforehand.

No Shows: Please be considerate when you RSVP to an event. If you no show without letting the group know you can't make it, you'll be removed.

Events: Feel free to suggest events! If you can host it/organize it, I expect that I've met you at least once before so I know you'll show up and help make people feel welcome.

Have fun and come back often!  :)

results.description:
Forget business as "usual". This club is for real estate investors who want more out of a club than just passing out business cards with the hope that they connect with the right person or service.

This is NOT a lead generation club or one of those business development-type networking meet-ups where you give a 1-2 minute sales pitch of your business followed by a lecture with training material for sale or back of the room products to promote. So if you are a Multi-level marketer, biz dev type, account rep or sales person, this club will not be a great fit for you.

This club is about meeting people who can help you build a real estate business. Some members will have money to invest and some will have projects looking for investors. In this club, you will be able to create or join an investment group with other members. The purpose of investments groups is for like-minded members to freely share their investment ideals and offer advice on how to evaluate real estate deals for the best possible cash flow, profit margin and/or return on investment (ROI).

Our club aims to develop new ideas and solutions to the ever changing marketplace and then put them into practice for buying and selling real estate. We focus a lot on all types of deal structuring on land, single family, multi-family, rehabs and other property types. We promote the ideal of partnerships to acquire assets when buying alone is not an available option.

Our club meets weekly for regular meetings and once a month for our Open Forum. Members are encouraged to present topics and solutions to the group during our Open Forums and discuss current real estate issues and offer suggestions and advice to other real estate investors seeking assistance. We invite industry professionals to speak at our open forums and we promote a simple motto “one must create a mutually beneficial relationship with others in the industry to grow and expand”.

This club is not always about business. We occasionally meet socially for fun networking activities to foster deeper connections with one another. We support the ideal of the payment of dues to enhance our standing in the community by contributing our time and money and industry insight to charitable organizations.

We invite you to watch our video at http://youtu.be/I86DdhRdtYU

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I86DdhRdtYU

Feel free to visit us at http://www.jointventureptnr.com/
results.name: The Real Estate Joint Venture Partnership Group

results.description:
Maryland IANDS NDE Discussion Group is a friends group of the International Association for Near-Death Studies. IANDS is the leading-edge group for the study of NDEs, founded in 1978 by Dr. Raymond Moody, author of "Life After Life," and others. The MD IANDS group meets monthly to discuss Near-Death Experiences, other spiritually transformative experiences (STEs), the integration of such experiences, and the information and lessons learned from those experiences about God, life, and humanity. Support is available for anyone who has had an NDE and is trying to integrate the experience.

Meeting format varies from month to month and can include presentations by those who have experienced NDEs; movies, documentaries, TV shows, or videos of presentations from the IANDS conferences; or general open discussion and sharing among the group. Recent meetings have included a presentation and workshop by Mary Grace, author of "The Communion of Saints; Talking to God and Grandma."

All are welcome, whether you have had an NDE or STE, if you have suffered the loss of a loved one, or are merely interested in learning more, discussing these topics, and meeting like-minded kindred spirits!
results.name: MD IANDS - Near-Death Experience (NDE) Discussion Group

results.description: Writers writing, not just talking about writing. This is a group of committed writers who really just want to sit down and put pen to paper or fingers to keyboard and produce for two to three hours at a time but who would like some company while doing so. We'll meet once a week at at a cafe, a diner, a bookstore, or some other place of inspiration with electrical outlets for laptops.
results.name: Shut Up and Write in Towson

results.description:
What is the “Insider’s Circle?”

They are regular folks who dreamt for many years about getting involved in real estate, but didn’t know where to start or who to trust. 

They are individuals who decided to take the first step and, guided by a seasoned real estate investor with over 30 years of experience, Don Miller, Jr, got their first deals done!

They are individuals who meet weekly to share their insider’s secrets as they progress toward their real estate goals.  

If you are ready to take the first step, you’ve come to the perfect place, the “Insider’s Circle,” sponsored by Club REIA.

But, don’t just take our word for it.  Listen to some of our real "Insiders" who are getting deals done!

•  Kim Fisher

•  Mike Ramsey

•  Travon Taylor

•  Al Barnes
results.name: Baltimore Real Estate “Insiders Circle”

topics.name: Slammers: People Who Like To Perform Their Poetry

results.description:
PerVerse is about great poetry well presented. We showcase singular and inspiring poets from all poetry communities. And you too! So grab your writing or your music and join hosts Julie Fisher and David Drager every 2nd Thursday for Baltimore's most twisted poetry event. 

Every 2nd Thursday - 2 featured poets plus Open Mic
results.name: PerVerse: Baltimore Poetry Performance & Open Mic

results.description: This group addresses a need for the civil design community to develop a network of users that are able to help the civil disciplines embrace the changes that are rapidly coming. Some of these changes are hardware based, such as computer platform upgrades, laser scanning, and machine control. Others are software platform driven, such as moving from legacy applications like Land Desktop to Civil 3D; or from one application, to a suite of applications. Third, there is also the largely reserved approach to cloud computing, merged with security concerns and fear of system failure
results.name: Mid Atlantic Infrastructure Forum

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in effortless meditation, breathing, pranayama techniques, spiritual knowledge etc. All skill levels are welcome. Members of this group will be meeting regularly for free group guided meditations and breathing excercises. There may also be short Yoga sessions conducted from time to time. Folks in the Baltimore area wanting to be a part of a community of meditators are expected to benefit a lot from this. The overall idea of forming this group is to form a community of meditators who can do group meditations regularly and help each other become better Baltimorians!
results.name: I Meditate Baltimore Group Meditators

results.description: We are a Washington, DC Mandarin language meet-up for busy beginning and intermediate language students to practice for short times on a weekly basis. We meet at restaurants or bars once a week during the evenings for an hour to practice. The meetings will focus on language learning only as there are other meet up groups for culture, etc that meet less frequently.

topics.name: Overview of Office 365 features and functionalites

results.description: The Central Maryland Association of .NET Professionals (CMAP) Office 365 Technologies Group is a CMAP Special Interest group focused on exploring and using the features and functionality of Office 365 Cloud Based Services. The group meets once a month on the third Thursday to discuss various topics on Office 365.
results.name: CMAP Office 365 Cloud Technologies Group

topics.name: Make New Friends, from all Walks of Life

results.description:
The Rotary Club of Historic Prince George's County (formerly the Rotary Club of Bladensburg) was founded in 1959. The Rotary Club is a local club of Rotary International, a worldwide organization of business people who have been dedicated to service projects for over a century, fostering goodwill and world peace through helping communities in need. The Rotary motto is "Service Above Self." Our club's signature project is Disaster Aid USA. The mission of Disaster Aid USA is to provide immediate disaster relief and humanitarian aid both domestic (in the USA) and international (worldwide) to victims suffering the effects of a disaster. Disaster Aid USA utilizes the 4 Way Test and guiding principles of Rotary, and adheres to the United Nations and Sphere Standards while providing disaster relief and humanitarian aid. The club performs a number of community service projects including: Margaret Brent Fun Day, where we provide games, pony rides, clowns, pizza, etc to students with special needs and their staff; and food baskets for families in need; we sponsor six high school students to attend the Rotary Youth Leadership Awards (RYLA) conference; dictionaries for 3rd grade students; Christmas Stockings for children of incarcerated inmates at the Prince George's County Detention Center; weekend snack program for elementary school students; and backpacks for elementary school students. In addition, we support international programs, such as Rotary's End Polio Now project, and a water project in Kyotera, Raiki District, Uganda. 

In addition to these service projects, we also enjoy fellowship with club members, family, and friends. The Rotary Club of Historic Prince George's County meets every Wednesday, at 6:15PM, at the Comfort Inn and Conference Center, 4500 Crain Hwy., Bowie, MD 20716 .
results.name: Rotary Club of Historic Prince George's County

results.description: Train in more affordable small groups in a controlled private studio without joining a gym lead by IFBB figure and Bikini pro Janet Lynn West and named Muscle Insiders Top 100 ripped bodies in the world while reversing the signs of aging and building a network of support w new active friends. Whether your a beginner in weight training or more experienced groups will be broken down by level . Using free weights, machines, medicine balls and bosu lets get in shape and feel younger and more fit!
results.name: Weight training and core conditioning training in EC

results.description:
This is a Meetup for the Open Source Cloud Computing community. It's a chance for developers, professionals, researchers, and enthusiasts in the Baltimore, MD area to meet, learn, present, and strengthen Open Source community ties.

A multitude of Open Source Cloud Computing tops will be covered, including IaaS and PaaS frameworks, Open Source SaaS solutions, Big Data, distributed storage, commodity hardware, Open Source development frameworks and languages, and more.

Like all good Open Source meetups, craft beers will be plentiful. So join us for a presentation and a pint, and let's learn about Open Source in the Cloud.

(The "open circle" logo is trademarked by the Open Source Initiative, and is modified and used by the Open Source Cloud Meetup under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.5 Generic license.)
results.name: Open Source Cloud

results.description: Do you make games while no one is looking (or maybe even when they are looking)? Are you an artist, designer, developer or all around maker looking to connect with other game makers? We are here to help by fostering the independent games community in the DMV area. We organize play-testing nights, speed dating-styled talent connections, lectures and networking. We won’t support the indie spirit in the heart of the nation’s capital. Meetings and events are held at metro-accessible locations. We supply the event, you supply the energy. Come and out play, design, develop and make great indie games.

results.description:
This group is for photographers that enjoy using an iPhone, or other mobile camera phone as their primary camera to express an artistic vision.  We'll gather to use the camera that’s always with us, and go beyond taking the simple snapshot to creating a photograph that’s an artistic expression unique to your vision.


• Why meet: Share techniques for iPhone image capture and the use of different apps to capture, edit and display your artistic expression

• Who is this for: All iPhone  or mobile phone photographers

• What will you need: iPhone, iPad or other mobile camera-phone

results.description:
This is a group for anyone who is seeking a greater understanding of our human journey, our relationship with ourselves, with other humans and all life. Founded to provide an affirming environment for individuals who are committed to an inter-spiritual approach to spirituality, encompassing all faiths and all traditions,  who wish to express their spirituality without dogma. We are not about religion, but we are about spiritual truths and recognizing we are ONE.

Our teachings are shared by: Wayne Dyer, Oprah Winfrey, Louise Hay, Dr. Michael Beckwith, Eckhart Tolle and many more. You can visit our website: http://www.centercl.org for more info.
results.name: The Spiritual Life

results.description: The more people who practice the Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT or Tapping) the more we can grow. Let's tap together to increase the energy of personal transformation, create the lives we dream of and help heal the planet. This energy psychology technique is one of the fastest and easiest ways to clear blocks to progress and happiness. Come even if you are a newbie. It's easy and fun to tap together.
results.name: Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT) to Unleash Your Potential

results.description:
Every month we'll read a book about the environment, then meet to discuss it in a though-provoking and fun-inducing way. The Blue Water Baltimore Book Club will be a great way to share your passion for the natural world - whatever that is - with friends, old and new.

Not every book will be directly about water, but we'll cover a broad range of topics that impact Baltimore's watersheds: pollution, water use, land use, native plants, and more.

Most books will be nonfiction, but fictional books are definitely NOT off-limits.
results.name: Blue Water Baltimore Environmental Book Club

results.description: Napoleon Hill, in his seminal book "Think and Grow Rich", asserted that no great professional success is possible without a Mastermind Group. A Mastermind Group is a small number of high-performing professionals and business owners, not necessarily in the same industry, who get together on a regular basis to discuss and brainstorm around challenges and opportunities. At each meeting, a different member brings up the challenges and opportunities he or she is facing. The individual and collective expertise and experience of the other members are then brought to the table. We hammer out creative solutions, and the brainstorming gives rise to insights not only for the current meeting's member, but for all present. DC Mastermind is a newly-formed such group and is seeking a small pool of suitable members based in Washington D.C.
results.name: DC Mastermind

results.description: Feeling a little uncultured lately? Looking for some refinement in your life but don't have a big budget? Or maybe you just love to attend cultural events but don't have anyone that will go with you? This group will take advantage of all the amazing cultural activities available in Annapolis and the wider DC/Baltimore area. We will attend live theater events, art exhibits, foreign and independent films, classical and contemporary musical performances, wine and food pairings and any other cultural events of interest. Our goal is to enjoy all these things for under $40 by attending matinees, getting group rates, getting less expensive memberships or season tickets, booking early and other means. Many excellent events are free!  Join Us!
results.name: Annapolis Culture Club

results.description: We are a grassroots organization consisting of women from all walks of life who are working together to promote conservative principles and make our communities better places in which to live. Participating in our Club is not only an educational experience, but you will really get to know our candidates and politicians. Whether it is through monthly meetings, our political forums, presentations, and field trips, you will surely become a “high information voter.”
results.name: Severna Park Republican Women's Club

results.description:
Tired of going to art galleries by yourself? Or maybe you wish to see that Italian film that speaks something to you but you don't speak enough Italian to join the people in the Italian meetup group that is watching it?

Perhaps you are too busy with a workshop or preparing for your next exhibit and you don't have time to find out about current art events in town?

Perhaps you are just interested in becoming more creative and wish to bring more art to your life.

If any of this sounds familiar to you, feel free to join us and welcome to DC Arts, Events & Languages meetup group!
results.name: DC Arts, Events & Languages

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in Latin, Flamenco & Spanish Dance! Learn about classes, workshops, and performances in your area!
results.name: Baltimore Latin, Flamenco & Spanish Dance Meetup

results.description:
Are you a single or married woman, a mother of young, teen, adult, or even spiritual children who wants to experience more of an abundant way of life? If you said, "Yes" to any of the descriptions above...then this is the group for you. We are faithful, like-minded Christians who are passionate about our identity in Christ, and about empowering women spiritually, mentally, socially, physically, educationally and financially. We also share money-making, saving, and budgeting ideas and strategies. Food, Fellowship, and Fun are important to us as well! Join Christian Women Succeed (CWS) today and enjoy being the mother, sister, friend, leader, and Woman God has called you to be.

We are blessed to connect with successful women from around the county who are mothers, wives, corporate executives, educators, writers, authors, ministers, entrepreneurs etc. We laugh together, pray together, cry together and do business together. Most importantly, we witness the Lord move mightily in each of our lives through answered prayer.

If you want to develop friendships and business partnerships with like-minded sisters in Christ...then Christian Women Succeed is the perfect group for you! We have a lot of events planned, and would like you to be a part of something truly special.

Please pray before you join to make sure this is the right group for you. We are looking for women who truly believe God has called them to join. In order to get the most out of CWS, You need to get involved on some level whether it’s attending the events or helping to suggest or plan activities. Your gifts and talents are welcomed and nurtured here!!!

Abundant Blessings,

Minister Sasha E. Lindsey
results.name: Christian Women Succeed

results.description: The Families of Color (FOC) Meetup Group was originally created in Hudson County, New Jersey. DC, MD, VA Families of Color is the sister meetup to the NJ FOC. DMV FOC seeks to serve as a social connection for families by bringing moms, dads, and children of color together to socialize and take advantage of all the DMV area has to offer.  From Museums and the zoo to great restaurants, there is so much for us to experience with our families. Feel free to RSVP and/or offer to host we are always looking for hosts and activities. We look forward to meeting your family!
results.name: DC, MD, VA Families of Color

results.description:
Embodied Awakening/Embracing Vulnerability exists for people who want to embody their essential nature by exploring the power of vulnerability and honesty.  It is for those who are tired of taking refuge in their beliefs and are serious about discovering the deepest intimacy with life that only comes from slowing way down and becoming deeply honest with oneself.  

Similarly, this group is designed for people who see relationship as a vehicle for awakening.  

This group focuses on the profound impact vulnerability has in our lives.  We consider the defining moments of any relationship: when we shield our hearts away from or open fully in the midst of the difficult moments that arise in everyday life. 

When relationship is used as a spiritual practice, it will act as a furnace that stokes the fire that burns within. It will support your awakening, flushing everything out that's not true - all of the conditioned beliefs and defense strategies - and inviting the deepest part of you to come forth in this world. 

Chris and Jennifer Rubacky are the teachers of this group.  They have been in a conscious partnership for over a decade and married since 2005.  They have devoted themselves to using their relationship as a crucible for embodying their essential nature in all aspects of their lives.        

We begin with a silent meditation each week.  All questions are welcome and everyone will have time to share.  

Suggested Donation: $20 dollars ($5-$20 dollars suggested sliding scale; no one turned away for lack of funds).  

If you would like to learn more please see Jennifer's website: www.iammet.com

<a href="http://www.iammet.com"></a>
results.name: Embodied Awakening/Embracing Vulnerability (Baltimore)

results.description: We are a group that celebrates the LGBT community by embracing our place at God's banquet table and engaging with open and affirming Christians.  We are seeking those that want to positively converse about sexuality and scripture.  We look forward to authentic individuals who desire to be in relationship with one another as we discuss our differences. We are a fun and loving people seeking the same. Our goal is to equip all to live from a place of wholeness. Grow in our lives as Christians while living authentically,  seeking to build relationships with those in the faith community.

A number of wildlife refuges are within a two-hour drive from Annapolis and offer stunning nature and wildlife views. results.description:
This group is intended for single professional women looking to date successfully and build relationships leading to long term commitment. We’ll explore the dynamics of being a single woman, attracting a mate, dating a mate, and creating the committed partnerships of our dreams.  The focus will be on being a single woman and making choices in the dating and relationship arena that allow you to elevate your feminine power, attract “the one,” or deepen your relationship with the “potential one.”  

“I do not wish [women] to have power over men; but over themselves.” ~Mary Wollstonecraft

results.description: I believe in surrounding myself with people that are like me - highly motivated, ambitious and driven to own a successful business. This Meetup group has a goal to offer a place for female entrepreneurs to empower one another and share their lessons learned. We will try and meet once a month to chat over coffee or a cocktail and share ideas and inspire one another. If you decide to join this group, please provide a quick highlight of your type of business, where you are located and what you hope to get out of this group.

results.description:
Does this describe you:

*You are an intrepid bicyclist

*You think you might want to be an intrepid bicyclist

*You are a woman between 12 and 120

*You have a bike

*You don't have a bike...we'll help you find one at moderate cost

*You enjoy the outdoors and want to spend more time outside with friends

*Members supporting each others best performance is good for the group

results.description: Baltimore transit employees interested in motorcycle riding for one or more day(s) bike rides. No meetings, no dues, no colors. Just motorcycle riders interested in fellow-shipping with fellow transit workers....

results.description: This group is geared toward building authentic Christian community amongst young adults ages 18-35 in Anne Arundel and Prince Georges County. This will be accomplished through weekly meet ups on Monday nights for fellowship and small groups as well as weekend events.
results.name: Anne Arundel/Prince George Young Adult Christian Community

results.description: Chesapeake Harmony Chorus is a women's singing group based in the greater Annapolis, MD area. We sing four-part a capella harmony in the barbershop style. Chesapeake Harmony is a chapter of Sweet Adelines International. If you are looking for an outlet for your vocal talent, ladies night out, friendship and camaraderie, we hope that you will come for a visit. We meet every Wednesday evening at 7:30pm at Historic Baldwin Hall in Millersville, MD. Our members come from all walks of life and throughout Anne Arundel County and beyond: Annapolis, Severna Park, Millersville, Crofton, Edgewater, Arnold, Severn, Crownsville, Gambrills, and Pasadena. We are always looking for singers. Sing with us for the evening and discover this wonderful hobby. No experience is necessary - just a love of singing.
results.name: Chesapeake Harmony Chorus Women a capella barbershop singers

results.description:
A Beacon is a small, wireless bluetooth device. When placed in a physical space, it broadcasts tiny radio signals to smart devices. Think about it as a very small lighthouse. Smartphones that are in range are able to 'hear' these signals and estimate their location very precisely, as well as communicate with the beacon to exchange data and information.  Beacon's are bluetooth-based, specifically Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) and are able to operate for a long time with very little power.

This group is intended to find developers in the Beacon community and to build new and innovative solutions with this exciting new technology.
results.name: DC Beacons

results.description:
This group is for those who want to enjoy Bermuda. I'm familiar with the island and know how to put together an economical, fun, local styled trip.

If you dream of island fun with new friends please click the "Join us!" button below to apply for membership. A tech issue erased our small membership base and we need new members!

Wishing you beautiful views, smiles, mild sunburns, and cold rum cocktails at sunset.
results.name: Bermuda Hoppers

results.description:
This Meetup is for business professionals looking to learn about technology in a non-sales environment. We host quarterly 2-hour breakfast seminars where knowledgeable technicians present on various IT solutions to support the goals of business organizations.

Each seminar will start with 30-minutes of eating and mingling time prior to the presentation. A delicious, hot breakfast is always provided.

These seminars are hosted by DP Solutions, an IT Services Provider located in Columbia, MD.

*Please note, this group is not to be confused with the TechBreakfast group*

DP Solutions Tech Trends Breakfast Code of Conduct

DP Solutions’ Tech Trends Breakfasts are intended for the sole purpose of allowing attendees to learn and gather educational information about technology trends for their organization.

While we do have time set aside for networking at each event, this is a sales-free environment and we do not condone attendees attempting to solicit or sell their products and/or services to other attendees.  

Attending with the purpose of promoting yourself or business will result in immediate removal from the event.

If you’d like to explore partnership opportunities with DP Solutions, please send an email to marketing@dpsolutions.com and we will be happy to discuss this with you outside of DP Solutions’ Tech Trends Breakfast forum.
results.name: DP Solutions' Tech Trends Breakfasts

results.description:
This group started in 2014 with the mission to read all of Jane Austen's books in a year. We had a fabulous time and didn't want to quit. So we picked a new author! In 2015 we will be reading Elizabeth Gaskell's novels. The group meets approximately once every two months at a metro-accessible cafe on Sundays in the mid-afternoon.

Because the group's aim is to read an author's oeuvre, we will be closed to new members after May, but, if we decide to stick together and pick a new author for 2016, will re-open for a time early that year. 

Participants are asked to help shoulder the cost to the organizer of running the group through MeetUp's website. 

March read: Mary Barton

May read: Cranford

July read: Ruth

September read: North & South

November read: Sylvia's Lovers

January 2016 read: Wives & Daughters
results.name: Elizabeth Gaskell Book Discussion

topics.name: Downhill Skiing, XC Skiing, Snowshoe, Snowboarding
cross country skiing snowshoing and ice skating

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in cross country or nordic skiing. We will ski in the Baltimore area when there is snow and maybe go out for a drink when there isn't. We will share our favorite locations to ski and plan ski trips for those who want to travel. If you don't know how to cross country ski we will help you get started!
results.name: Baltimore Cross Country Skiing

results.description:
This group is for active Baltimore Gen X'ers in their late 30s, 40s, and early 50s who like to travel. Since we, as Gen X'ers, in our older/wiser age, tend to be more selective about where and how we travel, this group’s focus is on non-touristy, responsible travel (to local, domestic and international destinations).

Non-touristy just means high-quality trips to cool, distinctive destinations (e.g., Iceland) with lots of character, as opposed to the cheapest vacations to the same old touristy spots. Responsible simply means patronizing locally-owned hotels and restaurants so that we give back - the money you spend stays in the local community, which is not the case with most mass tourism that only works with the huge international chains.

Besides that as a guiding principle, we go wherever we want to go! Near and far, domestic and international, beach and city, mountains and lakes, adventure and relaxation, long weekends and weekend to weekends, and anywhere in between or longer! This is our travel club and it’s all about us! So if you like to travel to cool, fun places and are looking for like-minded, new friends to travel with, then this is the group for you!

How do we decide where to go? Easy… while I’ll offer some trips for consideration, we’ll chat about locales of interest that you have... here online, and at local meet-ups at different bars & restaurants in the city. Fantastic way to get to know each other and the oh so many neighborhood spots in Baltimore. Always new places to check out & many neighborhoods to keep up with… so might as well check them out with new friends and do some travel planning at the same time! We also can do other types of quality, local Baltimore outings (e.g., walks/hikes, volunteering) to keep in touch, continue our travel ideas, and build lasting friendships with our fellow city and metro neighbors.

[Note: This group is the Baltimore-based, sister meetup group of the Washington DC Gen X Travel Club.]
results.name: Baltimore Gen X Travel Club (late 30s, 40s, early 50s)

results.description: Do you sing in your car or in the shower? OR maybe you have sang in a band or regularly go out and sing in general. Glen Burnie has a lot of fantastic and fun places to go to belt your favorite tunes out! I know most of these KJ's (karaoke dj's) and they really know how to put on a great show! We will be going out during the week and on weekends to sing our hearts out and meet new people. Let's bring our SING!!!!
results.name: Glen Burnie Karaoke and Drinks Meet Up

results.description:
Calling all serious-minded and mature lady djs 21 and older of all ethnicities, whether you are a hobbyist, or a full time dj with skills (beat matching, scratching, production, etc) or None ! Let’s get together to encourage, motivate, teach, and inspire one another. If you are curious or interested in djing…this is the place for you; if you want to dust off and remove the cobwebs from your equipment and ignite the passion inside you or simply promote your next event…this is the place for you; Lastly, should you lack self confidence and always doubting your abilities than this is the place for you. Seriously ladies let us truly get together and support one another, network, enjoy music, and more importantly just have fun in the process. One of my goals is for us to continue meeting with other members who are interested in wanting to practice together, teach, learn, share ideas/skills , and offer great criticism. My other goal (along with so much more) is to throw random listening parties which will allow member djs to participate in 30-45 minute sets rotation style. Ladies, please keep in mind this meet up group is intended to promote unity, mentorship, peace, and love; However, if you are someone with a big ego who enjoys humiliating or tearing down an individual or individuals based on their skills or lack of then this is not the place for you. I am into the uplifting business so ladies if you are with me, please join me into this sisterhood.

Please Note: To all interested in the practice sessions, if you have equipment (laptop w/ dj software or vinyl, turntables, cdjs, midi controllers, mixer, studio monitors, etc) you would like to practice with please feel free to bring whatever you are comfortable with.  If you do not have equipment, show up anyway, I am willing to share mine with anyone interested.  Eventually, my ultimate goal is to have in- house equipment available to members for their convenience for personal use or for gigs.

Dues (Not sure yet) Dues will be used for purchasing in-house equipment, space rental fee, field trips, planning events, etc.
results.name: DMV Lady DJs United

results.description: Let's get together to enjoy Montgomery County (sometimes metro DC), have parties, watch movies, go out to dinner, etc.   This group is for couples only!!  Monogamous LGBT couples who want to socialize as friends are welcome here!
results.name: LGBT Monogamous Couples of Montgomery County friendship

results.description: Why join the Holistic Parents Meetup Group of Lutherville-Timonium?  Consider joining us if you value and strive to live a more holistic and natural lifestyle and want to meet and socialize with like minded families.  What are some holistic values that may make you a good fit for this group?  Maybe you choose to eat a more healthful and natural diet and try to prepare more meals for yourself and your family that have less chemicals, additives, and artificial ingredients.  Maybe staying fit and being physically active is a priority for you and your family.  Although you may still utilize our traditional healthcare system, maybe you've explored more natural approaches to health and healing for yourself and family.  Maybe you have concerns about the side effects of traditional medicine and vaccines and have explored or considered alternative therapies.  If some or many of the ideas I've shared above ring true with you, and you'd like to meet and socialize with like minded individuals, I invite you and your family to join us for a meetup!  We aim to have events for the whole family (we have two young children ages 15 months and 3.5 years) as well as events for just the parents.  We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Holistic Parents Meetup Group of Lutherville-Timonium

results.description:
A group for people to get together for social gatherings such as game nights, bowling nights, group events, or pretty much anything else that would be fun in groups.

I look forward to meeting you all!


Is there anything I need to sign? I know some clubs have liability forms and such.
Please re-read meetup.com’s terms of service, especially section 6. You agreed to it in order to use this site. You may not have read it, but you had to check the box that said you did. In general, section 6 says if an organizer or any member places a event on the calendar and you get injured or something at it, it’s your own fault. If you can’t live with that, this group isn't for you.

Who runs this group?
This meetup group is not an organization.  It is a group of people who like to get together and socialize. There is no one in charge. If someone starts telling you what to do and you don’t agree with it, don’t do it. Use your own common sense and leave the event if you think it is too risky or you feel uncomfortable.

So who is this Chris, who is the organizer? Isn't he in charge?
Chris runs the web site. He can post calendar entries and moderate the message board, as can  any other organizers. (Moderate means if someone puts something up that is inappropriate, he can delete it.)

What are the rules?
If you want a group that has rules, you don’t want this group. Ok, well just a few basic ones.  1. Be safe, and 2. Be courteous towards others.  3. Use a recent photo of yourself so people can recognize you when you attend any events.  That means if someone does something you think is unsafe, don’t do it with them. If that doesn't work for you, tell them about your concerns directly or whoever organized the event that you are uncomfortable, or email the organizers. Nothing may get done about it, so be prepared for that. No one forced you to go to an event, and no one will force you to stay on one. You can leave at any time.

Overall, just have fun
I assume that everyone who joined this group wants to have fun.  If that is what you're looking for, this group is for you!  I am aware that not all groups are for everyone, so please don't take any offense to the above statements.  They are not intended to discourage anyone from joining.  We are all adults, so let's enjoy ourselves!

results.description:
From the annual chaos of National Novel Writing Month [NaNoWriMo]:  http://nanowrimo.org/, a small number of novelists banded together to discuss their craft and share their insights. Shortly after, it was decided that having such a resource was, not just helpful, but integral for motivation, creativity, and the editorial process of crafting a novel.


Thusly, the Silver Spring Novelist group was born. Our goal is to form a community of local novelists to support and encourage one another. Our purpose is to present a sponsored venue for that to occur. Our mission is to act as a resource for our fellow writers, offering: places for writers to write amongst their own kind, helpful discussions about the elements of noveling, and critique partners to help move your novel to the next level. All of these will be available through the monthly meetups for members to attend.


We are seeking novelist from all tiers of expertise and accepting applications, whether just starting out or authored several published novels. We only expect your writing and your novel is important to you. The MeetUp is set to 'private' as a precautionary measure to prevent not-yet-copyrighted material from being viewed publicly.  


If you’re a writer but not a novelist, or you’re a novelist that is looking for something a more informal, we suggest you look at our parent Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/SilverSpringWritersGroup/. It’s a wonderful group of writers of all types: fiction, non-fiction, blogs, script, comics, etc; one that many of the people in this Novelist Group share membership.
results.name: Silver Spring Novelists

results.description:
The Maryland chapter of the Business Executives Networking Group (BENG) is an organization of mid to senior level professionals in all business disciplines with over ten (10) years of business experience. It is an opportunity to facilitate your job search, improve your networking skills and find emotional support. Employed executives are also encouraged to attend.

Our "tag" line, is Members Helping Members and that says it all!

Past attendees have come from the financial management, information technology, legal, manufacturing, engineering, transportation, logistics, distribution and general management industries.

We actively seek new members from all disciplines.

BENG provides its members with:
  1. A supportive atmosphere of high-value, face-to-face networking opportunities
  2. Relevant professional contacts for the unemployed, employed and self-employed
  3. An emotionally supportive environment for those in career transition
  4. Education and assistance for those members desiring to build, maintain or expand their professional  network

Networking meetings provide members with an opportunity to sharpen their networking skills, meet peers from various disciplines and share business opportunities and job leads.

results.description:
Welcome back returning and new Beach Bums!  I'm expecting this year to be even better than last year with a few minor changes.  More beach and outdoor activities and men in House II (separate Meetup).  All Beach Bums must have at least 3 of the following items...a bike, a boat (be it a yacht or a kayak), jet ski, surf board, boogie board, swimming suit or trunks and a rockin' attitude!  No exceptions!

<br>

<br>

We are a group of active, easy-going, professional women ready to share a beach retreat in order to experience new feats, fun and friendship with other like-minded women for the summer. Are you a beach lover, have you always wanted a summer get-away and never had the money or the time to stay in a summer share or now that you do have the time and money you find out all the houses are filled with drunk frat boys?

If you are in your 30's or 40's, positive, smart, mature, young at heart, community oriented, professional, can go with the flow, not clique-ish and don't feel entitled to disregard people, then you are perfect. Let's leave work and the DMV behind, hit the Bay Bridge and head to the beach a few weekends of this coming summer starting May 29th 2015. 

 We'll share a house, experience exciting adventures - biking, SUP'ing, kayaking, swimming, fishing and day trips to near by beaches  - Ocean City, Assateague, Chinconteague, Cape May, Wildwood, etc.  We'll spend time basking in the sun, have cook outs, beach picnics and visit the local vineyards with new friends.

Current photo and full completion of questionnaire required, "YES" or "NO" answer to everything is not acceptable, we want to get to know you better before we share a house together!

This Meetup will have several meet and greets prior to the season start for those interested in knowing more about Women on the Go-Go.  Some may decide this is not the right time others will decide this is not the right group.  We want everyone to make the best decision for their circumstances, sharing a house full of women is a big commitment, our goal is to continue to have great stress-free harmonious summer at the beach.  For immediate group info, visit the PAGES and PHOTOS tabs.

This is a Group Share, it is Not a rental.  It is a home that is shared by a group for the summer.   This group is for the summer of 2015 and is for women and men interested in staying active while enjoying the Salt Life!
results.name: Women on the Go-Go: 2015 Summer Beach House Share

results.description:
HAFEZ: "A Poet for Poets": This group is devoted to sharing the wisdom of the profound Persian Poet: HAFEZ of Shiraz. (While we read the poems in Persian, they are immediately translated, and the discussions around them are in English - in other words, the group is open to all!) 

Hafez is an unrivaled  spiritual master-poet whose mysticism has continued to win over hearts since the 14th century. The material's beauty and transcendence lends itself to "never getting old" with people regularly turning to Hafez's words for guidance. 

HAFEZ's devotees span the globe: from India to the US, from Germany to Australia. Goethe and Nietzche  worshiped Hafez - Goethe went so far as  calling Hafez his "celestial friend." Meher Baba was devoted to Hafez. Inayat Khan, who introduced Sufism to the West, revered the man. And Ralph Waldo Emerson waxed lyrical about Hafez, calling him "a poet for poets." I taught a private weekend class on HAFEZ for 5 years, and have drawn from that experience in designing these monthly gatherings. They should  help us to slowly enter the world of a profound and wise mystic and poet. 

Monthly Gatherings: Some months will be focussed on certain themes ("Love", "Benevolence", "the Magi" etc.) and other months' will focused on a single poem. The meetings are limited to 8 members, and will take place at one of our area's many locations offering delicious Persian cuisine.  In the company of friends and delectable food, this should be a good way to nourish our souls and our bellies at the same time!

Come with an open heart - an accessible "heart" is a key ingredient to experiencing Hafez. And of course, come with a healthy appetite. Hafez was a fan of experiencing the divine here on earth - and nourishing our sense, in this case, our tastebuds, are part of the experience of these gatherings! 

Link to a feature on the Hafez class I used to teach:

http://www.paaia.org/CMS/teaching-the-divan-of-hafez-one-ghazal-a-week.aspx

Afsaneh
results.name: Learning from HAFEZ in MD, VA + DC

I received an email not to long after joining saying that someone else needed to step in an be the organizer or the site was gonna close down.....so I jumped in, to help keep it alive. I ....by no means can fill Chantel's shoes, she has done great things here. I can only hope to be able to be there for all my new friends as much as needed. I come from an Activities Director back round so I will do my best to keep everyone involved.

I am open to suggestions for any events/activities....

Some of the things I want to plan are.............

weekly coffee meet ups, bowling, mini golf, BYOB painting classes, board game nights, horseback riding, indoor rock climbing. ....etc....lots more... I am looking into as we speak.

check out www.groupon.com for deals for a lot of these activities, like mini getaways (hint hint)

What N.Y.A.S.G. Should Strive to Be:

• A safe place to express yourself through words, art, music etc.

• Weekly meetings to touch base and work on either individual, group projects or just chat and vent.

• Monthly or bi-monthly take a trips to a galleries, musical or movie experiences followed by a discussion and or activity.

Interactivity is the name of the game here! <br>

<br>

WE ARE IN NO WAY, SHAPE OR FORM DOCTORS. WE ARE JUST A SUPPORT GROUP GOING THROUGH A LOT IN OUR LIVES AND WANT TO GET AND OFFER HELP TO ANYONE IN NEED. ALONG THE WAY MAKE NEW FRIENDS AND ENJOY FUN ACTIVITIES.

results.description:
Meetup.com Site for all Poker Enthusiasts, and Poker Home Game Hosts. New to Meetup or Hosting please feel free to post game here. 

Want to Host a game? - I am MORE THAN HAPPY to add ANYONE as an event organizer and you can host your own game, at anytime! The more hosts available, the better this group will be. Just message me if you would like to host a game. HOST RULES: No rake, No entry-fee collection of any kind, and No minors. Hosts are not to make any money off the job of hosting a game. 

Code of Conduct - This poker group is a friendly game group (i.e. respect others and win & lose with grace. If you are a guest in someone's home, act like it. If you RSVP yes, please actually attend. If you attend, leave your non-playing friends and family at home.) Any host has the right to ask you to leave if your negative behavior warrants that, and could result in a ban from that and all game locations. Pretty much just don't be a jerk.

results.description:
This group is for those interested in participating in the creation of high quality non-profit fan films. Whether you are a just fan who wants to help expand the universe of his or her favorite science fiction or fantasy franchise or an up-and-coming professional or semiprofessional writer, actor, filmmaker, ect who wants to show the world their talent then this meet-up is for you.

The Maryland Fan Film Cooperative is dedicated to networking and organizing those interested in all levels of participation and production in such a way that we can help one another see our projects completed.  We need people interested in script writing, production planning and management, costuming, set design and construction, prop creation, digital effects, location scouting, lighting people, sound people, camera people, actors and directors.  All levels of interest and experience welcome. 

At our Meet & Greet and pitch meeting on April 5th we decided our first project will be a Star Trek fan film told through viewpoint of the crew’s personal logs. Each log will capture a crew member talking about events and relationships with other crew members from their perspective with the goal of making several short logs that link together to tell a more comprehensive story.

Join us in our upcoming meeting(s) and in the discussion section to start to get involved.

results.description:
A DC Area community of musicians with an interest in Gypsy Jazz.  Since starting this group I have met many musicians who love this type of music.  Many of them had attempted to play this style years ago but stopped because they could not find others to play Gypsy Jazz with.  If that describes you or if you just recently got the bug to play Gypsy Jazz, then this group is for you.

We have weekly jams on most Monday night of the year.  The Monday night Jams are located at either the VFW in Takoma Park or at the Brookmont Church in Bethesda.  Recently we have been experimenting with a monthly Sunday afternoon jam.
results.name: Gypsy Jazz DC Area Meetup

results.description: Calling all Audi owners to join our recently started District Audi Club! We not only own Audi's but we love them....so, getting Audi owners of the area together to discuss their experiences, share stories, do activities with our Audi's in the area such as short road trips, scenic drives, and basically have fun! We are a new groups so we need new members to stir the group and grow. Please, join! I looked around on Meetup and could not find an Exclusive Audi club, but I know there are many Audi owners in the area...so, let's bring it together and let the shenanigans begin!

results.description: Let's get together and walk in and around Patterson Park. Walking is great exercise. Plus being outdoors, in an amazing park, and meeting new neighbors is a great way to start/end the day. I hope to have at least two walk groups a week and other members can join as leads and host other walk groups at other times (message me if you're interested in leading walks during other days/times).  I started two polls to try and find days and times that work for the group.

topics.name: Single Travelers looking to share expenses

results.description:
If you've ever dreamed of seeing the country/world, but: 

•  Needed to budget your leave

•  Preferred to pay over time

• Wanted to get to know your travel companions before taking the plunge

• Wished for a travel itinerary that maximized your time & $$

• Wondered if you'd ever find a professional, well-run, active group of like-minded individuals..

WELCOME!!  

This group will hold regular meet-ups both to plan travel, and simply stay connected.   Local meets may include "virtual travel" (cinematic events filmed in exotic locales), planning meetings at member homes and/or sampling world wines & cuisine at local eateries, among other things. 

Every now and then, we'll throw in the odd trip-of-a-lifetime opportunity lasting a week or more.   Trips may sometimes be priced at the SINGLE RATE (worst case scenario), with a price reduction, if applicable, only when roommate pairs are identified and both have completed deposit.   It's vitally important that members commit to attending at least two local Meet & Greets or one short-stay trip each year.  

Join us and start traveling - TODAY! :-)
results.name: World In A Weekend Travel & More

results.description: You’re invited to join our Saturday morning, beginners group ride starting from and ending at our Baltimore, Performance Bicycle store. The ride is for beginners and those getting back on the saddle. The average pace will be between 10 and 14 miles per hour and the ride will last approximately one hour. We’ll explore some of the local bike paths available to you and experience some residential riding as well. The ride leaves the store every Saturday morning, 9:00 am and is a “No Rider Left Behind” ride. Come out and join our ride leaders, for some fun outdoors.

topics.name: EFT for Amplifying The Law of Attraction
Learn to do Emotional Freedom Technique: EFT

results.description:
Calling all people interested in improving their life using a simple, easy to learn tool that brings fast results. I'll teach you how to use it, we'll do it together and you'll also be able to use it on your own.
EFT is gentle and practical technique that combines psychology and tapping on some points of the traditional Chinese energy meridians.
EFT is for YOU if YOU WANT TO:
-Enjoy good health, high energy levels and wellness.
-Reduce or even completely eliminate your body pain fast.
-Create new and better relationships.
-Improve your life at work.
-Get rid of stress and other negative emotions fast.
Do you feel afraid, anxious, inadequate, heartbroken, discouraged, uncertain or similar? Join my group and you'll be blown away with the results!
We shall use EFT on specific issues upon attendees request and/or issues that I'll propose. AND I love movement and mind-body-soul connections, so at our meetups I'll sometimes propose a specific movement that goes along well with what we are doing and helps us sensing the changes deep into our body.

Looking forward to do a lot of Tapping with you!

Paola
results.name: EFT - TAPPING in Chevy Chase

results.description:
Plant Spirit Yoga is a group for nature lovers and yoga adventurers to come together.  Our group features a variety of activities and classes that blend the study and practices of herbal medicine and yoga.

Activities include:

Plant Spirit Yoga Class - A class that features a short teaching on a single plant and a yoga practice that follows. This class is a great way to sample different plant medicines and to experience a healing yoga practice that matches the energetics of a plant.

Plant Identification Walks - Join local herbalists for walks in nature and learn about medicinal plants, how to identify them, and how to use them as food and medicine.

Kundalini Yoga Classes - Featured Kundalini Yoga classes work with current astrological signatures and planetary teachings to bring  the body and mind to a state of greater strength  and  balance. 

6-Month Weekend Herbal Course - This 6-month weekend course is for newcomers to the herbal field, dabbling herbalists, and seasoned herbies looking for community or to brush up on their skills. Over the course of one Saturday a month students will dive into the history of herbal medicine, study plant identification and botany, learn how to make herbal medicines, and study specific indications for using the plants with herbalist Ashley Litecky. Ashley is a practicing herbalist and a professional member of the American Herbalists Guild. She holds a M.S in clinical herbal medicine and is a devout student of the plants and their teachings. 


Herbal Medicine Apprenticeship Program - The herbal apprenticeship is a two year program held two Thursday evenings and one Saturday per month. The first year focuses on studying human physiology and gaining a comprehensive understanding of plant medicine, medicine making, and plant energetics. The second year is for those wishing to use herbal medicines in a clinical practice and includes making custom formulations, pulse diagnosis, and reading the tongue.
results.name: Plant Spirit Yoga Silver Spring Meetup

results.description:
The Amazing Spiral Healing Community is your Holistic Health and Wellness Center in Baltimore, MD.  We offer educational and experiential lectures, groups, classes and workshops that can assist your Hero's Quest for Physical, Mental, Emotional and Spiritual Well-Being.  We seek to be a community resource for information on how alternative, complementary and natural practices balance with traditional Western medicine and approaches to empower us to Vitality.  

We Hope to offer a wide variety of Mind/Body/Spirit approaches that can enhance and help you take charge of meeting your health and wellness goals.  These Goals can be everything from living joyfully in abundance, sucesss and prosperity, feeling balanced and healthy, losing weight, harmonizing body and mind, inspiring creativity, bringing clarity and focus to life decisions, discovering Love, enhancing communication, feeling stable and grounded, conscious living, deeply relaxing, encouraging gratitude, exercising empathy and compassion for yourself and others, taking decisive action, laughing more....

We encourage Kind and Respectful conversation and practice.  Humor is Welcome in Our Healing Community as we learn to Be our own Hero!

results.description: Rob LaPin is a true Progressive Democrat, a former Baltimore City Teacher, and US Veteran running for the Maryland House of Delegates in Baltimore, MD. Rob is the most progressive candidate in the 40th District fighting for education reform, a living wage, women's rights, marriage equality, greater gun control, and correction systems reform. To name a few. Rob believes that the term "tough on crime" should mean building a fully funded education program within Baltimore City, investing in after-school and work programs for youth, keeping recreation centers open, and protecting our open spaces. As the underdog in the race fighting against incumbent opponents who have done little in the past eight years to protect our progressive interests, supporting Rob's causes and helping him to gain votes in the district is a great way for all us to build a better, stronger, fair, and equitable Baltimore.
results.name: Rob LaPin for a Progressive Baltimore

results.description: Founded in 1992, First Place Singles (FPS) is a membership organization that was originally sponsored by the Columbia Association.  Our monthly calendar, activity flyer, membership application and other information can be found at www.firstplacesingles.org.  We are a group of single men and women from the mid-Maryland area who enjoy socializing together with other singles.  Popular activities include house parties, dances, recreational outings, games nights, happy hours, sports events, theater and special events.  Monthly General Membership and Activities Planning Meetings encourage member participation.  We have bowling, a book club and a poetry night every month and volleyball every week September through June.  Members take turns hosting different events, especially happy hours or dinners together.  Our holiday parties attract singles from many different clubs.  You are welcome to attend any of the activities on our calendar that are not marked “FPS members only.”  Be sure to RSVP so the hosts can plan, and also so they can notify you of a change or cancellation.  Dues are $25 per year, and members receive a monthly newsletter, calendar and activity updates and a discounted admission price for parties.  Only FPS members can host events on our meet-up site.  Please join in our activities and enjoy warm friendships and lively social activities with us.  We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: First place singles

Our main purpose is to meet others in our ever-growing fields of computer science, business, engineering, etc.  to exchange ideas, learn new skills, expand our social network, and most of all, have fun!

results.description:
I have made it a rule to never smoke more than one cigar at a time.

Too much of anything is bad, but too much good whiskey is barely enough.

Taking our cue from the great humorist and cigar afficionado, Mark Twain, we are a friendly, Metro Washington DC group who enjoys occasional cigars, progressive politics, humor, and good conversation.  We meet monthly in the community or host in peoples' homes for cigar sampling, drinks, dinner, and community service efforts (giving back to the community).

Cigar novice?  So are we.

Whiskey, wine, or beer enthusiast?  Great, any favorites?

Progressive thinker?  More of a liberal/progressive crowd here.  Welcome everyone  

Samuel Clemens fan? Perfect...(but not required!)

results.description: This group is for those who are seriously seeking spiritual solutions to accelerate and advance themselves toward a deeper understanding to remove the blocks to total peace, love, and forgiveness. During a typical session, those who want to share,…discuss how A Course in Miracles has made a positive change in their lives that week, we read from ACIM, and then discuss its message. A Course in Miracles is a self-study curriculum which aims to assist its readers in achieving spiritual transformation. We meet weekly as a group to support one another in our transformation. ACIM is a modern spiritual path designed as an educational program in spiritual development; its aim is to completely reverse the way we perceive the world. As part of this program, we experience a change in our perception of reality and the a core group develops into a group of like-minded people or a ‘MasterMind group’.
