topics.name: Living In The Way Of Jesus

results.description: During a March 22, 2014 Discipleship class, my assignment was to talk about Queen Esther and how I related to her life in the bible. As You recall, Haman had a hatred for the Jews, and deceptively convinced the Persian king Ahasuerus   that the Jews needed to be exterminated. A decree was passed that this extermination would occur. However, Queen Esther being a Jew herself, with the guidance from Mordecai - asked all the Jews to Fast and Pray, before any she would take any action. During the  Discussion in my class - my question was to the group and they take this scenario and apply it to any issues that are happening today. One sister stated, yes,  the Stand Your Ground Law in Florida, where it is devised to imprision and or murder African Americans here in America.  We all agreed, it is the same situation, the Susan another one of the class participants said, "We Need To Fast and Pray" My heart just leaped! And So here is the beginnings of the Stand Your Ground WITH JESUS site. To pray and fast and then act. BUT Pray and fast first to the Lord, then ACT under the power of the Holy Spirit. Please join us if you feel lead by the power of the Lord Jesus Christ.
results.name: Stand Your Ground With Jesus Meetup

results.description:
A few short months ago I started this group in Maryland  because I'm new to the area, was feeling a little lonesome and wanted to get out during the week and meet with some ladies during the day to socialize with. This has been such a wonderful experience, the women are so great and we always have a nice time.  Our members are of all different ages and backgrounds but share several things in common. They are all upbeat, pleasant and interesting.

Since we are a fairly new group we are trying out different days, times and places to meet to make sure everyone finds a time and event that fits their schedule. 

The atmosphere is very casual and super friendly. If you can't make a few meetups, that's fine.  We'll never drop a member for inactivity.  If you may be late, just let us know and we'll save you a seat. If I were to ask anything from you it would be your help by suggesting something you'd like to do.

Join us, or come to a meeting for a visit to see how this group fits you. Just let me know when you'd like to come so we make sure there's a spot for you.

Hope to see you soon,

Jeanne

results.description: Dogs of Harford/Baltimore Counties (and their owners!): Let's enjoy the beautiful natural terrain of dog friendly nature trails and dog parks of Harford/Baltimore Counties. These walks will be a fun time for all age groups of people and dogs--without taking too much time out of your day. We will hike at a pace that is good for all, stop to take photos, enjoy wildlife, and maybe let dogs swim a bit...depending on where we are. But I can't plan this group alone. I want to organize walks...but I want some fellow group leaders as well to organize/share their favorite dog past-times that they feel others may enjoy. Truly seeking to make this a group effort with group input. What a great way for dogs and their owners to make new friends...while sharing similar interests. (All size dogs are welcome! results.description: Rotaract is a Rotary-sponsored service club for young men and women ages 18 to 30. Rotaract clubs are either community or university based, and they’re sponsored by a local Rotary club. This makes them true "partners in service" and key members of the Rotary family. As one of Rotary’s most significant and fastest-growing service programs, with more than 7,000 clubs in about 163 countries and geographical areas, Rotaract has become a worldwide phenomenon. Locally, the Annapolis Rotaract Club serves the Greater Annapolis Area (including Crownsville) and all of Anne Arundel County. Serving the Internation community, Rotaract will plan volunteer service trips and hold event fundraisers for international projects. If you live or work in A.A. County, are a young professional or college student and are looking for a way to network while bettering our community and the world, join us for a meeting or check our calendar to see when and where you can find us around town. results.description:
The practice of meditation awakens the spirit of the the Nobel Warrior. This type of Warrior is one who approaches life with a calm abiding mind.  This is a mind born of inner strength, a strength that arises when the turbulence of discursive thoughts is tamed.  Through mental discipline, this Meditator has identified the causes of suffering, and those causes are rooted in our own mental formations.

By understanding these principals, and developing mental discipline,  this Meditator is empowered, empowered to lead a joyful, fearless life, empowered to avail him/herself to others, and rejoice in all the blessings of a precious life. 

Welcome to Warrior Meditation!  

 These meditation sessions are non-secular and available to anyone wishing to meditate.   All experience levels are welcome. 

Meditation sessions are coordinated by Meditation practitioners who have over 20+ years experience. In addition, these coordinators have received in depth training from meditation Masters belonging to time honored Eastern meditation lineages.  These include Chan Zen traditions and Vajrayana Buddhism practitioners (Nyingma School, Palyul Lineage).  

 Each session will consist of instruction in the meditation technique, meditation sessions of varying lengths, and a free form discussion following. This is designed for anyone who wishes to learn/practice  Calm Abiding meditation (commonly called "mindfulness meditation"). Once this technique is mastered, participants can learn the techniques of Insight Meditation as well.
results.name: Warrior Meditation In Baltimore

We have taken two major trips in the year that we have been together. New York City and a 5 Day Cruise this past April. Our upcoming travel plans include 4 Night Trip to Las Vegas in November, 4 Nights In New Orleans April 2016, Mall of America June 2016 and a 7 Day Cruise to Alaska in August 2016.

This group is small in numbers for a reason, and the reason is because "slackers" are not allowed. This group is for people who come out and participate. I will not allow anyone to join and not participate. You will be removed from the group. 

I love being the organizer of this group and I have met some amazing people who I consider my friends. 

So I will leave you with this. There is just 1 rule of engagement for this group after you have joined.

1.  You must come out and participate. Slackers will be removed immediately.

Thanks Everyone

Anthony

results.description:
You heard the weather forecast.  You knew things could get bad.  You just didn't think  they would get this bad.  Suddenly the lights go out and it sounds like a locomotive is roaring through your front door.  The next thing you know you are trapped under what used to be your home.  You can't get free and emergency resources are overwhelmed by the devestation.  Help won't be on its way for another 72 hours.  What do you do?  Who will come to your aid?  

Your neighbors might.  But will they know what to do?  Do they know how to get to you without injuring you further?  Do they know how to help in a way that won't end up injuring themselves?  What are the priorities?  What is the best way to organize those that can help?  Do they have the right tools to help?

The Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) Program educates people about disaster preparedness for hazards that may impact their area and trains them in basic disaster response skills, such as fire safety, light search and rescue, team organization, and disaster medical operations. Using the training learned in the classroom and during exercises, CERT members can assist others in their neighborhood or workplace following an event when professional responders are not immediately available to help. CERT members also are encouraged to support emergency response agencies by taking a more active role in emergency preparedness projects in their community.

Join us and learn how you can be ready.
results.name: Bowie MD CERT (Community Emergency Response Teams)

results.description: Are you ready for something different? Do you go to the gym and do the same routine every time or take the same spinning class week after week? Bored with the usual exercises? Walked on the treadmill one too many times? Your body is probably so used to what you are doing that it hasn't changed in months. The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different result - STOP THE INSANITY! Ask yourself, "Am I getting the results I want from my exercise routine?" If the answer is "no," or if you're just plain bored, our boot camp class is the solution for you! Many people strength train with weights while others do cardio or aerobics; our boot camp classes fall somewhere in between. Get the benefits of both. You'll get stronger, your cardiovascular fitness will improve, and you'll burn more calories! Watch your body change! Our boot camp classes are held indoors in our 2700 sq ft facility in Hanover, MD. This is a group class setting with a certified instructor using tools such as kettlebells, sand bags, ropes, medicine balls, suspension trainers, and other fun and different equipment! No matter if you are just starting out or if you've been working out for a while, this boot camp is for you. We accommodate all fitness levels - we guarantee you'll feel different, move different, look different and play different! This type of training is a great way to shake things up and give you a full-body workout, burn a ton of calories, and get your metabolism going. We can't give this workout enough justice in writing, you have to come and experience the fun for yourself! Visit our website: http://www.transcendfp.com Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/transcendfitnessandperformance

Dan Kennedy has hand picked Vance as the only Certified Business Adviser in the area to lead a local group of growth minded business owners, entrepreneurs and sales professionals. 

• This is NOT...

•  just another meeting (who needs that?!).

• Nor is this a "networking event", though business relationships will be a great by-product of the meeting. 

• This is also not a happy hour meeting with a willy-nilly agenda. 

Here are 3 reasons you should attend: 

1. Become part of an Exclusive Community: Our monthly MEGA Events are the glue that bring Maryland & Delaware and DC -area entrepreneurs, self-employed business people and small business owners together on a regular basis to keep learning, discovering and implementing with great confidence. 

2. This is THE PLACE: You see, our members are all driven, innovative, action-oriented, results-focused and ambitious folks. If you find it difficult to find others who “really understand you,” then this is the place for you. You will be among friends and confidants who think just like you. Entrepreneurs are the loneliest people on the planet. The rank and file just do not think like us. 

3.What we provide is NOT “another” meeting. Who wants to go to another meeting? We have fun while we network, learn and grow. Whether you are a small business owner, professional practitioner, or a sales professional, you’ll love what we provide.

results.description:
If you've ever cruised or want to cruise this is the group for you! There is no vacation less stressful than one at sea. I am an avid traveler and owner of Ladybug Cruises, an independent  franchise of Cruise Planners, an American Express company. I will NOT try to sell at the meetups. It is against Meetup policy and in fairness to the other members, any personal business will have to be done before or after group time.  

We'll plan land or cruise trips, for singles wanting to take advantage of singles specials fares or those who prefer to travel in a group for extra savings and perks, not to mention good company.  Sometimes we'll just talk about our memories or future plans.  We're just getting started, it's up to you the direction we go.  

One thing I do know for sure, after 35 years of this, everyone has a different experience on every trip.  You can be laughing at the entertainer and the folks around you just stare straight ahead. Perhaps you think the food is killer and your tablemates turn up their noses.  One of my favorite destinations is not necessarily yours.  The best way to decide on your vacation is to gather as many bits of information about what matters to you, make a short list then get the lowdown about secret specials from a travel professional and choose which comes closest to your budget.  There are great tours and all-inclusives all over the world and we have members who have had extensive travel experiences to share tips.

An advantage of my affiliation is I have materials and brochures for you which are not handed out as liberally as in the past.  Where did all the travel agencies go?!

My goal is to to create a casual friendly atmosphere where the well traveled will swap stories and provide tips for those new to the cruise world.  If you love cruising, or want to dive in, please join us! 

Again, request for brochures are welcome, simply email or message me destinations, lines or tours and I'll bring them to a meeting or mail them to you.  I have thousands, but on the off chance I don't have what you want, Ill get it for you.

Please join us, the more the merrier!
results.name: Cruise Lovers

results.description: Rise and Grow Women’s Support Group is a community of empathetic, caring and inspirational women who meet to help each other navigate through the difficult challenges of separation and divorce. We offer a non-judgmental safe haven where women can talk freely, share their emotions, thoughts and feelings and be understood by others in the group. Even though each group member is going through a tumultuous time in their lives, we pride ourselves on humor being good medicine. This is not a group that envelopes themselves in sadness or the “misery loves company” adage. We are here to pick up our bra straps and march on to our true selves. You will leave our meetings feeling supported and inspired to pick up the pieces of your life and move towards wholeness and happiness again. The Rise and Grow community supports women at any stage in the process. From contemplating divorce to post divorce. Same for women who are/were in a long term relationship and lived as a family.
results.name: Howard County Women's Divorce Support Group (Rise and Grow)

results.description:
The MOMS Club® (MOMS Offering Moms Support) is a nonprofit, international organization that provides support for parents who choose to stay at home to raise their children. We believe that staying at home to raise our children, whether part-time or full-time, is one of the most important and fulfilling jobs we will ever have. The International MOMS Club was founded in California in 1983, and today, we have over 1,000 chapters and 100,000 members nationwide.

Thank you for your interest in joining the MOMS Club® of Chevy Chase/Kensington. We are a support group for stay-at-home and part-time moms serving homes zoned to attend the following elementary schools: Chevy Chase ES, Highland ES, Oakland Terrace ES, Rock Creek Forest ES, Rock View ES, Rosemary Hills ES, and Viers Mill ES. Our club offers the opportunity to socialize with other parents and their children by joining playgroups, attending monthly meetings, and hosting or participating in a number of outings planned each month. Once a month we meet to discuss club business and listen to a variety of speakers.

We invite you to come to a monthly meeting and see what we are all about. You are allowed to attend two MOMS Club business meetings before becoming a member.

Should you be interested in joining, please contact our chapter representative at cckmomsclub@yahoo.com for an application.  The annual dues to become a member are $30.
results.name: MOMS Club of Chevy Chase/Kensington

results.description: A group with varied interests on many subjects, those who use both left AND right brain. Do you enjoy following the Mars missions and visiting a Van Gogh exhibit? Do you like Mozart and the Beatles or Bob Marley? Can you hold your own in a political debate about gun ownership, or discuss why Napoleon shouldn't have invaded Russia? Can you talk about the philosophy of religion or philosophy itself? Our Founders, like Jefferson, were Renaissance men,  mainly self-taught, and with minds that were excited by a variety of subjects as were many educated people of their day. This group is for those who aren't fixed in their own world of science or technology or the arts or writing but are fascinated by all. True Renaissance men and women.
results.name: Renaissance Men & Women of Greater DC

The only prerequisite is that you have an open mind and the willingness to both learn and share!

results.description: This group is for any LGBTQ Believer who has, or has had, a love for Christ. If you have been hurt by the church, hurt by the people of the church, hurt by mis-interpretations of the Bible, we are here to love you, lift your spirit, affirm who you are as a believer and offer you Biblical truth (what you won't get in many traditional churches)! Bishop Abrams is a Ph.D in ministry and theology and she desires to pour into all of you. This group will explore the Bible and its intersection with our sexuality and expressions of authenticity as LGBTQ Christians. Join us on this spiritual journey and create loving relationships anchored in God, filled with the Holy Spirit, and guided by the Love of Jesus Christ. We have worship services each Sunday at 1pm (that celebrates LGBTQ Christians), we have Word Wednesday Study by conference call each Wednesday at 7:30pm, and quarterly conversation sessions on Saturdays on different topics around LGBTQ and spirituality.

We are ladies of size ranging in all sizes, shapes and color. We are single, professional and maintaining our own independence. However, we want someone to share this with. Some of us are single moms, some of us are just single. Plain and simple...there is not enough time in the day, or places to go to meet the "right one" so we decided to create a place in hopes of connecting people together. Chemistry, attraction and common interest is where the magic starts. Looking pass the physical to the mental is where the real CONNECTION begins. Let's meet, date, and have fun. Only serious, mature, men and women welcome. If you are here to play games, or you aren't seriously looking for love then this may not be the meet up group for you. Thick Chicks Rock!

results.description:
Hello,
Thank you for your interest in our sisterhood. We are primarily based out of Baltimore and Harford County. We are committed to studying GOD's word; understanding GOD's word; applying it to our lives; and holding one another accountable. Before deciding to join our Meetup, please review our mission statement below and verify that our values (which are based on Christian doctrine) align with yours. Be Blessed!

Pinky Promise is a decision to honor God with your life and your body. Whether you are single or married, this is what we believe: 

We are committed to Jesus Christ, and we believe He died for our sins, rose again and reconciled us back to God. We refuse to give our bodies to anyone who hasn’t paid the price for us, which is marriage.We set the standard to keep our hearts pure before God, and not test the sexual boundaries in our relationships. We guard our heart by monitoring what we see and hear. We seek godly friendships and surround ourselves with believers and women after God's own heart We honor the marriage covenant, refusing to step outside of our marriage by emotionally or physically  cheating on our spouse. We are first submitted to Christ and then to our husband. We are committed to work through every issue that arises in our marriage.
results.name: Pinky Promise Gunpowder

results.description: If you are a female military service member/government employee or just looking for female friends outside of work, hopefully this group can grow into just that! If you find yourself surrounded by male counterparts talking about sports, beer, and women in the workplace and just want to be able to talk about your latest mall purchase or schedule a mani/pedi, I know how you feel! Baltimore/D.C. has so many unique opportunities for single people, but it can be quiet difficult to get a group of girls together for military or career-oriented women. I am in no way excluding non-military women. Any woman who is new to the area and just wants to go out for a fun night or just do girlie things, suggest away!!
results.name: Military/Govt/Civilian Single Women: From Boots to Heels ;)

results.description:
The Understand Men Baltimore PAX community (which is linked to the Understand Men DC PAX community) is dedicated to promoting peace between women and men, and to supporting fun, nurturing and satisfying relationships in all contexts. 


It is led by a group of volunteers committed to share the education of PAX Programs. Our lives have been profoundly impacted by this work, and we host free events to generate interest in PAX workshops in Washington DC, Baltimore and Northern Virginia. PAX Programs is in the business of educating women about men. PAX, the Latin word for “peace” - and also an acronym for Partnership, Adoration and Xtasy - creates peace between the sexes by providing unique and immediately useful information to women and men. Women will rediscover MEN with compassion, understanding and the ability to get what you need from them with less effort and more satisfaction for both of you. 


PAX’s flagship program -- Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women® -- is a weekend educational workshop for women, which transforms the way women relate to men. It facilitates the reconciliation many women are seeking with men and outlines the skills necessary for women to realize powerful, satisfying relationships with all of the men in their lives. The Understand Men DC/Baltimore PAX community also hosts co-ed events so men can join us and learn more about women and learn tools to experience more rewarding relationships with women. We hope to see you at an event! 

http://www.facebook.com/understandmendc 

http://www.understandmen.com 

http://www.queenscode.com
results.name: Understand Men Baltimore - PAX Community

results.description:
Are you competing or thinking of competing in Bodybuilding, Physique, or Bikini competitions? You may have some kick ass delts or some amazing abs but if you don't know how to present your self on stage none of that will really matter. TEAM Warrior Withins coaches and trainers, with years of competition experience, will work with you to perfect your onstage presence.   Our coaches include national level competitors, IFBB Pros, and special guests.

Each week we have participants ranging from seasoned competitors to brand new, just thinking about it, newbies.  Whether you are just a few weeks away from your competition, or still have months (or years) to go, we will help you prepare.

Check out our videos for a sneak peak at what our posing clinics are like. Our FREE posing clinics are open to anyone. Doesn't matter where you train or who you train with, doesn't matter what gym you belong to or don't belong to. Come out and join us 'most' Sunday mornings at 7:00am in Columbia MD at the Colosseum Gym.

http://youtu.be/dWFgtK3raVE


IMPORTANT: Come to the clinic ready to practice as if you were on stage.   This means Bikinis and shoes for women's bikini and figure competitors, and bikinis for women's physique and bodybuilding. Men's bodybuilders should wear boxer briefs or posing trunks, and men's physique should be wearing board shorts or regular shorts.   You don't have to have your actual suit, just wear something similar.   Part of the clinic is allowing the coaches to see your current condition so that we can give you advice to get you ready for your competition.

To find out more about TEAM Warrior Within visit http://TEAMWarriorWithin.com  or find us on Facebook @ http://facebook.com/TEAMWarriorWithin .
results.name: Posing Clinic - Bodybuilding, Physique & Bikini Competitors

results.description:
Lean Coffee is a structured, but agenda-less meetup. Participants gather, build an agenda, and begin talking. Conversations are directed and productive because the agenda for the meeting was democratically generated. People all get pads of post-it notes and a pen. Using a Personal Kanban, they then start to add their topics for conversation into the “to discuss” column. These can be literally whatever people want to discuss or follow a theme. Right now, we want to encourage as many unique ideas as we can. You don't need to be a coffee drink to participate.

Join our LinkedIn Group: Agile Baltimore Group.  Our group will continue to have at least one monthly Baltimore Lean Coffee meetup, as a way to deliver value to the local community.  

Register for the upcoming unconference! For just $29, you'll get a full day of learning, teaching, and sharing. breakfast, lunch, and after-party included.
results.name: Agile Baltimore Group Lean Coffee

results.description:
Hi :)

DMVs Creme of the Crop is a co-ed, multicultural group of refined people who believe in living life on 10! This group has 3 objectives: FRIENDSHIP, FUN, and all things FABULOUS! Members are called "Bujhetto" because we are not "boojie" (stuck-up & stuffy) and we DISapprove of  all things "ghetto" (LoLLL)...... We fall somewhere in the middle of those extremes, creating a happy, healthy medium ;) This group is about drawing QUALITY people..... Quality over quantity. We CONSISTENTLY have a BUNCH of downright AWESOME events, including:

-FINANCE: Homebuying, wealth-building/ savings & investment  seminars

-CULTURE: Winetasting, film festivals, museums, sip & paint events, restaurants featuring various ethnic cuisines..... I'm  really great at finding great eats on the cheap! =)

-TRAVEL: From local weekend getaways...... to road trips & international expeditions.  A film festival in Martha's Vineyard & Vegas are our first two slated trips!

-ENTERTAINMENT:  We are BIG on posting Old School parties & music ('60s- '80s), & will be hosting events regarding golfing, jazz concerts, live music, comedy shows, amusement parks, paintball, Game Nights, BBQs, picnics in the park, etc.

-HEALTH & WELLNESS: Hiking, gardening, "How to Cook Healthy  & Yummy" workshops, deals on yoga & exercise classes, etc. 

4 Simple Membership Guidelines 

1) Members MUST complete ALL FOUR of the intro questions  FIRST in order to join & have a REAL photo of themselves.  All events are set to private so in case you have an online stalker, they won't be able to find you.... not  through us at least! =)

2) Members are to attend at least 1 meetup every 3 months.  If you go missing that long, the Organizer or whomever you're close w/ in the group will have called, text, emailed, or sent out a search party for you anyway.   We're about building REAL & sustaining friendships, remember? :)

3) "No Show" Policy: 3 no shows in any 6 month period = removal from group.  PLEASE take a brief moment to update your RSVP when you realize you won't be coming. 

4) Trial membership is free.   You can pay when you join, but  we won't even start the clock until you've gotten your FREE 60-day trial period in, after which unpaid trial members will be removed.  $10 is an extremely nominal fee to be a part of a group that has these caliber of events.  Besides, we are hecka fun. I do believe coming out to 1 or 2  events in that period will ensure you'll want to officially join :) 

We are the DMV's Creme of the Crop..... In all things we do, we RISE TO THE TOP! ;)<br>
results.name: DMV's Creme of the Crop

results.description: He decidido crear este grupo porque estoy casada con un Americano, nos encanta salir pero la mayoría de las veces salimos solos, pues el es de California y yo de México, y toda nuestra familia y amigos están lejos. Este MeetUp es para Hispan@s que están casados o tienen como pareja a un americano, gringo, estadounidense o cómo ustedes le llamen! ... El punto es convivir y mezclar nuestras culturas! hablar español para que ella o el aprenda y praticar nuestro ingles con ella o el! .. Formar amistades de parejas que puedan perdurar en esta ciudad tan atareada. Salir a comer o cenar, ir a visitar los viñedos, organizar "barbecues", viajes, campamentos, ir festivales juntos, conciertos, actividades al aire libre, juntarnos a celebrar alguna importante fecha de nuestros países, organizar picnics, etc etc !! (cualquier idea es bienvenida). ****************************************************************************************************************************** I have decided to create this MeetUp because my husband and I love to go out but unfortunatley we don't have as much as friends as we would like to, he is from California, I am from Mexico, so both our families and friends are far away. This is a group for Hispanics that are married to Americans. The point of this gathering is to mix our culture and language, so he or she can learn spanish or practice their english. Create a couples friendship that can last in this busy city. We can go out for lunch and dinner, visit the vineyards, concerts, outdoor activities, barbecues, get together to celebrate an importante holiday of our countries, picnic, kayaking and biking, etc, etc! (any idea is welcome)
results.name: Latin@s with Americans (couples)

results.description:
A group dedicated to exploring and discussing topics around sex and psychology, and how we can use both to improve ourselves and others.

NOTE: This is not a dating or introductions MeetUp, nor is it group therapy. It's a gathering of mature, like-minded people who have views on:

- Male-Female Dynamics
- Sexual Taboos
- Men's Work
- Women's Empowerment
- Sacred Sexuality (Tantra, Daoism etc.)
- Reconnecting with our instinctive, animal selves
- Attraction & how to maintain it over the long term
- Sexual sticking points and how to overcome them

These sorts of groups are widespread on the west coast. It's time we had one in the north-east.


The MeetUp creator, Evan Everman, is a dating, sexuality, and attraction coach, and the author of two books - The Forty Minute Lover and The Masculine Mind.
results.name: Sex & Personal Empowerment

• Do you have an attraction for women?

This meetup is for residents of the Falkland Chase Apartments in Silver Spring, MD.

We are a pro-active group of neighbors committed to making Falkland Chase a better place to live.  We hope to engage JBG, the property owners, in working with us in this effort.

Our group is organized around discussion forums.  We invite you to participate in as many of the forums as you would like -- and to suggest new forums on issues that are important to you.

Click on the "Discussions" link above, and then on "Falkland Chase Tenants Association Discussion Forums" for the current list of discussion topics. 

Please suggest additional topics by clicking on the "Discussions" link above, and then on the "Suggested Topics" forum.

results.description:
For the past 12 months, the Umoja Group has served as the coordinator of Data Jam which was created at Georgetown University and in partnership with the Department of Education to take advantage of President Barack Obama’s “My Brother’s Keeper” Initiative (MBK). After deliberating for the past six months what direction we would like to lead this Meet-up Group in, the concept and strategy was born out of my role with N&C, Inc and the project we launched using IBM/Watson’s cognitive computing systems to develop disruptive solutions in the regulatory space. As part of my firms launching of the Digital Baltimore campaign to create a cognitive computing hub for the nation by attracting new Tech Firms to Baltimore. These firms  will boost the economy, create a new environment for developing human capital which means training people for the jobs that the tech industry will need for these firms to thrive.


Our Meet-ups for the remainder of the year will be held at the Emerging Technology Center’s Haven Campus in Baltimore. I will notify everyone this month on upcoming calendar of events, updates and Meetups. If you would like more information on our program please contact us through the messaging system.


We have partnered with Amazon Web Services to develop a series of applications through our S.T.E.M. Program. This partnership gives us access to 21 different platforms offered by AWS including cloud services and storage. Their services will allow us to build a Big Data content hub as well as create and deploy cognitive computing systems and solutions.


As initially announced at the formation of this meetup we will continue bringing together groups of practitioners, experts, researchers, students, and educators to get their input on how best to design this series of convenings such that they are impactful. We hope to convene a diverse group of stakeholders to these MBK events and would greatly appreciate your sharing this event with anyone you think might be able to provide a unique perspective or add value (be it through expertise, past experiences, or a current skillset).
results.name: My Brother's Keeper - Data Jam Meetup

topics.name: Learning How to Take Better Photos

results.description:
"Pictures that Pop" Meetup Group is perfect for those photographers wanting to learn to take better images.

The name of the group says it all - learn to make your pictures pop.

Join professional photographer Reb Orrell as he teaches on a variety of subjects including learning about your camera, composition, techniques, and digital enhancement. Meetups will be a mixture of photo safaris, seminars, workshops, and webinars.

There is no charge to join the group.  Some of the meetings are free. 

Most of the training safaris, seminars, workshops, & webinars will have a nominal fee.

The seminars, workshops, photo safaris, and hands on training are bring taught by Reb Orrell of "Pictures that Pop!", who is a full time professional photographer. He specializes in portrait, commercial, architectural, macro, HDR, & landscape photography.  He is also a Google Trusted Photographer shooting business virtual tours.  Photography is his full time profession. A teacher for several years he's taught various workshops and seminars and has led photo safaris to the Bahamas (2013) and New Mexico (2014).  A Grand Canyon safari is being planned for 2015.  

He has won over 1,500 awards in the last two years and was named the digital photographer of the year and best photograph of the year.  One of his photos was selected as the Pixoto editors "photo of the week" over 7,000 images.  Another won top photo of the day, photo of the week, and photo of the month in the landmarks category over several thousand images.

He has won image of the month once, image of the week 4 times, and image of the day 17 times.  He has been awarded Judges Best in Show three times and has won several different photo challenge contests.

Several of his images were placed in the top 5% of the year out of thousands of images in different categories. Pixoto named him one of the best photographers of the year for 2013 ranking him #18 out of 4,521 photographers in the Travel Locations category.

There are many Meetup and local photography groups to choose from.  I know, as I belong to several different groups.

This group will place its main emphasis on training - whether in the field, in the studio, or in post processing.  It's all about teaching various techniques and types of photography using different camera equipment and software.

We'll cover composition, lighting, equipment and will spend quite a bit of time on processing images using various software packages.

Here is an introductory video about some of the things we'll cover

Http://www.screencast.com/t/jBXDV2Y3

Reb Orrell

Pictures that Pop!
results.name: Pictures that Pop Photo Training: Safaris-Workshops-Webinars

results.description:
This is an invitation-only road cycling group for riders who really want to hone their skills, become better cyclists, and have fun. This is not a racing club.

If you don't have experience riding in a paceline or if you can't maintain at least 17 mph by yourself in the flat sections (18-20 in the paceline), this may not be the group for you.

Additionally, we expect members of this group to actually participate in group rides at least once every month.  Inactive members will be removed from time to time.

Safety is our first priority. All riders must wear a helmet, practice rules of the road and be able to ride steadily in a pace line. Most rides (unless otherwise specified) will be a 19-20 mph pace in the flat sections and we expect every member to respect and adhere to this.

PLEASE NOTE: Participation in any Chain Gang event implies that you have read, understand, and agree with the group’s policies.

By taking part in any Chain Gang event, you acknowledge that you realize bicycling has inherent dangers and that you assume responsibility for yourself by participating. This means you recognize and accept responsibility for your actions and understand the potential for injury and even death. We expect new riders to choose a category ride appropriate for their skills.

Per the Electronic Records and Signatures in Commerce Act, if you join this group, you agree to ALL the terms listed.
results.name: Chain Gang North

results.description:

All martial art levels of skill and those that have never trained are welcome to explore this martial art for effective self-defense or just having a good time learning about Japanese martial arts in a generally non-competitive environment.

The group curriculum will be lead by Lee, which this is his 31st year as a student of the Bujinkan and Soke Hatsumi. Lee is currently ranked Judan (10th Dan/10th Degree Black Belt). For training please bring water, relaxed or loose clothing or martial arts GI or Keikogi and a good attitude!

For questions please feel free to contact me here through Meetup.com or via email at leebusy7@gmail.com.
results.name: (LR) Bujinkan Dojo AA County Public Meetup Group

results.description:
**IMPORTANT: Please make sure you read through ALL of the description to see if this group is a fit for you, before requesting to join**

So I've been browsing through countless Meetup groups, and while they're all amazing, they weren't exactly what I was looking for (group events were too big-which can be intimidating if you don't know anyone, or not the right kind of events, not the right age group, not the right location, etc). So I decided why not make my own and see if I get any interest! If you are:

• young (in college, a recent grad, young professional, in your early 20s--most groups that are for "20s or 20s & 30s usually lean towards the older end of the spectrum-- or a kid at heart.)

• looking to meet new people &; make friends (I know almost ALL groups say this, but what I mean is your looking for real, lasting friendships)

• new to the area looking for friends (I'm from this area originally but I lived in NJ for 5 years, so I haven't really been able to get around so sometimes I consider myself new too haha.)

• looking to explore (there's TONS of things to do in the area, and I always want to do them but don't have people to go with)

• looking to travel (how many times have you looked at those Groupon or LivingSocial or Travelzoo deals and thought I WISHH but no one would go with me!? Well now maybe you can meet your travel buddy!)

• into fandoms (whether it be tv shows- Any Game of Thrones fans?- or books-Harry Potter anyone?-or anything else and want to meet others with similar interests)

• looking to check off things from your bucket list

• open minded, willing to try new things, and friendly, then this group is for you :)

What makes this group different is that I will try to host a VARIETY of events. A lot of groups I see usually do the same kind of event. In this group, I want to do a little bit of everything! Some examples:

• Happy hours

• Going out nights (to bars, lounges, clubs, etc)

• Girls night every once in a while for the ladies (sorry gentlemen, I don't have a co-host who is a guy to have a guys night haha)

• Music festivals or concerts

• Game nights

• Themed get together (based on what we're all fans of!)

• Domestic travel: how about a trip to NYC for the weekend?! Or even the beach?

• Potentially international travel? (One day, we'll get there!)

• Potlucks or picnics or bbqs OR fun in the sun (games outside since its currently summer)

• Dinner and then out on the town

• Lasertag, bowling, paintball, firing range, etc

• Whatever is on Groupon haha

• And general bonding sessions :)

If any of this interests you, this group is for you.

I'm just looking for others with similar interests of making real connections with people, wanting to make new friends to hang out with, and genuine friendships where we support and lift one another up (fostered through smaller group events when needed.)

How this will work for now--since this is a new group--is the event will happen if it meets a certain minimum of people (it would suck to plan something and no one shows up :/)

 I'm also completely open to suggestions, since this is new and I'm new at it, I'd love to hear them!

Thanks and hope you join and we meet soon
results.name: Time to Have Fun & Make Friends in the DMV!

results.description: Rotaract is a Rotary-sponsored service club for young men and women ages 18 to 30. Rotaract clubs are either community or university based, and they’re sponsored by a local Rotary club. This makes them true "partners in service" and key members of the Rotary family. As one of Rotary’s most significant and fastest-growing service programs, with more than 7,000 clubs in about 163 countries and geographical areas, Rotaract has become a worldwide phenomenon. If you live or work in Baltimore City, are a young professional or college student and are looking for a way to network while bettering our community and the world, join us for a meeting or check our calendar to join an event! Our club offers a variety of ways for 18 to 30 year olds to get involved in and around Baltimore! Meetings are the second and fourth Monday of every month at Chesapeake Systems in Hampden at 6:30 pm and are open to anyone interested in Rotaract or in our speakers.

results.description:
HR Girlfriends is a networking community for women working in or providing services to the Human Resources field, who are looking for an environment to socially and professionally collaborate. The community provides a welcoming environment, promoting authentic networking amongst open minded professionals. HR Girlfriends knows no color lines and ALL women are welcome!

New to HR/Want into HR?

HR is a large career track with several options (Benefits, Recruiting, Training, etc). Navigating the landscape of HR can be daunting, but HR Girlfriends makes it easy for you. We offer a learning path for our members that will teach you core HR skills to navigate any new role, not to mention the community of Girlfriends on hand to share their inside knowledge. You'll also learn the skills necessary to land the HR job you seek. See more information below to explore membership.  

HR Pros

I have nothing left to learn, said no smart person ever! The HR Girlfriends community is a great resource for the Girlfriend who is experienced in HR, but desires career advancement. We offer training and resources to sharpen your soft and hard skills, not to mention the community of Girlfriends on hand to share their inside knowledge. Many of our trainings are certified through HRCI & SHRM. See more information below to explore membership.  

MEMBERSHIP

Joining the HR Girlfriends meetup.com group does not constitute paid membership into the community. Membership can be explored by visiting our website at www.HRGirlfriends.com. 

Social Media

We have an active LinkedIn group that provides the support every woman in HR wants and needs. Also, check us out on Facebook and Twitter.
results.name: HR Girlfriends Wash, DC

What Do We Do? We find evidence of the paranormal and relay it to you, our audience. Common ways to capture paranormal phenomena are via photography, video or sound recording devices. Many "sightings" found on the Internet are fake and are manipulated with graphic design or video editing software. Even sound editors can be used to relay false sightings. We aren't about that! Our Mission: to provide real evidence of the paranormal. In other words, we will not use any programs to manipulate what we find. We will only relay genuine sightings.

results.description:
Join the Olney Chamber of Commerce on Tuesday Aug. 5th as we host our 21st annual National Night Out.  National Night Out is a time when our Nation draws attention to crime prevention through community involvement and anti-crime efforts.  
The event kick-off will included a police-escorted motorcade through Olney.   The event site is the Fair Hill Shopping Center...  Visitors are encouraged to walk around and take a look at the police, fire and business displays and visit with the community.  National Night Out not only brings the community together for fun and safety lessons, it is also a successful fund raiser.  Businesses donate items for popular "paper bag raffle".  All money raised goes to our event partners, the Maryland-National Capital Police, Sandy Spring and SSVFD and the Olney Police Satellite Station.

results.description: AFRICAN MATH™ is the first mental math method created on planet Earth. Ancient Black Africans created this advanced math practice for their civilized societies which flourished throughout the entire continent for thousands of years. This Ancient Math Practice has been lost for thousands of years due to the trans-atlantic slave trade, racism, colonization, slavery, segregation and apartheid. The founders of AFRICAN MATH™ have rediscovered this valuable lost treasure of humanity and are committed to reintroducing it into practice use. You are privileged to be one of the first people in recent history to learn the world's first method of math. AFRICAN MATH™

results.description: CALLING ALL ENTREPRENEURS, PRODUCT DESIGNERS, MARKETERS, STARTUPS, TECHNOLOGIST!! Welcome to the Entrepreneur's Startup Lab. We offer boutique experiences and meetups for Entrepreneurs, Technologists, and Startups. Here are some examples of what we will be providing: ENTREPRENEUR OLYMPICS: Are you the best growth hacker? Are you the craftiest Product Designer? Can you hack together the best social media marketing campaign in Baltimore? Are you really the leanest Lean Startup practitioner? Are you the best Ruby on Rails Programmer? Are you looking to establish that you are the only person to be hired for freelance work in the DMV? PROVE IT!!! The entrepreneur olympic events will be set up with real brands and businesses in the Baltimore area with real prizes. DINNERS WITH FOUNDERS: Have you ever wondered how certain Baltimore entrepreneurs achieved their success or survived a business setback. Get that in our DINNERS WITH FOUNDERS events, you will be able to have an intimate family style dinner with these founders and few other entrepreneurs to get advice on your situations or motivation for your own journey. REVERSE PITCH SESSIONS: Do you have a kick ass idea but need a tech cofounder? Do you have the tech skills but you are looking for the right opportunity to attach yourself too? Can you sell ice to a snowman, and are looking to break into a team? If you answered yes to any question, you should check out our reverse pitch session. You will be able to pitch your idea or skillset to people that may be able to partner, freelance, or help you with your goal. TECH SKILLS BOOTCAMPS: Are you afraid it is too late to learn to code, and hate expensive outsourcing? Do you want to learn how to shoot and edit those cool startup videos? Do you already know how to code and want to learn how to get in on Big Data? Quit hanging out on the sidelines and get in the game! We will have special bootcamps to learn programming languages and technical skills. You will be able to learn these skills from scratch. Our local experts are ready! SOFT SKILL BOOTCAMP: We will also be offering skills that are outside of technology. Learn how to create a sales funnel for your products, product design, how to acquire skills faster, how to write influential copy, how to recruit team members, how to deal with the emotional side of running a business, and various other workshops. MINI-HACKATHONS: We will have industry specific mini hackathons for prizes and possible funding. These mini-hackathons will consist of entreprenuers with the help and feedback of local professionals getting together to create and test products for a particular industry in one weekend. EXAMPLE: Baltimore Real Estate Market, Entrepreneurs will be briefed on the problems that local real estate agents and brokers are having. They will then be allowed to interview these professionals before starting. The professionals will then vote on what product is most useful and the winners will receive prizes or possible funding. SPEED NETWORKING: Like speed dating, but networking. DIVERSITY WORKSHOPS AND TRAINING: We recognize the importance of diversity and we will host workshops that will help diversify tech.
results.name: Entrepreneur Lab Baltimore

results.description:
Comic Sutra The Game is an awesome new party game perfect for college students and young adults. Set the timer and couples/teams take turns racing through as many funny and daring positions as possible before time runs out. There are enough cards for 5 couples to play three rounds. Whichever couple/team successfully completes the most positions wins. Contents: 84 position cards, instruction card, timer instruction card, timer. High quality cards are printed on both sides so people in the room can also see the position you are trying to complete.   You only really need a couch, a floor, and a wall to play.  Game play is not creepy or perverted.  Fully clothed and tons of fun.  

You can check out a video of game play on YouTube at
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DI_k5XWSRTc

We would like to have a few parties to demonstrate the game and spread the word.  We would like to see if we can get enough of a following to have a few meetups and we will announce them shortly.

results.description:
THE BLACK YOUNG PROFESSIONALS

A social club for young black professionals (between the ages of 22-38) with common interests, professions or activities. If you are looking to have a good time, amongst delightful individuals, this is the group for you! 

Events will include, dining, happy hours, dinner parties, game nights, holiday parties, festivals, movies, lectures, community service, etc. 

~~~~~~~~~~~No SHOW POLICY~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Since our group is all about socializing and meeting others, we want to make sure that everyone has a fair chance to attend our events. Because our events are often capped at a certain number of attendees or involve making reservations at local venues, we ask members to try their best to modify their RSVP if they are no longer able to attend an event - even if it is the day of. After two no-shows (i.e. RSVP "yes" but do not show to the event) we will ask members to kindly leave the group in order to maintain fairness with respect to everyone's time. 

We understand that unexpected circumstances arise -- that's life! Just communicate with the event host. We are willing to work with you!

Cheers to fun times, good friends, and black people!! We look forward to socializing with you - always!

Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. As a result, IT can ship faster and run the same app, unchanged, on laptops, data center VMs, and any cloud.

Learn more about Docker at http://www.docker.com

In each class there will be a brief lecture period explaining how hypnosis works by changing attitudes, beliefs, habits and perceptions.  When we go within during self hypnosis, we are accessing the subconscious mind and guiding it to remove blocks thus beginning to build upon beautiful  resources , strengths, and capabilities that were within all long.  After clearing up any questions/concerns, I will guide our group in (2) healing guided/hypnosis meditations.  I will also teach (3) powerful , quick stress busting techniques that can be used at any time.  We will learn how to go into self hypnosis and how to write your own suggestions.   Included in the class fee are handouts to take home, a "Self Hypnosis" Cd to take home and also  bottled water and snacks are provided :-) 

I am planning to offer the  Self Hypnosis class each month.  Also , as it is important to me to provide individual attention, there will be a class limit of 10 participants. 

Though we will be Healing and Learning , my intention is also for it to fun and enjoyable too :-)

Please feel free to contact me with any questions/ concerns ( mary@womenstherapeutic.com)  and please visit my website:  www.womenstherapeutic.com  for a free 'stress reduction" download.

results.description:
In business, our relationships can make and cost us in three major areas:

Time
Money and
Energy

As entrepreneurs, artists and leaders, more time, money and energy can be the difference between success and failure, so maximizing our relationships can really benefit us, but we spend little time improving them and learning how we can make the most out of them. So, let's spend time together sharing our relationship issues and possibilities, working on them and benefiting from each others' as well. We'll make real progress on our relationships and ourselves that will make a difference in our businesses and our lives.

We lose time and energy in heaps when our relationships aren't working as well as they can, whether they are professional or personal. When our relationships aren't working, we may be cranky, stressed, intimidated, disillusioned, vengeful, preoccupied and any of those things will affect our focus, resolve and our well-being. We won't be at our best and we'll wind up putting too much on ourselves.

If you look closely, you'll see just how much money your relationships are costing you because you may not be taking necessary risks, you may be shut down in a particular area, you may be lacking the support you need and unwilling to reach out to resources or potential income that could be game-changing.

For everyone in the world of startups, and that includes all creative people, like artists and musicians as well as people with private practices, like accountants and doctors, your relationships will also be vital when you start transitioning from the person with a dream to the person with a business, because things like delegation, workplace communication and collaboration become more vital than ever when you can't intimately oversee everything going on.

If your personal relationships are not energy-providing, you may take your home issues to the office in the form of not having restful sleep, arriving already frustrated, spending time on "work" that could be spent on the relationship which can lead to diminishing returns, etc. All of our relationships contribute to the person we are being for our business, whether we are putting our best foot forward and being the leaders we need to be for the success of our endeavor. If those relationships are working, it feels like all of our energies are going in the same direction, which can bring huge time and energy gains from feeling understood, supported and appreciated for who we are and for our choices.

Lastly, there's our relationships with ourselves, which couldn't be more vital. How much we trust ourselves, believe that what we're up to is valuable, feel connected to our work and feel appreciated for our work can make such a difference. This can determine whether we show up as an exciting and magnetic maverick, a tiresome techie, or just self-involved. An empowered relationship with ourselves can be a great asset at the moment(s) of truth for your business.

We'll work on all of these vital elements of our business relationships via meeting topics like: What are you Worth?, Disabling your Distractions, The Distortion of Fear, (Re)Defining Success, Building Relationships that Pay and Treating Yourself Right, to name a few.

I look forward to leading us through this process together in a way that will hopefully profit you greatly.
results.name: Master Your Business Relationships

results.description:
We are a network dedicated to providing trained martial artists with opportunities to test and refine your skills through respectful, combative sparring.

This is a group for martial artists of sound mind and good character who would like to occasionally meet up and spar with others from various styles to test and refine their skills in an energetic, supportive, sportsmanlike environment. This group is for men and women 21 and older of all fighting styles with at least 1 year of formal martial arts training under a qualified instructor (preference for those who've actively trained within the last 5 years).

This is NOT a class, training course, fitness group, or seminar. We do not meet to "cross-train" or swap techniques. This is NOT a "fight club". Brawling and showing lack of reasonable control/restraint will not be tolerated.  Maintaining the right group culture is essential.

You must officially register before you can participate in sparring.  To get started, contact a group organizer on meetup or send an email to info@martialartsexchange.com.

Sessions will be respectful ("friendly") but also combative, meaning you should expect your partner to actively engage you. We use light or medium contact (holding back power, showing restraint when partner takes hard blow, certain kinds of strikes prohibited). Mandatory protective gear and rules are set and collectively enforced. You must be willing to sign a waiver accepting full liability for injury and sole responsibility for your own protection and safety.

Spread the Word!  Like Us on FACEBOOK


Click here to go to our New York City Meetup Group
results.name: Martial Arts Exchange - DC/MD

results.description:
The mission of the Starts Within Organization is to decrease the recidivism rate by targeting incarcerated individuals and providing education and mentoring making the transition from offender to ex-offender a success.                                          

The Starts Within Organization (S.W.O.) was formed in 2011 as a non-profit organization that combats the alarming recidivism rate that hinders the growth of communities across the nation. S.W.O. was co-founded by Carlos Christian. .

At the age of 13, Carlos got involved into the drug trade which led to a 10-year prison sentence. He was incarcerated at The Marion Correctional Institution in Marion, Ohio from ages 19 to 29. During his sentence, Carlos dedicated himself to rehabilitation and being a positive role model for his community. Carlos graduated from Marion Technical College majoring in Business Management with a 3.83 GPA. In addition he successfully completed an Administrative Office Technology vocational program. Upon release Carlos had support from his friends, family, and a case manager from the halfway house he was released to. His friends and family helped him out with clothing and transportation assistance and the case manager referred him to employment after his many unsuccessful attempts. After he obtained employment, housing, and his own transportation; Carlos relocated to Columbus, Ohio where he went on to homeownership, custody of his son, and mentoring currently incarcerated individuals in penitentiaries and county jails. .

During Carlos’ prison sentence he realized that he had more examples of individuals being released from prison and returning than he had examples of individuals being released from prison and going on to lead positive lives in the community. It is because of his determination to help currently incarcerated men build the same solid foundation pre and post release as he did that S.W.O. was formed. The organization is founded on the principal that individuals must Start Within themselves and Start Within their current situations. The organization takes a holistic approach to reentry providing programming for incarcerated men, their significant other, and their children.
results.name: The Starts Within Organization Washington D.C. Chapter

results.description: Today many minorities hold stigmatizing beliefs about mental illnesses. As a result, many members of our community do not receive the help they need to cope with their illness. Because of the stigma associated with mental illness in minority communities, many suffer quietly and alone. This group provides support for those minorities who suffer from a mental illness-namely bipolar and depression. Our group is also open to families and friends of minorities with bipolar or depression. Our purpose is two-fold: 1. We aim to provide support through fellowship in a variety of ways-whether through talk sessions, a Sunday afternoon BBQ, or a volunteering event. 2. Help to raise awareness of mental illness in minority communities in an effort to erase the stigma associated with it. As an African American woman diagnosed with bipolar disorder, I have dealt with many challenges associated with the disease-from strained and broken relationships to problems on the job. After a life changing event that left me lonely and in a financial bind, I decided that I would no longer allow my illness to control my life. I was determined to fight back. And no better way is there to fight back than to join others with bipolar or depression for fun and fellowship. Please note, we are not licensed professional therapists and we do not offer or provide professional mental health services. However, we will share with you various resources that can help you on your road to recovery. So, join us, and always remember, no one should fight harder for your life than you!
results.name: Fight Back! Assoc. of Minorities w/Mental Illness (AMMI)

topics.name: Healthy Spirit Mind Body: Stress Reduction

results.description:
WHAT WE DO:
We provide a variety of mindfulness meditation experiences (classes, workshops, retreats, mentoring, one-to-one teaching, and therapy), including Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) and Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT) 8-week classes.

"As long as you are breathing, there is more right with you than there is wrong with you, no matter how ill or hopeless you may feel." - Jon Kabat-Zinn

Our mission is to help you open up to all that you are and all that you can be through mindfulness meditation.

Mindfulness:
Mindfulness is "paying attention in a particular way, on purpose, in the present moment, without judgement" - Jon Kabat-Zinn

Mindfulness is a form of meditation that stems from Buddhism and is often referred to as Insight Meditation or Vipassina Meditation. Mindfulness meditation is not just practiced on the cushion, through sitting meditation, but it is incorporated in all that we do in our daily lives, moment by moment. In mindfulness we learn to clear our minds, open our hearts, and live life fully through our bodies. Through this process we open up to a greater sense of wholeness and wellbeing within ourselves and a vast connectedness with others and the world. As we build the muscles of mindfulness meditation, we live more fully in the present moment and experience life from a greater stillness, which aids us in relating to both ourselves and others with increased clarity, compassion, calmness and creativity, and less fear, anxiety, and stress. Thirty years of research has indicated that mindfulness meditation is associated with significant decreases in stress, pain, physical and emotional distress (including depression, anxiety, grief and loss), and improvements in sleep, energy, health outcomes, and quality of life.

TEACHERS:


NANCY BRUTSCHÉ, MSN, RN, PMHCNS-BC

I am a board certified Clinical Nurse Specialist and psychotherapist with 30 years experience in health and wellness and a specialty in mood and anxiety disorders. I was trained in Cognitive Therapy through the Beck Institute of Cognitive Therapy, in Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) through the EMDR Institute, and have incorporated various theoretical frameworks in my work. I have worked with people with a variety of mental and physical conditions and of all ages. I have had a regular personal meditation practice for over 12 years and extensive training in Mindfulness Meditation, including MBSR, MBCT, Mindful Eating Conscious Living (MECL), and mindfulness in chronic illness, in death and dying, in managing anger, and more. I am a graduate of a two-year program through the Meditation Teachers Training Institute (MTTI) with teachers Tara Brach, Jonathan Foust, Hugh Byrne, and Pat Coffey. I have been incorporating mindfulness in my work for over eight years.

STAN EISENSTEIN, MSW

I have been meditating for over 25 years and have been practicing Mindfulness Meditation for over nine years, including numerous 7 day silent meditation retreats. I have trained in MBSR with Jon Kabat-Zinn and Saki Santorelli, as well as with Nancy Brutsche. I have taught both MBSR and Mindfulness Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT) with Nancy. I am a graduate of a two-year training through the Meditation Teachers Training Institute (MTTI), with teachers Tara Brach, Jonathan Foust, Hugh Byrne, and Pat Coffey. I am involved with the Insight Meditation Community of Washington (IMCW), and I am currently teaching an open, weekly, Mindfulness Meditation class in Columbia, MD for more than 25 students a week. You can check out this weekly class and my teachings by following this link: http://www.meetup.com/Columbia-Insight-Medi... I have taught physics to high school students for 30 years and have a Masters degree in Social Work.

We Hope You Can Join Us!

topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government

results.description:
My Fellow Marylanders,

It’s time to face some unpleasant facts.  Both the State of Maryland and the United States Federal Government have become unrecognizable.  Unaccountable government, at all levels, continues to grow by leaps and bounds.  We now live in a high-tech surveillance police state.  Without the founding principles of individual freedom, our government engages in endless activities that rob us of those freedoms one regulation and law at a time.  In addition, this lack of principle promulgates foreign policy decisions that are making the world less safe, both for American's at home and abroad.  Drones and surveillance systems have become the norm and only minimal or token efforts are made to protect American's rights of privacy.

Additionally, there are targeted assassinations, kill lists, the abandonment of due process and habeas corpus, the inculcation of paranoia and fear in the population, massive snitching and entrapment industries, uncontrolled borders and uncontrolled immigration (endorsed and promoted by D.C and Annapolis), a crumbling infrastructure, a gutted industrial base, and financial bankruptcy with the ‘banksters and gangsters’ in power plundering the working and middle class.  Immorality and evil have replaced traditional values and the Bill of Rights, while extreme violence is considered 'Politics' and promoted ceaselessly as long as it supports an 'Approved' agenda.  Even our Constitutional First and Second Amendment rights are under open and sustained attack.

Sadly, most in leadership positions, of BOTH parties, are fully supportive of using their power to enrich themselves and their crony friends.  They take turns sharing the spoils of power while shutting out all those who are not a direct part of their political machine.  Marylanders have been sold out over and over again by politicians who only care about lining their own pockets.  It’s time to break up the Elitist monopoly and return America to Americans and Maryland to Marylanders.  It's time to fight for our state and our country, restoring its promise and potential to all citizens.

 Our Principles:

1. Spending money you don't have is a recipe for disaster. Thus, we believe in FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY.

2. More government is rarely the solution to a problem. Thus, we believe in LIMITED GOVERNMENT.

3. Each individual must acknowledge primary responsibility for his own well-being and that of his family. Thus, we believe in PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITY

4. Every judge and prosecutor has a duty to apply the law as it is written, not as he or she wishes it could be. Thus, we believe in THE RULE OF LAW.

 5. The people, as individuals, and as members of each state and nation should determine for themselves the laws which will govern their lives. Thus, we believe in SOVEREIGNTY.

 If you believe that Maryland is worth fighting for, and that America is worth fighting for, join us.
results.name: Maryland Tea Party

results.description:
Being a single woman in today's society is not an easy task and dating... Well, let's just say, I'd be better off explaining that over a bottle of Moscato.

After my marriage of 15 years came to an end, I found myself single but not so ready to mingle. I did not want my next relationship to end in failure but the men I gravitated to only met my requirements for the moment; not a lifetime. 

Was something wrong with me? Are all the good men gone? It took me awhile but I realized the problem wasn't them; it was me. How could I recognize a king when I had a hard time understanding that I Am Queen?

This group is for those 30+ single women who dream, hustle & love hard while waiting for their king to arrive. I truly believe a woman's picture of herself is reflected in the type of man she dates. So, who's loving you?  

Let's prepare ourselves to become better rulers of our throne. So, we can bring more than a plate to the table. 

We'll start on the journey of self-discovery while building genuine friendships in a drama free environment. You'll enjoy great conversations, fun-filled gatherings, and unique experiences all designed to make us stronger women; mind, body & soul.

Kings are highly encouraged to join us. While this is not a dating meet up group, we do recognize the importance of building healthy relationships with men without the pressure of finding "the one". Sometimes, Queens just want to have fun in the company of Kings.
results.name: Fit For A King Single Ladies Social Club of MD

results.description:
Sticky Pitch is a workshop for Marketers, Business Owners, Salespeople, Presenters, people raising money or even Public Speakers who are unhappy with their current message and wish to improve their pitch.

In this workshop we focus on the art (the form) and science (the psychology) of communication so we can improve your message by making it more powerful and memorable.

This is not like taking a communications course in school or going to a seminar about speaking or even listening to a Do It Yourself book.

What we do is teach you the formula for crafting and delivering a message that goes straight to the part of your audiences brain that makes decisions. We take a deep dive into your specific message, then break it down to its core and re-engineer it in a way that makes it easy to understand and more meaningful. Ultimately you leave the workshop with a blueprint for sticky messaging.
results.name: Sticky Pitch Workshop: Glue for your words

results.description: My Name is Cassandra Hill MA CCC-SLP, and I am a trained speech language pathologist with a B.A. and an M.A. in Speech Language Pathology. I am also a certified P-ESL (Pronouncing English as a Second Language) Instructor having completed my training with The Institute of Language & Phonology. I am also the owner of Speech Therapy Enterprises LLC wherein I work with a multitude of communication cases. There are many reasons why people want to learn the “English Pronunciation” of language. Foreign born speakers of the English language have to navigate socially and professional while living in America. For some, it is critical to speak the English language with clarity in order to obtain or keep a professional job. Enhance your telephone speaking skills or professional presentation skills. Some ESL (English as a Second Language) speakers need to reduce their accent in order to increase their income. Reduce the accent, not the pay. Learn to “Code Switch” between meeting with friends to meeting with co-workers to increase understanding. For whatever reason you’ve come to review the Bowie Accent Modification Classes/English Pronunciation announcement, it will be well worth your time. Enjoy the journey and have fun with one on one and sometimes group classes. Screenings are free! I will assess your speech &  language skills via a link at my website and you can have a consultation with me to discuss aspects of your current communication skills. Subsequent classes require a fee for services that will be well worth your investment. Payment plans are also available when needed. http://speechtherapyenterprisesllc.com/accent-reduction/

results.description:
Starting in 2015, the format will change to make this more of a supportive community for people learning about healthy food, including those just getting started.  

It is also for people further along in their journey who want to offer support, and in so doing, experience benefits themselves. 

(Note that this description is subject to change based on input from the community).

The format will change to meetings TWICE a month, with telephone support for those who want it, at least weekly. 

If you are reading this in late December 2014, dates for the first new meetings have not yet been set, but will be soon.  They will probably be on the 2nd and 4th, or the 1st and 3rd Friday evenings of the week;  stay tuned. 

We welcome peoples' involvement as Participants, Coaches, or Helpers.     Everything is free of charge, with no commercial interests, and nothing for sale.* 


PARTICIPANTS are those looking for help on their journey toward healthier food.  Most participants will be beginners, not very familiar with preparing healthy, delicious, plant-based foods or the benefits it can provide.   Most participants will be omnivores, interested in learning new recipes and trying to add something new to their diet.   Some participants may be motivated by health challenges, looking to reverse or radically improve health issues rather than just taking pills.  Many participants will be from the Park Heights neighborhood.  Participants will be open to the idea of possibly moving toward a plant-based diet. They are not required to bring food to meetings, but may do so if they wish, and may be able to receive a payment toward the cost of ingredients.   This is also for eating together, socializing, and mutual support where people can talk honestly about their challenges, barriers, and successes. 


COACHES are those who would like to offer support to participants, and should have some experience in preparing healthy, plant-based food with minimal if any salt, sugar or oil.  Prospective coaches would attend support meetings and eventually determine if they would like to join the team by serving as a coach over a period of time.  Coaches are not necessarily experts in plant-based cooking or nutrition, but have some amount of passion for helping others to move in this direction, and are able to provide helpful tips and pointers for participants.  Some coaches will be motivated by the prospect of getting support and inspiration for themselves.  If needed, coaches may be able to receive a payment toward the cost of ingredients. 

HELPERS are those who are part-way on their journey,  able to prepare some healthy plant-based food with minimal if any salt, sugar or oil, who can give some advice and encouragement to others, but are still on the path of learning.   If needed, helpers may be able to receive a payment toward the cost of ingredients. 

SUPPORT MEETINGS:  Twice a month.  We hope that most people will be regular Participants, learning more over time, with a smaller number of Coaches and Helpers.   Coaches, helpers (and Participants if they want) bring potluck dishes to share.  There is usually a presentation about nutrition or food preparation, often a guest speaker or excerpt from a video,  plenty of discussion about barriers and successes, with sharing of ideas and recipes.  *Useful kitchen items and copies of DVDs will be available at every meeting for sale at cost (no profit will be made).

"TICKETS":   Space is limited.  An invitation ("ticket") is required.   We'll have a list of invitees so there is no need to bring a paper ticket.   Send a request to attend by email WITH YOUR PHONE NUMBER and contact information and we will get back with you with the exact time and date.  Some invitations ("tickets") that are good for one or two months at a time.  


FREE CONSULTATION from Joseph A. Adams M.D. can be provided individually at support meetings, free of charge, for participants.  This is not medical advice, just coaching and nutrition information.   


INTRODUCTORY MEETINGS:   To be scheduled periodically, date, location and frequency to be determined. These will be open to the public, scheduled in or around the Park Heights area.  All are welcome, free of charge.  These are outreach meetings to inform neighbors about the Nutrition As Medicine program.  

DRAMATIC HEALTH BENEFITS:  
 For people who want to lose weight, or treat and prevent heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, cancer, and many many other health challenges.  It’s also for anyone who wants to try fabulous new plant-based recipes that are more delicious, and easy to prepare, than they ever imagined. It’s for people who like to taste a new recipe before they go to the trouble of preparing it themselves. 


Dr. Joe maintains a website of favorite recipes (www.NutritionAsMedicine.org), and can answer questions about nutrition, health, and medication. 

Just as people need support from N.A. or A.A. to overcome dependence on drugs or alcohol, people also need support to get into “recovery” from chicken wings, pizza, and the S.A.D. (Standard American Diet).   It is possible to experience a transformation, and your taste buds will change as you learn to appreciate the taste of real food.  Once people discover that healthy food is fabulous, many can completely get off some or all of their pills for diabetes, high blood pressure, and other health conditions.
results.name: Baltimore Nutrition As Medicine Education & Support Group

topics.name: Hula Hoop Exercises For The Core and More
