results.description:
Hey hoopers! Just wanted to let you all know that I will be planning out some dates for us to have some outdoor hoop jams, sorry there has been a delay in scheduling this, I promise some events will come soon!

Meet up with other hula hoop dancers, doesn't matter if its your first time picking up a hoop or you've been hooping for years, come to learn, teach and have fun! Bring your own hoop or if you don't have one don't worry I'll bring extras. 

Hooping is a very special type of dance. Moving within a circle creates a sphere of light around you, allowing energy flow and healing. Its an incredible way to heal from anxiety and let go of pain and self doubt, its litterally impossible to hoop without smiling! When you let go and allow yourself to move you will feel a connection to your body and soul. It brings us back to a sense of play, a joy we have as chilren but loose as adults, its an incredible to just have fun again! It has been such a large part of my healing path I want to bring people together to experiance the joy of hooping. 

Hoop dance is also an incredible workout, do you hate going to the gym? I do! You won't beleive how fun it is to workout with the hoop! Keep up the practice and watch your belly slim down and your arms get really toned! Did I mention cardio?!

results.description:
- About 

Skip that embarrassing one-on-one date and go out with a group that shares your good taste and interests. It’s you and your friends + him and his friends. 

- Why Group Dating

Because groups have more fun.

Blind dates are awkward. Traditional online dating? –Creepy, we know

Come to our meetup and we set you up with a group of daters for a fun and safe dating experience.

Our meetup is all about new people, new places, new ideas and new experiences. It’s the safest way out of your comfort zone. Meet other groups, find an interesting and compatible group of daters and go out in the city. Build friendships and your professional network, and maybe even update your relationship status along the way.

 - How It Works  


We organize and coordinate group dating among our members. 

Here are rules for a group formation:

 - Minimum 2 and maximum 4 members per group is allowed. 
- All group members should be the same gender. 
- One member of group should be a Group Lead who manages the group activities. 
- A member can only be a part of one group. 


- When and Where to meet  

We meet every Friday and Saturday evening. 

 - WEG2G Mobile App 
You can use WEG2G mobile App for tracking people you meet and your group activities. It is a free social site and mobile App. 

Here are 5 quick steps for organizing your group meetup via our App: 
- Go to weg2g.com (or click here) and signup via Facebook 
- Add or invite connections 
- Make a group with your friends 
- Make or join a plan 
- Meet others in groups and have fun...

results.description:
This is a group committed to transcending their own perceived limitations through self realization:  a conscious, awareness, and empowerment group.  Open mindedness and tolerance is a requirement of all members to accommodate the varying perspectives and interpretations of belief systems.

******************************************************************************************

                         

January 31, 2015

                                  HAPPY NEW YEAR 2015  - Lets Make the Most of 2015

2015 - HAPPY NEW YEAR! Get those cognitive juices flowing. Lets Get busy! 

                                                30-DAY PLANT THE SEEDS CHALLENGE

"And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth fruit in his season, his leaf also shall not wither, and whatsoever he does shall prosper." (Psalm 1:3 KJV).

                                 What will you plant and sow into your life this year!

Is your vision planted in fertile soil?  What seeds have you sown from which you expect an ABUNDANT HARVEST.   RE-POT your seeds into healthy nutrient robust soil.  Replant Vision into a RENEWED, REPLENISHED, and REFRESHED MIND that is fed daily.  Replant new seeds into a HEART THAT IS FULL, EAGER, RECEPTIVE and INSPIRED where your seed(s) can thrive and grow strong.  Replant into a SPIRIT that is HUMBLE and WILLING TO LEARN AND GROW.

 Nature abhors a vacuum. If the space is not occupied by Life-Giving substances, conducive to what you intend to grow, then it will become occupied by an overgrowth of weeds that will grow up, take over, and strangle the first shoots of your dreams as soon as the first sprouts appear?  Is your environment conducive to the conception and birth of your Vision?  Is your mental, spiritual and physical environment Dream-Ready? How committed are you to fulfilling your goals?

Join Us as we share an abundance of inspirational, motivational, and educational resources as we explore ways to create what we do want, as opposed to what we don't want, in our lives, by practicing increased awareness.  We support each other, read, listen and watch various posted videos, and discuss the pros and cons of the various disciplines,  philosophies, empowerment, and manifesting techniques in the privacy of our own homes. We attempt to maintain an online connection and conversation with each other until the next scheduled face-to-face meetup, which is once a month.  dw.


Namaste, Denise

Light, Peace & Blessings

results.description:
This is a group who indulges in Ethiopian Philosophy and politics around coffee houses. This group will be for people who value and view Ethiopian philosophy and politics combined.

Events held in this group are all about life and happiness on Planet Earth and thereafter. This Meetup group is created by ABR Partners to bring community together on the basis of Zere Zera Yacob philosophy. Zera Yacob was an Ethiopian philosopher who lived in the 15th Century. He was a contemporary of Descartes, a French philosopher who lead England and France in new way of knowledge. However, Zera Yacob's Method of knowledge of God, of Human and the duties of Man was sharply different from Descartes.

It is true that Descartes became the founder of modern philosophy of Science in which God is disclosed through intelligence whereas for Zera Yacob God is revealed through Natural Reason.There lies their difference. Yacob's Method of Natural Reason is a common sense which is equivalent to today's digital age.

The Digital Age like the Age of the Renaissance  is blooming but the communication to the Heart and the Mind is not.

This group is about Methods of Natural Reasoning in a way of cultivating citizens mindset in global world based on local community.
results.name: Washington Ethiopian Zera Yacob Philosophy and Politics

results.description:
Brush up on your sign skills with ASL Hands--Hearing and Deaf Signers. Classes every 1st & 3rd Saturday at Wheaton Library, Study Rm #3. Lessons are pre-planned with 30-mins of instruction and 90-mins of group interaction, games, and exercises. While the group is primarily beginner signers looking to progress to an intermediate stage we invite all sign levels to come learn with us. 

To promote a group of active learners and participants ASL Hands sends out recap and event newsletters, as well as posts Recap videos. To sign up for our e-newsletter(s), or catch up on previous meetups visit us at aslhandsmeetup.com.

Topic and event suggestions welcome at shanjohn89@gmail.com

MEETUP LOCATION (Wheaton Library) 
15 mins from Downtown Silver Spring
30 mins from PGCC (Largo campus) 
30 mins from Bowie Town Center 
45 mins from AACC (Arnold campus) 
50 mins from BCCC (Liberty Heights Ave)
results.name: ASL Hands

results.description:
Anyone interested in OpenStack is encouraged to join this group in order to learn more about this exciting open source cloud computing platform. Let's get together to learn about OpenStack, how it is being used, and how it is impacting the software defined economy! If you are interested in deploying Private, Community, Public and/or Hybrid clouds, this group is for you! If you are familiar with OpenStack, come give a presentation or lighting talk! The format will be informational and collaborative as we learn through presentations, social outings, install events, and hackathons. Collaboration and participation is highly encouraged and welcomed! This group is for the community and topics and direction will be driven by the community!  Topics will vary:  application development on OpenStack, management and best practices, architecture, design Updates, complimentary and enabling technologies, etc.

To learn more about OpenStack online, please take a minute to visit the foundations website: http://openstack.org/

-Chris Williams
results.name: OpenStack Baltimore

topics.name: Do You Love Stamping, Crafting, Card Making

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in Stamping and card making. All skills levels are welcome. I started this group to meet other stamping enthusiasts who would like a group they can participate in and have fun creating great cards etc.

There will be a demo at the start of each meetup which should take about 20 minutes showcasing new ideas, new tools, new techniques, etc. Most times I will have a sample "Make and take" for you that used that new tool or technique ( I will provide what you need for the Make & Take). After that, we work on our own projects that we have brought with us and just have some creative fun while getting the chance to meet others.

A generic supply list of tools you may need for the meetup are below. A clear idea of what you plan to work on will help you know what supplies you actually need. If you are like me, I pack the kitchen sink just in case....
Most common Tools:
Adhesive (Tombow, tape runners, glue dots)
paper cutter
Stamps and blocks
Stamp clearer
cardstock (card bases, mats)
decorative paper
scissors
die cutter system and dies
embossing folders and whatever system you use to run your folders thru.
punches
ribbon, twine, etc.
inkpads and sponge Daubers
markers
brads and other fasteners
pop dots
Embellishments (rhinestones,buttons,washi tape,)
embossing supplies (heat tool, embossing powder, VersaMark Pad)
Scoring tool and Bone folder
Snacks and drinks are optional (each bring their own).

We will be meeting twice per month at the Library across from Mission BBQ.

Hope to see you there! Happy Stampin!
results.name: Anne Arundel County Cre8tive Stampers

results.description: Being in Business, whether you are a startup or an established business is a means towards satisfying the many reasons you are in business. The undeniable fact of the matter is this: Being a business owner is about a life-style. It’s about building a business that will make the money to first satisfy then support your “Why’s” for becoming a business owner. Are your really doing it better than you planned? Have you reached a level of success in your Business and have plateaued? Every Business is challenged in three areas: Time, Team, & Money Time – Spending time on doing the things you want to do as the business is driving you when you should be driving the business to control your time. Team – Recruiting, Hiring, and Retaining the best staff working for your business for the right reasons. Money – Mastering the numbers of your business to clearly determine what your daily activities need to be in reaching your goals. If you are that business owner wanting to make a change in your TIME, TEAM, or MONEY, this is the MeetUp for you!
results.name: The Business Growth Corridor

results.description: Calling all Washington, DC home owners, landlords, buyers and investors to meet together on a monthly basis in Upper Northwest DC. We will learn together and break bread together. On a monthly basis, we will have experts to educate you on topics where you have found to be complex and just need to be ironed out. We are here to help. How? Buyers, are you having difficulty finding a home due to low inventory? Come learn about renovation loans? Buyers, are you confused about the various aspects of the process? We will be having a specialist for the various fields of real estate on a monthly basis to iron out this process for you. Home Owners / Landlords, do you need renovations or updates to your home and simply do not have the money? You will benefit from the workshop on the FHA 203k loan / Conventional Rehab loan. Investors, are you seeking to do a condo conversion, need to understand the fundamentals of investing, to include the laws of wholesaling in DC and flipping in DC? You will benefit from your monthly workshops as well Other topics include: 1. Understanding appraisals, home inspections, termite inspections, environmental inspections and how they impact the home buying process and home selling process ... 2. Down Payment Assistance --- What's available for you? 3. How to Purchase a Home when there is low inventory? 4. How to Prepare and Market Your Home and Get It Sold for Top Dollar? 5. Buyers and Sellers -- Do you REALLY need a Realtor? Can you buy or sell your home Yourself? 6. Landlords, can you manage your home yourself while you are living out of town? 7. Landlords, do you REALLY need the Basic Business License in DC? Come Find Out? 8. Much, much more!!!
results.name: Washington DC Real Estate ABCs for Owners, Buyers, Investors

results.description:
Do you seek guidance, healing, knowledge, balance or joy in your life? 

Then join the Spiritual Spectra Meetup Group! 

The Spiritual Spectra Meetup Group empowers those who are interested in learning and experiencing a holistic approach to wellness, seeking self-empowerment and self-transformation, exploring their spirituality, and improving their physical and mental well-being. 

The Spiritual Spectra Meetup Group provides opportunities to attend fairs, festivals, workshops, seminars, retreats, and other events with a group of positive, open-minded seekers. Some of the topics we'll explore are alternative healing arts such as Energy Healing, Aura Clearing, and Chakra balancing; Tarot Card Readings and learning the Tarot; Medium Readings, Astrology, Metaphysics; spiritual concepts; group Meditation and learning Meditation; vision and goal setting; discuss and explore the Mind/Body/Spirit connection, yoga and more. 

Most Meetups will be located in Columbia and Howard County but occasionally there will Meetups in other parts of Maryland and the Mid-Atlantic region. There will be at least two meetups per month; except during Winter months.
results.name: Spiritual Spectra - Spiritual, Emotional & Physical Wellness

results.description:
African Americans for Economic and Social Change is a grassroots, community led group based in Baltimore, Maryland. We are Black men and women from all walks of life, and we are committed to working toward building the community we wish to see.

We are a youth led group with members primarily ranging from ages 18-35. We are trans inclusive and LGBTQIA affirmative. We believe in remembering the past struggle, acknowledging our ancestors, and continuing the work that must be done to free our people.

We believe in amplifying the voices of the marginalized within our community. Our primary focus is serving youth within the community, making sure they have the resources they need to do well and excel.

"…For the master's tools will never dismantle the master's house…

They may allow us to temporarily beat him at his own game, but they will never enable us to bring about genuine change. And this fact is only threatening to those women who still define the master's house as their only source of support." ~Audre Lorde

In the spirit of our ancestors and elders Audre Lorde, Baynard Rustin, Maya Angelou, Miss Major Griffin Gracy, and so many more, we stand firm in working toward the change we wish to see. Any efforts made toward freedom cannot be successful if we do not acknowledge the multi faceted nature of the struggle. Audre Lorde has said, "There is no such thing as a single issue struggle because we do not live single issue lives."

The sole purpose of the group is to create a space for members to actively engage in culturally sensitive community service projects and programs to benefit Baltimore's youth and young adults. While we engage in community service projects, we also fight for social justice, and we work to provide educational opportunities for our people.

If you are able to work with us in organizing projects for the community, please join us!
results.name: African Americans for Economic & Social Change

About Baltimore Scala
We've organized the group to help bring together software engineers and developers from Baltimore city who are interested in the Scala programming language, and other issues related to building high-scalability web sites and applications. The meeting will also focus on the Akka toolkit and the Play framework.

Agenda for Meetups
Each meeting we'll try to find a speaker who can talk about a project or technology they're working on, and we'll discuss projects we can work on as a group. Send a message if you have specific suggestions for meeting topics, or if you would like to deliver a quick presentation on an project or research subjects.

results.description: “This is a group of open-minded and motivated individuals who are environmentally conscious and want to explore options for a healthier lifestyle by "living clean". We share information and ideas about gluten-free, GMO-free and vegan lifestyles (although you do not need to be vegan), and about the importance of decreasing the toxic load that affects our bodies. By bringing awareness and attention to how we take care of ourselves, we learn that it is possible to alleviate or eliminate many chronic illnesses. We are a caring, supportive group that shares stories, experiences, ideas and factual information about the latest findings and advances in the field of alternative medicine and nutrition. Our goal is to support one another in each of our own personal efforts to gain better health. This is an optimistic group that meets regularly in a safe, caring and nurturing environment and speaks freely, sharing our concerns, disappointments and success stories.

results.description: My wife and I started this group to connect with other LGBT parents in Anne Arundel County and the greater Annapolis Area. We are interested in building community and encouraging supportive friendships among LGBT families with school-aged children. However, LGBT parents of all ages and stages are welcome to join. We are also members of the fantastic Maryland LGBT Parent Meetup, but the sheer number of members in that group (which is wonderful!), along with the vast geographic variety of members, has not allowed us to build close friendships within our immediate community. For this group, we are interested in building connections between LGBT parents in Annapolis, Arnold, Bowie, Crofton, Davidsonville, and the greater Annapolis area. Meetup events will include events for both children and parents, as well as gatherings for parents only.

This is a group for anyone interested in Real Estate,Economy,Hard Money, Non-performing Mortgage notes,Wholesaling, rehabbing etc. All skills levels are welcome. I started this group because i have been involved in the real estate sector for over 25 years responsible for building and selling of Hundreds of homes / $ Millions worth transactions.” 

Lets Network and get the real estate market and economy back where it should be .

Summary

Entrepreneur | Dynamic Public Speaker | Thought Leader | Mentor 

Sid Hameed 

President and Founder of Brickfront Properties and Construction, LLC, Owner of Expert Real Estate Advisers Group Brokerage,and owner of Real Estate Investment Solution Group. Full Service Real Estate Investment Company


Entrepreneur |Dynamic Public Speaker |Thought Leader |Mentor

Sid Hameed is a powerful business driver whose entrepreneurial instincts and clarity of vision have carried multiple companies through rapid and continuous growth. With over 24 years of business and real estate experience that includes project management, construction management, real estate rehabbing, and investing, Sid has built and impressive portfolio of projects. At the age of 15, Sid begin working in construction and it was during this time he developed a passion for real estate and has been an unstoppable force ever since.

During the 1990’s, Sid joined Computer World Service Corporation as Vice President of Business Development and was instrumental in growing the company from a small start-up to a multi- million dollar company in a short time. The company was named by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing small businesses in the U.S. two years in a row. During his tenure with the company, he received numerous awards for leadership and business development.

After years of doing real estate part-time with great success, Sid decided that it was time to focus all his attention and efforts exclusively on his life passion. Sid founded Brickfront Properties and Expert Real Estate Advisers Group where he specializes in real estate investments and rehabbing investment properties. His most recent venture is Real Estate Investment Solutions Group, a Washington DC Metro based Real Estate Investment Firm specializing in Mortgage Notes.

For more information, visit http://www.brickfrontproperties.com, call us at (240) 764-5347 or email us at sidhameed@brickfrontproperties.com.

results.description:
Everyone should know what their money is doing. But these days, we get wrapped up in charts and fine print, and guys on TV yelling buy-sell-hold, and it’s clear that Wall Street isn’t looking out for you or me. 

InvestEd is designed to get rid of all that noise. We believe in smart money for everyone–no matter age, income or career path–we want you to have the financial means to reach your life goals. 

So we provide free, clear and straightforward financial information, that’s specific and unbiased. We’re not tied to big banks, and we’re real people with real offices in downtown Baltimore, not just a chat window or a voice on the phone. 

There’s no minimum to start, and we charge a simple .95% advisor fee–no hidden charges, no commissions, no fine print.

Please feel free to give us a call at 410-469-9532.


InvestEd

345 N. Charles St., 1st Floor, Baltimore, MD

admin@mdinvested.com

results.description:
Since I bought my first iPad in April 2010, it opened the door to the idea called 'Life Hack', basically imporving productivity in both in your work and life. I tried a local mobile device user support group for over a year and a half. Eventually, I was very frustrated and gave up. I realized that I should create my own ‘life hack for mature women’ system. 

My intention is to share the result of what I learned and am still learning after reading 30+ books and over 1000 blog posts and tried over 300 apps. This is not about ‘multi-tasking’ or mobile device overload. This is about getting more things done while decreasing anxiety and stress Finally this is about being productive at any age while keeping the balance in life with our peers.

Let's me explain what 'iTracking Party ' stands for.

1.  'i'  stands for cloud and to the extent mobile devices.   We will learn how to take advantage of cloud computing and mobile devices.  The nut shell is to be able to access your important 'unique' information wherever you are.

2.  'Tracking', the most important habit we need to creat is to track as much activity as possible.  This is where moble divices become very handy.

3.   'Party';  do you know a single biggest reason why people procasitnate? Isolation !!, Yes, if you are normal human being, it is almost impossible to do it alone.  Making new habits and stopping bad and old habits are so hard  if you do it alone.  However, if you have someone to do it together,  it becomes doable.

This is why I try to make 'local small groups'.  Then within those groups , we can work together.

Let me know if you want to start a new local group.  I will facilitate any group which have more than 2 people.
results.name: iTracking Party

results.description: Interested in reading pro-women and feminist books but don't know much about feminism itself? Good, neither do I. If the most you know about feminism is that Taylor Swift and Lena Dunham seem to be all about it, or that Aziz Ansari now understands feminism because of his new girlfriend, then this may be the book club for you. If you Googled the definition of feminism and went, oh, yeah, that makes sense, this group may appeal to you. If you generally think feminism sounds like a good idea but you don't want to be hit over the head with college textbook-style reading choices, definitely join. results.name: Jonathan's Circle:  men connecting spiritual life and sex

results.description:
We are an inclusive social homeschool cooperative focusing on field trips, family events, and interest-led classes and learning experiences.

This Group was created for the existing Mid-Maryland Homeschool Cooperative. We host a potential new member picnic before spring and fall semesters begin. If you're interested in joining our group, please apply and when we select a date for our next new member picnic, we will send you a message to join us.

What is our groups purpose?  Glad you asked!  ; P  

We choose to come together for activities, classes and adventures throughout the year.  This is a relaxed, truly cooperative, group.  There are no set requirements for hosting or for attending.  (We only ask for you to please attend if you say you are going.)  The number and kinds of events will be ever changing and ebb and flow naturally with the busy lives of our homeschooling members.  This is a platform for our members to use for fun, relaxation (did someone say Mom's Night Out?) and exploration of our worldly classroom.

Have a field trip idea?  Post it as an event and those families who like the sound of your idea will join you!  It will then be your responsibility to coordinate your event:  Collect any fees, coordinate a meeting place, inform members of any changes or information regarding venue.

But events are not limited to field trips!

Have an idea for a class or maybe a series of classes in a subject or topic?  Call the library and reserve the room to teach on one or as many occasions as you like.  Perhaps host at your home.  Those families interested in your class (that you list as an event) will join you.  You may list supplies to bring or fees for class materials.  

Feel like a last minute outing or trip to your local park?  Post it as an event!  Members can adjust their settings to receive notifications when new events are posted and they may join you.

Seasonal and holiday parties are always fun!  We hope to plan parties through the year as well.

So!  There you have it!  

Please feel free to use our forum as well as ask any member or organizer (of this Meetup page, we're all organizers) and we will be happy to help!
results.name: Mid-Maryland Homeschool Cooperative

results.description:

results.description:
From Darkness to Light (FDTL)

We are continuing our women's only (18 to 65) survivor group, From Darkness to Light. This interactive experience is lead by 2 licensed therapists who are Certified Clinical Trauma Professionals. Our 12 week structured skills-based group is tailored towards women who have experienced varying levels of victimization, loss of a loved one, intimate partner violence, rape, sexual assault, or natural disaster. This is an opportunity for women to heal and connect with individuals that have similar experiences. 

Our goal is to provide structured, interactive, and educational materials that help members move from shame, isolation, and learned helplessness to an empowered, strength-based, judgment-free view of self that will help members to facilitate healing, emotional regulation, and coping.

results.description:
A fun and supportive group for moms in the Ellicott City, MD area. This is a group for moms who live in Ellicott City, MD (generally the 21042 and 21043 area codes).  If you are within the above geographical boundaries and would like to join this group, please contact us.  

The MOMS Club® of Ellicott City, MD is a local chapter of the International MOMS (Moms Offering Moms Support) Club. We are a non-profit support group for stay-at-home moms and part-time working moms.  All moms are welcome to join but the majority of our activities take place during the weekday.  

The MOMS Club (MOMS Offering Moms Support) is an international nonprofit organization which provides support to full-time or part-time stay-at-home moms, including moms with home-based businesses. Today there are over 2,000 chapters with more than 100,000 members from across the United States. Our network of moms is here to offer support and understanding to each other through the joys and tasks of motherhood. Our club offers a wonderful opportunity to create lifetime friendships for moms and children alike. Our activities include participation in local service projects, monthly meetings (children are always welcome) and fun-filled activities for moms and children to enjoy together. All activities, outings, parties and projects are organized by volunteer moms and attended by moms and children of all ages. We would be thrilled to hear from you and look forward to meeting you and your family!

Dues are $25 per year. If you are interested please contact us!
results.name: The MOMS Club of Ellicott City

Starting with a basic structure, we can variations.Sing beautiful harmonies gain self-­‐confidence, and delight in what we can create together. This is a group for 30+ female professionals with a fondness for the geeky-side of things and want to make friends with women with similar background and interests. Are you interested in trying restaurants, breweries, bars in the DC/Baltimore suburbs? Want someone to go see the latest sci/fi-movie? Even looking for someone to binge-watch geek-worthy TV show? This group is meant for you.

Attendance Policy:

The organizers spend a lot of time planning and coordinate their schedule to attend these events.  When people RSVP and don't show up, it's frustrating, so we have a three-strike and you're out policy.  If you are a "NO SHOW" or change your RSVP within 2 hours of the start of an event more than 3 times you may be removed from the group.  

If you RSVP and are running late, please send a message via Meetup, so we know to expect you.  We understand that life doesn't always go as planned, but try to respect the time and effort of those that are coordinating these activities.

results.description: Join us on our journey to our BEST SELF. Not just a meetup, this is a MOVEMENT. A movement towards a new generation of "whole black women who are EMPOWERED in every area of their lives. Whole women make SMART decisions and know their value. We refer to ourselves as Diamonds and we are priceless! We bring out the BEST in each other! We plan events that cater to EVERY aspect of your life. We workout together, travel together, save and invest together, pray together, solve problems together. We encourage and RESPECT our sisters at all times This group will strengthen your finances, your relationships, your health and emotional well-being and your spirit. We don't plan events, we create experiences. Designed to help you grow, explore the unique and live OUTSIDE "the box". Deep, introspective and amazing!...Not for EVERYONE...only women who want to be wiser, stronger, smarter...who are bold enough to SAY...I WANT MORE. More money, more respect, more love, more self-worth, more adventures, more of ME! My best self. When you bring your best self to every situation, you have the confidence to demand MORE. We limit our group numbers and focus on growth from the INSIDE out. We want active, committed members who ADD to the warm loving supportive atmosphere that we create at our events. We will be leaving meetup soon and expanding. Going National, as we will be featured in a book that we expect to be a National best seller. We have done a documentary and a talk show and our message is clear, BLACK WOMEN WANT MORE...and we will not settle for less than all of the best that life has to offer. If the group is closed, please email me to be added to the waiting list. As inactive and non committed members are removed, new members are added. We hope to MEET you soon... Black Women Who Want more are Spiritually grounded, emotionally stable, physically fit, financially poised, intellectually enlightened, politically conscious, socially gracious, black women who want more, demand more, deserve more of all of the best that life has to offer, on our journey to our best self.....

results.description:
This Real Estate Investors Network was created to bring like minded real estate investors & creative entrepreneurs, both new and experienced, together on a regular basis so we can educate, learn and grow together as professionals. We have monthly workshops given by practitioners in that field. Weekly meetings are held with seasoned local real investors as well as live cash flow games to continue to educate, relate new ideas and network with other like minded entrepreneurs.


Whether you are just starting out in real estate investing and looking to learn, or are working on deal number one-hundred, the Prince Georges County Real Estate Investors Meetup can help you accomplish your goals all while having a ton of fun doing it. You are here because you know this is the best times to invest in real estate and you're right!



Prince Georges County Real Estate Investors Meetup members include beginner, seasoned, full, and part-time investors, accountants and attorneys, real estate agents and brokers, contractors, mortgage lenders, property appraisers and inspectors, property managers, and renovation specialists — people looking to enjoy the many benefits of the real estate industry.



We invite you to learn more about Prince Georges County Real Estate Investors Meetup, by joining us at our next General Meeting. Guests are always welcome and RSVPing is highly encouraged.
results.name: Prince Georges County Real Estate Investors Meetup
New Earth New Life Walking Meditation -DC/MD/VA/East Coast

results.description:
This is my attempt to form a Body Dysmorphic Disorder (BDD) meetup group in Baltimore. It is difficult to find a group of this nature (the closest one I found is located in Ontario, Canada). I'm not great at organizing things, but I have BDD and I think it would be therapeutic to have some sort of discussion with people who also suffer from this.


Thanks     -Sean
results.name: Baltimore Body Dysmorphic Disorder Meetup

results.description: This is a women's only group....men need not apply;).  Women over 40 near Middle River and White Marsh that enjoy life and love to laugh. I am a Pa born, now Marylander ... Lived here a long time and find it's a tough area to meet people if you were not born here. I love football, animals, dinner, wine, pot lucks, reading,travel, hiking, just about anything... Most importantly, sincere women that care about each other and can support each other during times of need. Fun times are easy... But we know, life happens and sometimes you just need a friend... Other than your significant other or husband. This is my first club...and I was informed by some of the girls that I should add a no show policy...my rookie mistake;). I know plans change and lives are busy There is usually a waiting list for these functions so please be courteous to the other women and the restaurant/venue by updating meet up or texting me. I don't want to be a meanie... But I will establish the three strikes you are out rule. It is for the respect of everyone and no one is too busy for an update message or text. Thanks, Cindy
results.name: Women Over 40 Middle River/White Marsh

results.description: I am creating a men's Compline choir to chant the ancient monastic service of Compline. This will take place on Sunday nights with a rehearsal at 7 pm, and then chanting Compline at 8 pm. Taking place at Church on the Square (on ODonnell Square in Canton), we need male singers with an interest in Gregorian Chant and an interest or experience in reading traditional four-line chant notation. No particular spiritual background is necessary. Commitment is flexible, week-by-week participation is OK. There is no expectation of religious affiliation or any sort of involvement in any worship community. This is a uniquely Christian experience, but people from all kinds of spiritual journeys have found Compline to be rewarding and enriching because of its meditative, mystical, and centering qualities. Check it out sometime.
results.name: Men's Compline Chanting Group

This group will also conduct a series of art workshops, art showings and fun creative activities. We will host a series of food workshops, tasting events, wine workshops and art events.

results.description: The names say it all, you only live once and there are places you might at least want to see once in your life time. This group has been designed to make those trips happen. We will pick some exotic destinations to travel and look for the best deals. We are looking for travel enthusiasts that are open to picking some exciting destinations. If you fit this description then this is the right group.
results.name: You only live once travel group

results.description:
THIS IS A ROLL CALL for heterosexual men who are sick of folks asking them when are they going to get married and have kids!!! The purpose of this group is to find Young at Heart, Single, Black, Working, Men without Kids 40 years and older in the DC, MD, and VA area to connect with each other and other groups of people. This non co-ed group is as private as Meetup.com will allow it to be.

[PLEASE READ ALL BEFORE CLICKING JOIN-Best read from desktop site-plus videos] Just because the men in the group currently do not have kids, it doesn’t mean the men in the group will not have wives and kids in the future. Just as, some may not want them in the future. If you’ve read this far and still have a smile on your face; hopefully, you fit all attributes and this group is for you.

Type of Events:

The group is designed so a person can find one person to roll with or grab the fellas. It’s the perfect group for someone new in town looking to make new friends who have lived in the area for a while. The type of events this group does are completely up to the male members whether that be:

• Sporting , golfing, and fishing events

• Networking, men’s fellowship, and dating and relationship discussions

• Career specific, tech, empowerment, wellness, health,  and fitness conferences

• Night life, themed night out,  single events, and live music events

• Happy hour, wine, dining out and poetry events

• Road dog for annual events, workout partners,  and mentors/mentees collaborations 

• Travel, volunteer work, and home improvement projects,

• Supporting an event, creating a team, or Whatever.   

It’s your group so you decided if want to stay in and play spades or even put on a suit and crash a party with the fellas. The goal is for trustworthy people with different personalities to come together and have fun times.

• • • • • • • 

Preference for the Men's Childfree Group:

• Never married biologically born males who have never had kids

• Ages 40-50 years young but all ages 38 and over are free to join.

• Divorced folks won't be turned away- just make sure the IRS thinks you're single (and God knows you are single)

“No kids” means no child has ever crawled around with your passed down DNA or you have never knowingly impregnated anyone in the last 10 months. It doesn’t mean the kids don’t live with you. If you click the join button, then go out and get married or impregnate somebody, you no longer fit the attributes of people in the group but the bonds you made in the group should continue in or out of the meetup. This group gives members a platform without judgment because your peers have similar stories.

Don’t Feel You Fit in this Group: <br> If you do not fit all of the listed attributes above, there are many meetups to join that don’t put you in a box so they may suit your needs better. Or, you might want to consider creating your own meetup group. However, this group will have some events inclusive to all as Society isn’t made up of the same types of people. And before you exit this page, think about one 40yr old single black male with no kids to pass on the  group URL link to. We all know at least one. 

Assistant Organizers:  If you don’t know by now, the organizer of this group is biologically a woman and will be the only known woman in the group. The organizer is looking for Male Assistant Organizers to help run the group because the organizer does not plan to create events for the group without a male event host. The only time you will probably see the organizer is when a male event host plans something with other groups.

Social Media/Articles/ Videos: 

You won’t hear from the female organizer that much but when you do she  may brighten your day by sending you information that speaks to your platform like medical ailments :-) or blogger post and youtube videos like theses to get your opinion:

• Article: ""21 Things Black Men Don't Hear Enough" http://blavity.com/21-things-black-men-need-hear/?utm_campaign=coschedule&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=Blavity&utm_content=21+Things+Black+Men+Don%27t+Hear+Often+Enough

• Article: "Childfree Men: Misunderstood and Often Maligned" http://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/complete-without-kids/201203/childfree-men-misunderstood-and-often-maligned

• Blogger’s post about Single Black Men Without Kidshttp://shakaama.blogspot.com/2012/08/black-single-men-with-no-kids-truth.html

• Article on statistics and society’s views of Men vs Women without Children  http://www.blisstree.com/2013/04/03/mental-health-well-being/mental-health/depression/childless-men-more-depressed-than-women-without-kids/

• YouTube: A Single Black Male with no children’s perspective on society’s views on finding out he has no children. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_gR3xROWH9o

•YouTube: Ask a Black Man  “Episode 1: Life of a Single Man https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2oBXk_RppY (Watch all Episodes)

YouTube:“Qualified, yet Single: Why Good Men Remain Single” https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wv_kwqGXz1g

https://youtu.be/Wv_kwqGXz1g

But never forget, your purpose in this meetup group is to bond with the unmarried guys rather than being a panelist.  Nevertheless, the single men and  no kids group does provide bachelors a platform. If everything you heard/read sounds good to you, Click the Join Button!!!

And for you ladies who have read this with questions, maybe this video will answer one question for you

https://youtu.be/4UkjPjZS1kg
results.name: Black Men: Single Without Kids Working in the DMV ~38yrs+

results.description:
Short version:  Members can meet weekly to see a film then talk about it over food and/or drinks either at a theater (usually in Baltimore) or a member's home.


Long version:

The Film Circle's mission is to offer a casual, weekly forum for people to discuss film and meet others who share this interest. We continue to schedule films weekly in the Baltimore area followed by a meal and lively and informative conversation, encouraging attendees to offer their honest critiques. Your film, venue and schedule suggestions are welcome and encouraged. We have also already hosted several private potluck screenings in organizer and member homes in Camden, Little Italy, Reisterstown, and Columbia so be on the lookout for additional options. 

As always, visiting our site will give you a snapshot of new Independent & Foreign films and classic or cult film revivals coming to town. We'll always provide linked excerpts to thought-provoking reviews, and trailers to pique your interest. Not to mention we'll continue to offer occasional FREE passes to pre-release screenings. With all that in mind, welcome and have a seat with us. In the words of Roger Ebert, "[t]he movies are like a machine that generates empathy.  It lets you understand a little bit more about different hopes, aspirations, dreams and fears. It helps us to identify with the people who are sharing this journey with us." This group's purpose is to bring together people to reflect on filmed artifacts of these journeys.
results.name: Film Circle:  A Community for Film Lovers

results.description: The Hash House Harriers (abbreviated to HHH, H3, or referred to simply as Hashing) is an international group of non-competitive running, social and drinking clubs. An event organized by a club is known as a hash or hash run, with participants calling themselves Hashers.

results.description:
The event will begin at 3pm at the DAASN office at

31 Allegheny Ave. Suite 302 in Towson, followed by a Happy Hour at Cafe Troia downstairs at 4pm.

There will be no cost except we will be accepting Toys for Tots donations.

RSVP Here

Our first speaker will be Sterling McKinley.

As an online marketing specialist, Sterling McKinley has advised businesses across the country on how to use online marketing to increase sales. He focuses on website design, search engine optimization, social, mobile & video marketing.

At our event, Sterling will discuss 2015 Online Marketing Trends and how to choose an internet marketing consultant. It is hard to believe that 2015 is right around the corner. As the weather starts to cool down, digital marketers’ brains just begin to warm up and think about the budget for the New Year. The million-dollar question is what are the best digital networks to invest into and what platforms should receive more exposure for 2015?

Our second speaker will be DAASN’s own CTO, Brad Bullard discussing how to Turn Your Website into a Rain Maker. Topics Covered Will Be: Misconceptions about having a website for your business, Make your website your top employee, Tailoring User Experience to generate revenue, Proper tactics for winning business online, Result tracking through goal completion (Google Analytics)
results.name: 2015 Marketing Trends, Turning Your Website Into A Rainmaker

results.description:
All are welcome to experience gentle, healing yoga and powerful meditations. This group is aimed at centering and balancing the mind and body. We will focus on dynamic movement that increases flexibility, stimulates the circulatory, immune and endocrine systems, and brings energy down to your core. After doing gentle stretches, poses, and breathing, The balance of the class is dedicated to meditation and relaxation methods. 

The purpose for beginning this group was to help those interested in lowering stress levels, strengthening their body, and mastering their mind. Benefits are physical, emotional and spiritual health and wellness, improved concentration, deeper rest, pain relief, and emotional balance. This group is open to beginners who have never done yoga or meditation, as well as practitioners alike. And you don't have to be extremely flexible. You also do not need a mat. Just wear comfortable clothes that allow you to move freely. 

We meet for free, Sundays at 3:00 p.m.  starting in January.  Meetings are located at 13878 Georgia Avenue in the Northgate Plaza Shopping Center.
results.name: Silver Spring Transforming Yoga/Meditation Meetup

results.description: The Baltimore-Washington C3D User Group strives to create a network that promotes the sharing of ideas and experiences among the membership in the Baltimore Washington metropolitan area. The user group is at its founding stage and is looking for C3D users of all levels who would like to increase their knowledge of the program through activities, both fun and educational, with other users.  We are looking for people who are interested in participating at all levels, from wanting to sit in the corner and listen to being a member of the Board of Directors. I started this group in hopes that everyone would no longer stay at home and social network on the internet and instead meet people face to face. No group hating here, I want all groups of people to learn from each other and just go out and have fun. I will likely start by posting events I'm going to, or get invited to every week, so I hope you all will too.

results.description:
I'm trying to start up a novice meetup for adult men's lacrosse players in Baltimore. I'm 48, played baseball in college, and am pretty lousy at lacrosse, but have come to love the game. 

Idea: Meet up at Patterson Park, some other field or in the winter months indoors, throw the ball around, and build from there. 

I will get t-shirts printed up (the organization will be sponsored thru my Fells Point church, Holy Cross, which is a good start for a lacrosse team name) to give it a semi-organized feel and get people geared up about being part of something.

 Idea: Build to the point where we can play another beginner team. Also, be active in community and do some things like stream cleanups, etc (not mandatory), so this primarily an informal lacrosse toss around, but if you're interested in doing some good, you can. It will be the first of its kind. - TF
results.name: Baltimore *Novice* Men's Lacrosse Club & Toss-Around

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x48yrSniYBE

"The Harry Potter Alliance turns fans into heroes.

An HPA Chapter uses the power of storytelling to promote important causes in any scale -- locally, globally, or both! We like to call this fan activism. Chapters are like real-life Dumbledore’s Armies (or Fellowships, or Avengers, or Knights of the Round Table -- you know, nerds with a purpose). You will have the power to celebrate your love for fiction and fantasy while also serving your community. We’re changing the world by making activism accessible through the power of story. 

Since 2005, we’ve engaged millions of fans through our work for equality, human rights, and literacy.

OUR VISION
 A creative and collaborative culture that solves the world’s problems.

OUR VALUES
 We believe in magic.
We believe that unironic enthusiasm is a renewable resource.
We know fantasy is not only an escape from our world, but an invitation to go deeper into it.
We celebrate the power of community—both online and off.
We believe that the weapon we have is love.

“We do not need magic to change the world, we carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to Imagine Better.” – J.K. Rowling"

Please join me in this Meetup if you're interested in being a leader/member of the HPA Montgomery County Chapter! Don't know if you want to be? Well if you:

* Want to change someone else's life like the Harry Potter books (or whatever other fandom close to your heart) changed yours
* Want to create lasting impact through something deeper than visiting (or simply wanting to but never getting around to it) a soup kitchen
* Want to harness the power behind books and imagination to influence change by letting your creativity loose
* Want to inspire a love of reading in others
* And many, many other things

Then this group is perfect for you! 

I hope you'll join me as we instill the values of Dumbledore's Army within our hearts to embark on many journeys for justice in life!


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KeW8ribDNQU

http://thehpalliance.org/
results.name: Harry Potter Alliance- Montgomery County Chapter

results.description:
Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion & purpose?

Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?

Have you ever felt fearful financially or emotionally when thinking on you need to make a change but feel trapped & don't know how?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, full of excitment, purpose, & a knowing that your adding value to the world & getting paid really well for it, making a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you're passionate about?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time struggle financially & emotionally knowing where we work is not who we are.

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion & hope, inspire & support members to create & share there dreams on paper so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed.

You'll become aware of the freedom on SO many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream.  You'll have the support from myself & the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the processes on how to begin your business without any risk. You'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum & desire.

What gives me the right?  I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change, am now living a life I once only dreamed of! From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other in this amazing group.

Matthew Croteau

Find out more about Matthew at www.matthewcroteau.com
results.name: Baltimore Aspiring Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Have you ever felt insecure, powerless, or like you could use a huge boost of confidence at your job, with men or women, or just in life in general?

Do you ever feel stuck, procrastinate, or go into a pattern where life kind of feels boring or frustrating?

Have you ever dreamed of living a more passionate, fulfilling life but don't know what to do next to change, or felt you just can't seem to get a break, almost like you have the worst luck?

If you answered yes to any or all of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a successful NLP graduate I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time sometimes feel stuck, like life is just passing us by, or the need for a confidence boost now!

The purpose of this group is to understand the mystery of why we feel this way and how we create these patterns, how to recognize the patterns, and finally, how to replace these patterns with amazing, positive, supportive, passionate action oriented ones!

Throughout these meet ups we'll all have the opportunity to learn in a like minded community where I'll be teaching the inside secrets and where you'll become aware of the most amazing discovery.

You'll learn why you're currently feeling the way you do & how you literally have the power to change this pattern to support your dream life. You'll literally see instant results from this new awareness, & the amazing NLP techniques, tools, and processes & you'll have the opportunity to practice in our group & outside be in touch within the community.

What gives me the right? I've spent many thousands of dollars on NLP seminars & NLP related certifications.   I finally put together some of the most powerful life changing material that creates the biggest difference in one's life while the results can be seen instantly!

Are you ready to learn the most amazing, powerful secrets to attracting your dream life now? 

Don't you deserve a dream life full of inspiration, laughter, love, passion, & deep empowering lasting connections in your life? 

Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to share these life changing secrets and look forward to meeting all who attend.

Matthew Croteau

Find out more about Matthew at www.matthewcroteau.com

of If you're in Rockville, you may also be interested in http://coderdojodc.com/
